loans.name: Labaran

texts.en:
Labaran is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Labaran has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Labaran would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Labaran can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Labaran will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Labaran is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shurajo

texts.en:
Shurajo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shurajo is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Shurajo would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shurajo will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Shurajo now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yesica es una mujer de 27 años, casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años y su negocio es la venta de trajes de novia.
Ella es amable, conversadora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en una galería de la zona central, caracterizada por tiendas de buena ropa.
Yesica es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y con su hijo que aún no está en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de vestidos de novia, actividad que inicio por impulso de sus padres que son costureros, “los vestidos de novia se utilizan una sola vez, pero todo el tiempo hay matrimonios…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las personas se casan continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de maniquíes para exponer los vestidos. Su sueño es abrir sucursales, ella desea comprar maniquíes de cuerpo entero. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yesica solicita un préstamo para comprar maniquíes de cuerpo entero para exponer vestidos de novia.
texts.en:
Yesica is 27 years old, married and has a three-year-old son. She has a business selling wedding dresses.

Yesica is friendly, chatty and very hard-working. Her business is located in a central shopping centre, known for its good clothing stores,

Yesica is dark-skinned with brown hair; she is short. Her native language is Aymara but she also speaks Spanish at her work. Yesica shares her life with her husband, who works, and her son, who is not yet of school age. The family lives in a rented room built with bricks. The family has running water, electricity and is connected to the sewage system.

Yesica has a buisness selling wedding dresses, which she started following encouragement from her parents, both dress-makers.

"Wedding dresses are used just once, but there are weddings all the time", says Yesica.

One advantage for Yesica's business is that people are always getting married; a disadvantage is that Yesica does not have mannequins to display dresses.

Yesica's dream is to open new branches. She also wants to buy full-body mannequins. This is Yesica's first loan with Emprender in the three years that she has had her business.

For the above reasons, Yesica is applying for a loan in order to buy full-body mannequins to display wedding dresses.

loans.use: to buy full-body mannequins to display wedding dresses.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene hijos independientes, y su negocio es la confección de sábanas.
Ella es emprendedora, amable y muy responsable, su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad la región de mayor industrialización, principalmente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, Situada a una altura de 437 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados.
Hilda es de tez morena, cabello corto castaño y ojos marrones obscuros, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio, su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que son independientes, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia que está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de sábanas de una plaza, plaza y media, 2 plazas y 2 plazas y media, las confecciona para vender a tiendas y otros comercios, también las confecciona a encargo, “generalmente las camas son de plaza y media y de 2 plazas, también existen de 2 plazas y media pero esas son más caras...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor y por encargo, la desventaja es la competencia con precios rebajados. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de sábanas, ella desea comprar tela por rollo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Hilda solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar sábanas de todo tamaño.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 54-year-old woman. She is married and has children who are independent. Her business is making sheets. She is enterprising, kind, and very responsible. She carries out her business in the southern part of the city, the region's most industrialized region mainly for agricultural and forestry production. It is located at a height of 437 meters above sea level, with a warm, tropical weather, and with a temperature varying during the day between 21-34 degrees Celsius.

Hilda is of dark complexion, short brown hair, and dark brown eyes. Her mother tongue is Guarani which she speaks with her family, and speaks Spanish for her business. She shares her life with her husband who works in transportation and with her children who are independent. They live in a house, a family property, that is built of brick and cement with a tin roof; it has potable water, electricity, and sewerage.

Hilda's business is the production of sheets for twin, full, queen, and king-size beds. She makes them to sell to shops and other businesses; she also makes them per order. "Generally, beds are full and queen-sized. There are also king-sized but those are more expensive ...", she says. Her business's advantage is that she sells wholesale and per order; the downside is the competition with reduced prices.

Hilda's dream is to open a sheet store. She wishes to buy fabric per roll. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in 25 years that she has carried out this occupation. It is for those reasons she is requesting a loan to buy fabric per roll for making sheets of all sizes.

loans.use: to buy fabric per roll to make sheets of all sizes.

loans.name: Noris Luz

texts.es:
Noris, es una mujer práctica, ágil, responsable, una luchadora, de 34 años de edad que tiene dos negocios, la cría y venta de cerdos y la venta de cervezas, negocio que inicio por necesidad económica, pero gracias a su negocio las cosas en su hogar han marchado muy bien, cuenta con capital para cubrir las necesidades básicas.
Noris no se conforma con lo que ha logrado hasta ahora, por ello quiere hacer énfasis en su trabajo, invirtiendo capital para crecer y tener mejores proyecciones a futuro, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecerse de cerveza y comprar porcinos para sus cocheras.
texts.en:
Noris is a practical, agile, responsible, determined woman, age 34, who runs two businesses: raising pigs and selling beer. She started the businesses out of necessity but thanks to the fact that things are going very well she has the money to cover basic needs.

But Noris is not only content with what she has achieved so far, but wants to place more emphasis on her work and invest in it to grow and have better plans for the future. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy beer and pigs for her pen.

loans.use: to buy beer, and pigs for her pen.

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. Una de las socias es la Sra. María de  años, conviviente  con hijos mayores e independientes. Hace quince años ella se dedica a la venta de animales domésticos como: pollos, patos,cuyes y conejos, ubicado  en un lugar céntrico del mercado central de la localidad. Con los ingresos de sus ventas apoya a su esposo con  los gastos de su hogar. El préstamo que solicito será invertido en la compra de jaulas para poner a sus animalitos. María es la segunda persona que está parada a lado derecho de la foto.
Agradece a los inversionistas   kiva por el apoyo recibido y confiar en ella.
texts.en:
This group is starting its second cycle. One of the members is Maria who lives with her partner. She has independent, adult children. For 15 years she has been selling domestic animals such as chickens, turkeys, guinea pigs and rabbits from a central location in the city market. With her income she is able to help her husband cover the household expenses.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of cages for the animals. In the photo Maria is the second person standing from the right. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support and trust they show in her.

loans.use: to buy cages.

loans.name: Grupo A Orillas Del Lago Group

texts.es:
José es un joven de apenas 18 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a  sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Santa Cruz La Laguna.
José (el primero del lado derecho en la fotografía) para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, trabaja como jornalero desde hace tres años, gracias a esta actividad su familia tiene todo lo necesario, él es un joven con grandes aspiraciones  en la vida, y la manera de superarse es estudiando mucho. José vive en un área  muy lejana donde la tecnología aun no llega, a pesar de todo su esfuerzo lo le ha sido posible comparar una computadora para  utilizarlo en su preparación académica, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para adquirir su computadora.
Su gran sueño es contar con esta computadora para obtener en ella más conocimiento, y llegar a ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
José is a young man aged just 18. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in a community in Santa Cruz La Laguna.

To make a living and support his family, José (on the left in the photograph) has worked as a day labourer for three years. Thanks to this work, his family have everything they need. He is a young man with big dreams for life, and he betters himself by studying a lot. José lives in a remote area technology has not yet reached. Despite all his hard work, he has been unable to buy a computer for his studies. That is why he is requesting a loan to buy his own computer.

His biggest dream is to use this computer to expand his knowledge, in order to become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesus

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer de 63 años de edad la cual se dedica a la confección de terceros, se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, simpática, honesta y servicial, lleva realizando su profesión como independiente.
Ella siempre piensa en crecer, quiere dejar un negocio próspero y rentable a su hija, por ello se empeñara en mejorar las ventas tanto como sea posible.
Consuelo quiere crecer en servicios, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar una maquina pegadora de cuellos de prendas, un nuevo servicio que le traerá buenos contratos a futuro.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 63, is a seamstress who is known as a responsible, sympathetic, honest, service oriented person who works independently.

She is always thinking of growing and making her business prosperous and profitable for her daughter. Therefore she will make every effort to improve sales as much as possible.

Consuelo wants to expand her services and is requesting a loan to buy a collar sewing machine, a new service that will bring her good contracts in the future.

loans.use: to buy a collar sewing machine.

loans.name: Jhony Arley

texts.es:
Jhony es un joven de 20 años de edad, un hombre responsable y trabajador, padre de un pequeño de tan solo 1 mes de edad, Inicio como independiente un negocio de Reciclaje, desde que estaba con su pareja se proyectaba grandes cosas, como tener una familia, una casa propia y vivir felices ahora los tres, desde la llegada de su hijo, el joven se ha puesto en la tarea de mejorar como empresario, trabajando a casi a doble jornada para generar mejores ingresos para alimentar su familia.
Para un reciclador lo más importante es tener capital de trabajo para comprar los materiales que diariamente ofrecen en su negocio, por ello este joven pensando en crecer y vender en mayores cantidades quiere solicitar un monto de dinero para tener capital de trabajo para trabajar, busca crecer en mercancía, piensa buscar mejores clientes y llevarles productos.
Su principal sueño es comprar una vivienda y vivir junto con su pareja e hijo.
texts.en:
Jhony, 20, is a responsible, hard-working young man who has a one-month-old infant boy. He started an independent recycling business and since establishing the relationship with his wife has projected great things such as forming a family, buying a house and living happily the three of them. Since his son was born, Jhony has set a goal of improving his business and working twice as hard to generate a better income to feed his family.

For a recycler the most important thing is to have work capital to buy the materials needed on a daily basis for business. Therefore since this young man thinks of growing and selling greater volumes he is requesting a loan to use as work capital to work, expand and attracting more customers to buy his products.

His main goal is to buy a house and live with his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, plastic, tin, steel and other materials.

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina es una tierna, carismática y atractiva joven de 20 años de edad, una luchadora incansable, madre cabeza de familia de una bebe de tan solo 2 años de edad, el padre, se dedica a la venta de mercancía, aunque recibe apoyo de sus padres, ella quiere ser autosuficiente, demostrar a todos que aunque es una madre muy joven tiene la madurez para aceptar lo que le depara la vida.
Lina quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar ropa americana, una línea que le está dando bastante resultado, todo el capital será para abastecerse de mercancía.
texts.en:
Lina is a tender, charismatic, attractive young woman who is 20 years old. She is a tireless warrior and head of household with a 2-year-old baby. Her father sells merchandise and although she receives help from her parents she wants to be self-sufficient. She wants to prove to everyone that although she is a very young mother she is mature enough to accept what comes her way in life.

Lina is requesting a loan to buy American clothing which is a line of goods that is giving her good results. All of the capital will be used to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of American clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 50 años de edad que dedica a la venta de alimento, es una mujer muy trabajadora que junto con su marido quien trabaja en el campo, ella es alegre, sonriente, muy simpática. Rosa tiene como objetivo mejorar las condiciones de su casa, es consciente de la edad que tiene y al no tener hijos depende de ellos mismo sea para comprar un medicamento o un alimento, por eso quieren asegurar su futuro, trabajando y ahorrando todo el capital posible, para vivir cómodamente.
Con el préstamo la cliente trabajadora 8 horas todos los días de la semana.
El dinero del préstamo será para la compra de una estufa parrilla y compra de insumos, principalmente embutidos, platos plásticos, papa, refrescos, etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and makes a living selling food. She is a very hardworking woman and has a husband who works in the countryside. She is cheerful, smiling, and very kind. 

Rosa's goal is to improve living conditions in her home. She is aware of her age and the fact that she doesn't have children to rely on to buy her medicine or food. That's why they want to secure their future, working and saving as much money as possible, in order to live comfortably.

With the loan, the client will work 8 hours every day of the week.

The money from the loan will be used to buy a grill stove and items, mainly sausages, plastic plates, potatoes, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy a grill stove and items to double her production of tamales, traditional corn dishes steamed in a leaf.

loans.name: Maryuri

texts.es: Maryuri es una mujer de 37 años de edad, que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para aumentar la producción  en su negocio de venta de tamales, su objetivo con el dinero es duplicar sus pedidos llegando a la producción semanal de 200 tamales, para ello necesita comprar un compartimento para desplazar los tamales en la moto (ver foto), también necesita un anafre ya que el que tiene esta muy viejo por último necesita comprar insumos para la preparación del producto como carne, arroz, alverja, papa, entre otros.
texts.en: Maryuri is a 37-year-old woman who is asking for a loan to increase the production in her business selling tamales. Her goal with the money is to double her orders getting to the weekly production of 200 tamales, for this she needs to purchase a container to carry the tamales on the motorcycle (see photo), she also needs a brazier since the one she has is very old, and lastly she needs to purchase supplies to prepare the product such as meat, rice, peas, potatoes, and more.

loans.use: to purchase a brazier, a container and supplies to make tamales.

loans.name: Horacio De Jesus

texts.es:
Horacio es un honorable hombre de 53 años de edad, estricto, un hombre recto, responsable dedicado a la agricultura, negocio que le da de comer a él y a su familia conformada por su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y sus 4 hijos.
Aunque es un hombre muy serio, ama de corazón a su familia y este sentimiento lo refleja en su trabajo, donde deja hasta la última gota de sudor en cada día, trabajando honestamente para llevar un alimento a la mesa.
Actualmente sus cultivos están en etapa de maduración y necesita de ciertos insumos para protegerlos y ayudarlos a madurar, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la cantidad necesaria para todo el campo, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar abonos, pesticidas, insecticidas, fungicidas y gallinaza.
Su principal sueño es comprar una vivienda fruto de su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Horacio is an honorable man, 53 years old, strict, an upright, responsible man, who works in agriculture, a business which gives food to him and his family, made up of his partner with whom he lives in common-law marriage, and their 4 children.

Although he is a very serious man, he loves his family deeply and this sentiment is seen in his work, where he leaves his last drop of sweat each day, working honestly to bring food to the table.

Currently, his crops are in the ripening stage, and he needs certain supplies to protect them and help them ripen, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to purchase the necessary quantity for the whole field, so he is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, insecticide, fungicide and hen manure.

His primary dream is to purchase a house, the fruit of his labor.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, insecticide, fungicide, and hen manure.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven de 23 años de edad, madre de una pequeña de 5 años de edad, al ser madre tan joven optó por dejar de estudiar, es una mujer humilde que busco un trabajo para alimentar a su hija.
Leidy al no encontrar trabajo, optó por convertirse en empresaria vendiendo ropa a amigos, familiares y puerta a puerta, ahora que cuenta con experiencia y clientes, se permite soñar con recuperar el tiempo perdido, quiere estudiar, ser alguien la vida, tener vivienda propia y vivir junto con su pareja y bebe.
Leidy quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ropa informal, para hombre y mujer, pensando en la temporada alta, donde ira a pueblos a probar suerte.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young woman, 23 years old, the mother of a little one, 5 years old. Being such a young mother, she decided to drop out of school. She is a humble woman who sought a job to feed her daughter.

Not finding work, Leidy decided to become a businesswoman selling clothing to friends, family, and door to door. Now that she has experience and customers, she lets herself dream of making up for the lost time, she wants to go to school, be someone in life, have her own house, and live with her partner and baby.

Leidy wants to ask for a loan to purchase casual clothing for men and women, thinking of the high season when she will go to towns to try her luck.

loans.use: to purchase casual clothing for men and women, thinking of the high season.

loans.name: Leidy Susana

texts.es:
Leidy es una madre cabeza de familia, madre de un pequeño de 13 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora, luchadora que genera el sustento para ella y su amado hijo con un negocio de venta de cosméticos y lencería por catálogo.
El sueño de esta humilde joven es crecer con su negocio, constituir un local comercial, para generar mayores ingresos que le permitan pagar la educación de sus hijos y comprar una vivienda.
Hoy la cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar productos promocionales de revista, con los cuales obtendrá un mayor beneficio económico, todo el dinero será invertido en cosméticos y lencería.
texts.en:
Leidy is a head of household. She is the mother of a 13 year old and she is an enterprising woman who is a fighter. She earns income for herself and for her beloved son with a business selling cosmetics and underwear via catalog.

This humble young woman's dream is to grow with her business, open a locale and generate more income so she can pay for her child's education and buy a home.

Today she is asking for a loan to buy catalog products that are on sale so that with them she can obtain more financial benefit. All of the money will be invested in cosmetics and underwear.

loans.use: to buy products that are on sale, especially underwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Abono para cultivo de caña y cacao, insumos para la siembre de café, venenos para los campos, riegos, son los productos por los cuales el señor José se encuentra solicitando un préstamo. Él un agricultor de 49 años de edad que toda la vida ha estado en el campo trabajando para llevar su fresco producto a la plaza, generando los recursos para el mantenimiento de su familia.
José es muy trabajador, diariamente sale a trabajar a primera hora, se esmera mucho pro mantener esos terrenos que con tanto empeño él y sus antecesores han tenido.
texts.en:
Señor José is requesting a loan to buy compost for growing sugar cane and cocoa, inputs for growing coffee, pesticides for his crops and water. He is a 49-year-old farmer who has worked the land his entire life to take his fresh produce to market, earning a living to support his family.

José is very hardworking. He goes out to work early in the morning every day, and strives to look after the land that he and his predecessors acquired through so much hard work.

loans.use: to buy compost for growing sugar cane and cocoa, inputs for growing coffee, pesticides for his crops and water.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Blanca, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajos de albañilería, tienen 3 hijos pero una ya está acompañada y sus otros 2 hijos van a la escuela.

Blanca, desde hace mucho se dedica a las labores agrícolas, cuando era pequeña le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas y cuando se acompañó se dedicó mucho más a estas actividades porque su pareja no dispone de tiempo para plantar y manejar los cultivos, es por eso que mejor deciden producirlos ellos mismos. Pero también se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral para su propio consumo, pero en poco tiempo pretenden incrementar la producción para la venta.

Blanca, pretende diversificar sus producciones y utilizar todos los subproductos de los cultivos; junto a su familia han planeado incluir la crianza de cerdos, porque tienen una pequeña instalación para mantenerlos alojados; es por eso que necesitan el préstamo para comprar dos cerdos pequeños y alimento para ellos y luego comercializarlos para obtner el mayor beneficio y seguir con la producción.

Blanca, desea tener buenas producciones en sus cultivos y disponer de subproductos para los animales de corral, pero también sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 34 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade, is partnered, and her partner works at construction jobs. They have three children, but one is already partnered and the other 2 children go to school.

For a long time, Blanca has done farm work. When she was little, she liked to help her parents with the agricultural jobs and when she became partnered, she worked a lot more in these tasks because her partner did not have the time to plant and manage the crops, and for this they decided it was better to produce them themselves. But, she also works raising small animals for their own consumption but in a short time, they plan to increase the production for sale.

Blanca plans to diversify her products and use all the derivatives of the crops, with her family she has planned to include raising pigs because they have a small structure to house them, and for this they need the loan to purchase two piglets and food for them, and later they will sell them to get more profits and continue with the production.

Blanca wants to have good production in her crops and to have derivatives for the animals, but she also dreams of improving the condition of her house.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and food for them.

loans.name: Juana Marisol

texts.es:
Juana, de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, la situación económica de los padres era precaria por lo que no le permitió continuar con su formación académica, está casada, su esposo es empleado y juntos tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos trabajan y solo uno estudia.

Juana, tiene un comedor en donde vende almuerzos y antojitos tales como: yuca frita, empanadas, panes con pollo, entre otros, el comedor lo administra desde hace cinco años y fue la necesidad de generar ingresos la que los llevó a tomar la iniciativa de poner un comedor, su horario de atención es desde las 5:30 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. y en el comedor tiene 4 empleados que le ayudan en el funcionamiento del mismo.
 
Juana, necesita el préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas y un mostrador de comida, para captar más la atención de los clientes y de esta forma atraerlos al comedor para generar mayores ingresos.

Los sueños de Juana, son hacer que el negocio siga creciendo y que los hijos sigan trabajando para que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Juana, 39 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. Her parents' economic situation was precarious, so it didn't allow her to continue with her academic training. She is married, her husband is an employee, and together they have three children of whom two work and only one goes to school.

Juana has an eatery where she sells lunches and snacks such as: fried yucca, empanadas, bread with chicken, and more. She has managed the eatery for five years and it was the necessity of generating income that brought her to take the initiative to establish an eatery. Her opening hours are from 5:30 am to 6:00 pm and in the eatery she has 4 employees who help run it.

Juana needs the loan to purchase tables, chairs and a food counter to attract the attention of the customers and, in this way, bring them to her eatery to generate more income.

Juana's dreams are to make her business continue to grow, and that her children continue working so that they have a good future.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and a food counter.

loans.name: Madelyn Vanessa

texts.es:
Madelyn, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, la situación de inseguridad que atraviesa el país fue la razón por la que sus abuelos no le permitieron seguir en la universidad, porque tenía a viajar hasta la cuidad; está soltera y vive con sus abuelos desde su infancia porque sus padres viajaron al extranjero.   

Madelyn, tiene un negocio en donde vende piñatas, dulces, flores y artículos para regalo, este negocio lo tiene desde hace cuatro años y lo aprendió gracias a su tío; este negocio lo tiene en el mercado del pueblo y el horario de atención es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

Madelyn, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para ampliar el negocio como: piñatas, flores, dulces y regalos para toda ocasión. 

Ella, espera que el negocio crezca para poder emplear a otras personas y darles la oportunidad de crecer así como ella lo está haciendo y en el futuro desea continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Madelyn is 23 years old. She has a high school education. The security situation the country is going through is the reason why her grandparents didn't allow her to continue with college, because she had to ravel to the city. She is single and has lived with her grandparents since childhood because her parents traveled abroad.

Madelyn has a business where she sells piñatas, candies, flowers and gift items. She has had this business for four years and she learned it from her uncle. She has the business in the town's market and the schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Madelyn needs the loan to buy more merchandise to expand the business, such as piñatas, flowers, candies, and gifts for all occasions.

She hopes that the business will grow so that she can employ others and give them an opportunity to grow, as she has been doing. In the future, she wants to continue with her education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to expand her business, such piñatas, flowers, candies and gifts for all occasions.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer from Guibi Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dahiru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dahiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Dahiru plans on using his additional income to build a house/renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Khusnorai

texts.ru: Эту самостоятельную и целеустремленную девушку зовут Хуснораи. Она 22 летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Хуснораи живет вместе отцом, матерью и братишкой. Пять лет назад Хуснораи начала свой маленький бизнес, чтобы помочь папе обеспечить семью. Она начала изучать профессию швеи, чтобы зарабатывать таким путем для улучшения условий жизни семьи. Хуснораи быстро освоила эту деятельность, и она сейчас хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она сейчас берет кредит, чтобы поменять швейную машинку, потому что нынешняя швейная машинка устарела. Это кредит поможет ей приобрести швейную машинку и расширить бизнес. Хуснораи обратилась к Вам за кредитом, потому что она верит в Вас, и вы ее не подводите.
texts.en:
Meet Khusnorai, 22, an independent and determined young woman from the city of Tursunzoda.  She lives with her father, mother and young brother.  She started her own small business five years ago in order to help her dad provide for the family.  She learned how to sew so that she could make enough money to improve her family's living conditions.  She quickly mastered her trade and she now does an excellent job.  

Khusnorai is taking this loan to buy a new sewing machine because the sewing machine that she's currently using is getting old.  Thanks to her loan, she will be able to buy a new machine and expand her business.  Khusnorai is turning to you for this loan because she is confident that you will help her and will not turn her down.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Wendy Sarai

texts.es:
Wendy, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer joven llena de expectativas buenas y con ganas de salir adelante, está acompañada, tiene un hijo y está muy feliz con la llegada de su nuevo bebé porque tiene 5 mese de embarazo. 

Wendy, se dedica a administrar su propia tienda de productos de primera necesidad y gracias al apoyo que recibió anteriormente con otro préstamo, su tienda mejoró mucho y desea que continué así y que mejore mucho más. 

Wendy,  necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, huevos, plátanos, café, detergente, entre otros productos para su tienda y así poder tener surtido su negocio para la época navideña y de fin de año.

Wendy, sueña con poder continuar con su negocio y obtener ganancias para tener mejores oportunidades para sus hijos y su familia.
texts.en:
Wendy is 21 years old, and is a young women full of high hopes and a desire to move forward. She has a partner, a child, and is very excited about the arrival of her next baby, because she is five months pregnant.

Wendy makes a living running her own grocery store, and thanks to the support she received from another loan in the past, her shop improved a great deal. She wants her store to continue and improve even further. 

Wendy needs a loan to buy rice, beans, eggs, bananas, coffee, detergent and other items for her store, so that it is well-stocked for Christmas and the New Year.

Wendy dreams of being able to continue running her business and making profits so that her children and her family have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, eggs, bananas, coffee, detergent and other items for her store.

loans.name: Nelson Geovany

texts.es:
Nelson es un joven que junto con su padre se dedica al cultivo de diferentes productos de origen agrícola sus principales cultivos son el café y productos de hortaliza como ser: tomates, lechugas y repollos, Nelson tiene deseos de ganar experiencia tanto técnica como de campo en el cultivo de estos productos su meta es poder producir diversidad alimentos para tener diversas fuentes de ingreso y además darle a su familia el apoyo que necesitan para tener una vida digna.
Nelson está interesado en la construcción de un invernadero para cultivar tomates orgánicos y de esta manera presentar una opción más saludable a las personas, Nelson quiere llevar a cabo el proyecto bajo el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Nelson ya tiene un mercado con COCAFCAL para su producto por lo cual quiere iniciar con el trabajo lo antes posible.
Nelson solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores en su invernadero y de esta manera empezar a cosechar tomate lo más pronto posible, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Nelson espera iniciar su propio patrimonio para estar preparado a la hora de formar su propia familia además pretende ayudar a sus padres para que mejoren su calidad de vida.
Un crédito ayudara a Nelson a tener un invernadero propio para trabajar y obtener ingresos suficientes para ayudar a las necesidades de sus padres y sobre todo a iniciar su propio patrimonio.
texts.en:
Nelson is a young man who grows different products with his father. His main crops are coffee and produce, such as tomatoes, lettuce and cabbage. Nelson wants to get technical and practical experience growing these products. His goal is to be able to produce diverse foods so he can have different sources of income and also support his family so that they can have a dignified life.

Nelson is interested in building a greenhouse to grow organic tomatoes so that he can offer people a healthier option. Nelson wants to undertake the project with the technical support of COCAFCAL, of which he is a member. Nelson already has a market for his product with COCAFCAL, so he wants to begin his work as soon as possible.

Nelson is asking for a loan to start work on his greenhouse so he can harvest tomatoes as soon as possible. With the profits from the sold product, Nelson hopes to start having his own capital so he can be ready to start his own family. He also intends on helping his parents so that they can improve their quality of life.

A loan will help Nelson to have his own greenhouse to work and obtain enough income to help his parents' needs and above all, start having his own capital.

loans.use: to buy tomato plants, nylon, bags, organic compost, covers and other materials necessary to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hamisu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hamisu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Hamisu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lorena, de 38 años de edad, es una madre soltera, vive con su hermana y sus tres hijos en su propia casa, los niños asisten a la escuela y su hermana le ayuda a cuidarlos mientras ella trabaja. 

Lorena, se dedica a trabajar como empleada en una pupusería, tiene varios años de trabajar en ese lugar, porque es de ahí de donde obtiene ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.- Pero aparte de trabajar en ese lugar, ella tiene la habilidad de elaborar flores de bolsa plástica, para el día de los difuntos que es un día tradicional en este país y ella aprovecha está temporada para hacer flores y venderlas. 

Lorena, necesita el préstamo para comprar bolsas, alambre y otros materiales para la elaboración de flores para venderla y así poder tener un ingreso extra en está temporada. 

Los sueños de Lorena, son seguir trabajando y así poder salir siempre adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 38 year old single mother. She lives with her sister and her three children in her own home. The children attend school and her sister helps her to take care of them while she works.

Lorena works as an employee at a pupusa restuarant. She has spent several years working at this location because it is where she obtains an income to get her family ahead. But, in addition to working at this location, she also has the ability to create flowers out of plastic bags for the Day of the Dead which is a traditional day in this country. Lorena takes advantage of this season to make flowers and sell them.

Lorena needs the loan to purchase bags, wire and other materials for the creation of decorative flowers to sell in order to be able to have an extra source of income during this season. Lorena's dreams are to continue working in order to be able to always get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags, wire and other materials for the creation of decorative flowers to sell in order to be able to have an extra source of income during this season.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: La vivienda en la que Manuel vive con su madre desde hace varios años es muy humilde y sencilla, por lo que el constantemente está tratando de mejorarla. Manuel es un joven de 23 años de edad que se gana la vida como albañil independiente, pero además para sostener la economía de su familia se dedica a los cultivos de hortalizas. Él siempre busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que ha decidido encementar el piso de su vivienda y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y madera para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The house where Manuel has been living with his mother for several years is very humble and simple. He is therefore constantly trying to make improvements to it.

Manuel is 23 years old and earns a living as a freelance builder. However, in addition and in order to earn an income to support his family, he works growing vegetables.

Manuel is always looking for ways to improve his quality of life. He has therefore decided to cement the floor in his house, and replace the roof. To do so, he is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and wood to replace the roof and lay cement on the ground of his house.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Rafael, de 37 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando. 

Rafael, se dedica a la venta de zapatos, tiene dos locales en el mercado municipal y su esposa le ayuda a vender, el atiende un local y su esposa atiende el otro; gracias a ese trabajo ha logrado sacar a sus hijos y a su esposa adelante.  

Rafael, necesita el préstamo para comprar zapatos y surtir sus locales para la venta navideña, porque ya se acerca.  

Los sueños de Rafael, son poder seguir adelante con su negocio y así poder darles la educación superior a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is 37 years old and very hard-working. He has a partner and four children, who are in school.

Rafael makes a living selling shoes. He has two shops in the town market. His wife helps him to sell the products. Rafael works at one of the shops; his wife at the other. Thanks to this work, Rafael has been able to move forward with his wife and children.

Rafael needs this loan in order to buy shoes and to stock up his stores for the Christmas sales that are now approaching.

Rafael's dreams are to move forward with his business and to put his children through further education and give them a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes and to stock up his stores for the Christmas sales that are now approaching.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 51 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo tiene un hijo los dos trabajan en el campo en la agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la siembra de trigo, habas, papas a demas a la crianza de vacas, ovejas y cuyes, en dinero lo solicita para la compra de vacas lecheras y alimentos como polvillo, alfalfa y abalancedados para los animales.

enfrentan desafios como la competencia dan los animales a precios mas bajos, en los tiempos libres le gusta ir a las mingas del barrio y compartir con la familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 51 years old. She is married and lives with her husband. She has a son and both her son and her husband work in agriculture in the countryside.

She works planting wheat, lima beans and potatoes, in addition to raising cows, sheep and guinea pigs. She is seeking funding to purchase milk cows and food such as powder, alfalfa and balanced nutritional feed for the animals.

She faces challenges such as competition that lowers the price of the animals. In her free time she likes to go to the community work days and to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows and food such as powder, alfalfa and balanced nutritional feed for the animals.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John es un hombre joven es casado pero aun no tiene hijos vive con la esposa.

El se dedica a la agricultura comercio, ganadería, agricultor siembra papas, ocas, habas el dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas de papas, habas y ocas ademas para fertilizantes y abonos.

El sueño es tener una casa grande de 3 pisos tener un negocio grande, viajar por otro país.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
John is a young man. He is married but does not have any children yet, and he lives with his wife.

John is a farmer, merchant, and livestock breeder. He grows potatoes, ocas and beans, He is requesting a loan to buy potatoes, beans, and oca seeds as well as fertiliser and compost.

His dreams include having a large house with three stories, owning a large business, and traveling to another country. 

In his free time, John enjoys the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, beans, and oca seeds as well as fertiliser and compost.

loans.name: Usama

texts.en:
Usama is maize farmer from Kanawa Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Usama is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usama would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Usama can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Usama is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es:
María, de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 20 años de edad, su pareja la abandonó y ella con mucho esfuerzo saco adelante a su hijo y ahora el muchacho trabaja como empleado en un supermercado y le ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar. 

María, trabaja como empleada en una pupuseria en el centro de su pueblo, ella trabaja ahí desde hace 6 años y es de ahí de donde obtiene ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su casa a ello han podido salir adelante y ayudarse mutuamente con su hijo.- Ella quiere iniciar a vender ropa para la temporada navideña, porque considera que es un época en donde se vende bastante este tipo de artículos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para vender en su casa.

Los sueños de María, son poder tener mejores ingresos y darle la oportunidad a su hijo que pueda estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old. She is a single mother and she has a son who is 20 years old. Her partner abandoned her. With a lot of effort she helped her son to succeed and currently the young man works as an employee in a supermarket and helps his mother with the expenses of their home.

María works as an employee at a pupusa restaurant in the center of her town. She has worked there for 6 years and she earns an income to cover the needs of her household from there. Because of this she has been able to get ahead and assist her son.

María wants to start selling clothing for the Christmas season because she thinks that it is the season when she can sell enough of these type of items. María needs the loan to purchase clothing to sell from her home. María's dreams are to be able to obtain better earnings and to provide opportunities to her son so he can study at the university.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell from her home.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dahiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Dahiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Dahiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bashir has the opportunity to attain a yield of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Bashir would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bashir can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Bashir will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Bashir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona is offering a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Adamu can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Adamu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. 

Adamu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Joshua has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Joshua will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Joshua is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old, married and has five children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú, and grows organic mangoes. 

Jose needs a 1,000 USD loan to buy tools and manure for his fields, and to increase his organic mango production. With the increased income, he will pay for his son to study English.

loans.use: to buy tools and manure for his organic mango production.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Gemma runs a general store, selling merchandise like cooking oil, sugar, bottled mineral water, candles, foot apparel, seasonings, rice, coffee, powdered milk, soft drinks, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.

She is married and has one dependent. Her husband has an income that helps meet the needs of the entire family.

Gemma would like to expand her business and improve her earnings. She needs additional capital to do so. That is why she joined CEVI to avail a loan.

She wants to buy groceries for the store like rice, feed, fertilizer, soft drinks and liquors. These could increase her stock so she can continue to manage her business. These will improve her daily income and enable her to pay her obligations.

Gemma is hopeful that with your support she will be able to manage her business and to continue send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store like rice, feed, fertilizer, soft drinks and liquors.

loans.name: Domingos

texts.en:
Domingos is a 36-year-old married father of one child. He works hard to support his family. He is policeman.

Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for him to afford the cost of his sister's education. This loan of $1,000 will allow Domingos to help his sister pay for her studies in university. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

Domingos loves his sister very much and In the future, Domingos hopes that his sister will be able to work in the government, in agriculture, or in a business.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi works hard to support her family. Mimi is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Mimi requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Marinette

texts.en:
Marinette is 26 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Marinette is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marinette requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Marinette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 42 years of age, separated and has only one child. She has a sari-sari store business and this is what provides their daily needs and is the source of her daughter's tuition fees.

Jennifer needs to earn a lot for their daughter's tuition fees because her dream is for her daughter to finish her studies. Jennifer took a new loan for the purpose of earning much more from her business.

She will buy additional goods to display her sari-sari store. Now Jennifer has an improvement in her living standards and she can provide the tuition fees for her only child because she earns through this business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is a 50-year-old married woman who has four children. Her husband is a fruit vendor at a bus terminal station in her town.

Fortunata wants to help her husband financially and wants him to stay in the house because of health problems. Fortunata wants her business to improve so that she can provide daily medicine for her husband.

She took a new loan to have additional capital for her sari-sari store business, to buy some goods for the business. Now Fortunata can improve her living and also provide the medication for her husband through this business because she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is encouraged that she was able to access loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. Being single did not cause her to settle; she has successfully made it on her own diligence to support herself.

She is again humbly asking for a Php 10,000 loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past twenty years which also enabled her to assist her aging parents. She is grateful to God and people who are good hearted like you who support small business women like her.

Pacita's simple dream is to sustain her store and live a long and healthy life. Every week, she meets up with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 47 years old and married. She has eight children. With two children in school, Narcisa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 29 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, snack foods, candies, coffee and other groceries.

Narcisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ruyrina

texts.en:
Ruyrina is 68 years old and married. She has 10 children and she works very hard to provide for them.

Ruyrina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 45 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, candies, sugar and other groceries.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Ruyrina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eliosa

texts.en:
Eliosa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eliosa is 55 years old now.

Eliosa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Eliosa requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

In the future, Eliosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 53 years old and has seven children. Emerita is married and has two children who are in school.

Emerita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerita requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emerita has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emily is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emily has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Emily has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrella is 58 years old now.

Estrella has a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of used shoes to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elvira

texts.en:
Ma. Elvira is 48 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Ma. Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ma. Elvira has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ma. Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 48 years old and married with one child. Marietta works very hard to provide for them.

Marietta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marietta has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marietta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marife is 43 years old and has one child in school.

Marife has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy hair spray, hair color, etc..

Marife has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy hair spray and hair color.

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita is 51 years old and married with one child, Mariquita works very hard to provide for them.

Mariquita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Mariquita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Mariquita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 54 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marlyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Deceluna

texts.en:
Deceluna has been engaged in fishing for many years now. She sells fresh fish, crabs, and clams to the locals in her place.

She is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. Her youngest child is 14 and is still attending school.

Her husband is a fisherman. Together, they help support the needs of their family.

When the catch is very limited, she engages in buying and selling of fish to have other sources of income. In that way, she can continue to provide for the needs of the entire family.

Deceluna has requested a loan from CEVI to finance her current livelihood. She wants to purchase fuel, a battery for the flashlight, and food for the family. These tools are essential to improve her day-to-day livelihood. These would help generate higher yields so the business can continue to expand.

In the future, Deceluna is hoping that she could be successful in handling her fishing livelihood to become sustainable.

loans.use: purchase fuel, a battery for the flashlight, and food for the family.

loans.name: Borith

texts.en:
Borith is 22 years old, a single factory worker. He resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. He has been a garment-factory worker since 2003. Borith can earn approximately $7 per day.

Now he would like to request a loan to buy cows to feed and breed to have calves to resell. This loan will help him earn more income to support his family. In the future, he is going to expand doing cow-fattening'and build fences around his parents house.

loans.use: to buy cows to feed and breed to get calves to resell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a 44-year-old married man and a father of two children.

He engages in his piggery business to earn more profit. He is able to provide the needs of his family as well as the school fees of his children. He also repaid his previous loan used for his business.

He wants to expand and improve their living condition. Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional piglets to raise in order to produce plenty of meat in their local community as well as in the market.

Allan's plan for the future is to save more money to have a better life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
Sofronia is 47 years old and married with five children.

Sofronia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Sofronia has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Sofronia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 49, is a married woman with nine children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Roselyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, flour, etc..

Roselyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: La Cajita De Ahorro Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “La Cajita de Ahorro” formada por 5 personas muy responsables y con deseos de triunfar en la vida. Actualmente está representada por su presidenta la Sra. Martha de 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos pero solamente 4 aun dependen de ella. Tiene como negocio la venta de todo tipo de revistas y periódicos en su quiosco de venta, de esta manera Ella trata de apoyar a su pareja en brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en surtir de más revistas y periódicos su negocio para poder atender a sus clientes. Uno de los anhelos que tiene Martha es hacer crecer su negocio y terminar de mejorar su casa. En la foto grupal Martha se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeros sentados.
texts.en:
This is the La Cajita de Ahorro communal bank. It is comprised of five very responsible people who have the desire to triumph in life. The bank is currently represented by the president, Martha. She is 44 years old, in a relationship, and has six children. Only four of them are still dependent upon her. Her business is selling all types of magazines and newspapers at a kiosk. This is the way she tries to support her life partner in providing a better quality of life for their children.

She will use the loan to invest in stocking more magazines and newspapers in her business in order to be able to tend to her customers. One of Martha's wishes to make her business grow and to finish improving her house.

In the group photo Martha is standing among her other seated colleagues.

loans.use: to buy newspapers and magazines.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old, widowed, and has two children. As a single parent, she wants the best for her children. Teresita wants to earn more income to provide for the daily needs of her children.

Teresita requested her second loan, which she will use to buy more stocks of rice to sell. With the loan, she will be able to have more sales and generate a greater income while the cost of rice is not high and can be sold at better price. In the future, Teresita plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice products to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is so encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. They have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in their daily sustenance.

She is again humbly asking for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past 15 years and has sustained her family's basic needs.

Luzviminda's simple dream is to improve their quality of life and for her store to become big. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Fris

texts.en:
Fris is separated from her husband. She is 40 years old and has two children. They reside in Ozamiz City.

She has been selling matured coco lumber for a couple of months. She has been able to sustain their living with her income and has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy feeds and vitamins for her hog raising. Her children are still studying and she has been able to finance their daily needs and education expenses with her profit.

She took a new loan recently to purchase more mature coco lumber to sell. She is planning to obtain an additional stall to be used for displaying her lumber and expanding her business. She wants to have a stable and sustainable income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of mature coco lumber to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May, 37, is a woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

May has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

May requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, May would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mayra, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, está acompañada, vive con tres de sus hijos los cuales están estudiando, su hija mayor pronto se graduará y entrará a estudiar bachillerato.

Mayra, se dedica a la venta de artesanías religiosas, ella hace escapularios y otros accesorios enfocados a la religión, pero quiere iniciar a vender ropa para vender en navidad. 

Mayra, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para damas y niños, porque es lo que más se vende en la temporada navideña. 

Los sueños de Mayra, son poder tener éxito con su negocio y tener un ingreso extra en estas fechas tan importantes para ella y para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mayra, age 39, is a very tenacious woman. She is in a relationship, and she lives with three of her children, who go to school. Her oldest daughter will soon graduate and begin high school. Mayra sells religious handicrafts. She makes scapulars and other accessories that are focused on religion. However, she wants to start selling clothes at Christmas time.

Mayra needs the loan to buy clothes for women and children because this is what sells the most during the Christmas season.

Mayra's dreams are to be able to have success with her business and to have extra income during these dates that are so important to her and her children.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa tiene 35 años es casada y tiene dos hijos es una mujer trabajadora se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia ella siembra papas, cebolla y trigo a demas tiene animales como vacas lecheras el credito lo soclita para la compra de vacas y alimento para estas.

El esposo le ayuda mucho en la agricultura pues a los dos les gusta, son un matrimonio feliz lleno de amor..

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho pasar con la familia y cocinar algo rico para disfrutar y ver una pelicula de comedia.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa, age 35, is married and has two children. She is a hard-working woman, who devotes herself to agriculture and livestock. She grows potatoes, onions, and wheat. She also has animals like dairy cows.

She is requesting the loan to buy cows and feed for them. Her husband helps her a lot with the farming. Both of them like it. It is a marriage that is full of love.

In her free time she really like to spend time with the family, cooking something delicious to enjoy, and watching comedy movies.

loans.use: to buy cows and feed for them.

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband is a fisherman. Rabina runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells household commodities ranging from vegetables, fruits, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric softener, and assorted canned goods. She has run her business for many years now and caters to local residents in her community. Rabina repaid her previous loan and is grateful for the chance to continue to expand her business and move toward prosperity.

Rabina is requesting a loan to purchase assorted groceries such as soft drinks, condiments, and canned goods. Her loan is very vital to improving her income and will serve as fuel to continue move her business forward to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, condiments, and canned goods

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is 45, married and blessed with two sons and two daughters. She is a housewife and lives in a small flat with her family in Lahore. One of her sons has a small shop in a nearby market where he sells cosmetics and ladies products. The growing demand for cosmetics has made his business lucrative. Each day there are numerous brands coming with a variety of products.

He wants to increase variety at his store and sell more brands to his customers. Ambitions to make his business profitable he spends more time at his store. He is not self sufficient as yet and Naheed wants to help her son with his dream of having a profitable business. She has therefore requested for a loan that she plans to invest in her son's business and the installments will be paid off with the help of the sales this investment will generate.

loans.use: to help her son with the purchase of cosmetics for his shop.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is 34 years old and is married with three children. He is a mechanic who owns a repair shop. Joey’s wife works as his assistant in the shop. He has daily customers, but is lacking materials to improve his shop and get many customers. 

Joey is requesting a loan to purchase spare motorcycle parts for his shop. He provides excellent service to his customers and his loan will help him meet their needs and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts for his shop
