loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old married man with one child. To earn a living, he runs a retail store beside in his house where he sells grocery goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, and sugar. Richard earns a lot from his business and was able to repay his previous loan.

Richard is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell. He will use his loan to boost his inventory and improve his sales. In the future, Richard plans to save more money to improve the general living conditions of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Zaytuna

texts.ru:
Считается, что искусной мастерицей может стать не каждая девушка или женщина. Для этого необходимо иметь талант, как, впрочем, и в любом другом деле. Зайтуна из города Турсунзаде,  несмотря на свой молодой возраст уже можно назвать искусной мастерицей за талантливо вышитые рукодельные изделия вышивка и подушек. Зайтуне 19 лет. У нее не большая семья – мать и отец.
Зайтуна признаётся, что вышивка – это её любимое дело. Как и многие женщины, она научилась вышивать у мамы и сейчас с удовольствием продолжает заниматься этим ремеслом. Вышитые ею изделия имеют много покупателей на местном рынке, а также Зайтуна вышивает на заказ.
Она желает усовершенствовать свои навыки шитья и расширить ассортимент своих изделий. Зайтуна просит кредит для купли ткани и швейные принадлежности.
texts.en:
It is thought that not every young woman or woman can become a skilled tradesperson. One must have talent for this as in any other sphere. Despite her young age, Zaytuna, from the city of Tursun-zoda, can already call herself skilled at using her talent to embroider handcrafted goods such as pillowcases. She is 19 and has a small family - just her mother and father.

Zaytuna admits that embroidery is her favourite activity. Like many women, she learned to embroider from her mother and now continues doing this craft with pleasure. The embroidered goods she makes have many buyers at the local market, and she also embroiders to order. She wants to improve her sewing skills and to expand her selection of goods. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is young and clever woman. She is single and she lives with parents. Sanavbar is a student at the first course. Sanavbar studies well and she is one of the best students. Her teachers like her because she is a responsible student.

Sanavbar is asking for a loan of 5100 Somoni to pay for the university tuition because her parents have no money. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma and her husband are engaged in a fishing business like most people in the community of Concepcion, Iloilo. They have been doing this business for ten years to raise their family. Thus, they have five children; four adult and one school-aged child.

Vilma’s goal in life is to have a better means of living and support the needs of their family. That is why she wants to uplift their livelihood. To do this, she needs a loan that will help her and her husband to enhance their catch and increase their earnings.

Vilma will use the loan to buy materials (such as bamboo, plywood and paint) for their fishing boat to maintain its good condition. In addition to this, she will also buy a variety of goods (such as toiletries, spices, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee and sugar).

She is thinking of other business opportunities that will help her augment their earnings.

loans.use: to buy materials (such as bamboo, plywood and paint), and a variety of goods (such as toiletries, spices, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee and sugar).

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 55 years old and married with one child. For the past year, she has run a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Susana has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Susana is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Young and enthusiastic Bushra runs a small general store in her neighborhood in Lahore. She is 29, married with 4 children and her aim in life is to educate her children. She sells general items mostly grocery at her store. She wants to refurbish her store in order to avoid running out of stock and also to give more variety to her customers. But due to lack of funds she cant't. Most of her income is spent on household expenses.

She has therefore requested for a BRAC Micorfinance loan with which she will purchase these items that includes grains, lentils, washing powder, soaps, spices etc. She is a strong person and hopes to increase her family's living standards

loans.use: to buy supplies to restock her general store.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She is a widow and now she lives alone since her single daughter is already married and she lives with her family. Armenuhi has higher pedagogical education and many years she worked at the kindergarten, but for 5 years Armenuhi is busy with another occupation.

At her house she sells clothes for women, bedding, linens and towels. She brings her merchandise from Yerevan once a month. Armenuhi mentions that working from her house she makes some savings, avoiding to pay the rent for her place at the wholesale market. Her customers are her neighbors and friends who like the assortment of her products very much and even give orders for their preferred products, which Armenuhi provided with great pleasure. In addition to all the prices of merchandise are not high and attracts very many buyers.

Now with this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams Armenuhi plans to refresh the autumn-winter season clothes collection since she is expecting to have good sales.

loans.use: to refresh the autumn-winter season clothes collection as she expects to have good sales.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 33 years old lady and a responsible mother of three children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own welding shop for past 16 years.

Samina's husband needs to purchase rods, soldering, iron and steel etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase them. To fulfill the need of her husband Samina has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs

Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his welding business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is 45 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Jasmin works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, etc. Jasmin has been in this business for 23 years now. In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of canned goods, sugar, coffee, milk, etc

loans.name: Larena

texts.en: Larena is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Larena is 50 years old and has one child in school. Larena has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Larena has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies for her business. Larena has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Larena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Lybang

texts.en:
Lybang is a 19-year-old single freshman and he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Civil Engineering at a university in the city. He is from the Kratie Province in Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers.

Lybang lacks the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year, so he has decided to take out a loan. With this loan, he will have enough money to earn a bachelor’s degree and graduate successfully.

After graduation, he is going to find a good job with a decent salary, so he will be able to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for a BSc. in Civil Engineering from the first to the fourth year. His parents are rice farmers.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
Sreypao is a 21-year-old single student. She is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Now she is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. Her parents earn their main income from rice farming, which makes it hard to pay her tuition fees.

Due to the fact that Sreypao is short of the money to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth years, she would like to secure a loan. With this loan, she will graduate successfully.

In the future, Sreypao is going to find a good job in the bank. She also wants to build a new proper house. If she has children, she will want them to study to pursue bachelor or master's degrees if she can support it.

loans.use: to cover her university fees for the first to the fourth years.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 29-year-old, Married woman from Tubas near Jenin City. She lives with her family in a small, old house. Rasha has a small store for selling clothes in the city. It is good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation in the west bank is bad because of conflict.

Rasha took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of woman clothes for the winter season. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her husband to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of woman clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 39 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. For the past nine years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Margie works very hard to provide for her family.

Margie is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel is 53 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anabel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her pigpens. Anabel has been raising pigs for two years now, and also earns additional income from a general store business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save more in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair her pigpens.

loans.name: Jenever

texts.en: Jenever is 28 years old and has one child. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenever has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds. Jenever has been doing the pig fattening business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jenever would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is 32 years old and married. Gertrudes works very hard to provide for her family. Gertrudes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy beverages, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries. Gertrudes has been in this business for 3 years now and sells a variety of items. In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely works hard to support her family. Fely is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Fely has been in this business for 9 years now. She would like to save enough in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joie

texts.en:
Mary Joie is 28 years old and married with one child.

Mary Joie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Mary Joie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Mary Joie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en: Vith, a farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province, she is 48 years old and a married mother of five children, four of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been growing rice; raising piglets and she also take her free time to work for others for a fee about 10 years. The farming business has been threatened by drought, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her children. This will be the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund and she is willing to use her portion of loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for labor fees to increase the crop products. She hopes that this loan will enable her to grow her crop well and gain more outputs so as to expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to boost her crop outputs so as to increase her income.

loans.name: Firdusi

texts.en:
Firdusi is 61 years old and he lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. He is married and he lives with his wife and son. His daughter is already married and she lives with her family. Firdusi is employed and at the private company he works as a storekeeper. Firdusi’s wife works at the hospital as a nurse and his son is a constructor.

Firdusi decided to have deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon since he has serious dental problems and course of treatment that he must pass is very expensive but very important for him. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks in order to pay for his dental treatment course and he sends his great thanks beforehand for such great support.

loans.use: to pay for his dental treatment course and he sends his great thanks beforehand.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Rukhsana is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tatiana Group

texts.en:
Tala is the featured borrower of Tatiana group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends and seek to develop their living.

Tala is a 20 years old married mother of one child, who has been working as a tutor from her house and in clothes selling business for three years to support her husband in making their living and improving their social and financial situation at the same time.
She is a hard working woman, who works hard to support her family. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase special winter clothes collection to increase her merchandise and develop her business.
Tala is the lady at the center of the picture accompanied with Stephanie at the left side of the picture, while Fadia at the right side.

loans.use: to purchase special winter clothes collection to increase her merchandise and develop her business.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en: Lelia is 62 years old. She’s married and has three children to provide for. She owns a retail store for almost ten years now, just to work for a profit and this business has become their main source of living. With the help of her husband who does farming, they were able to sustain the business and were able to send her children in school. She’s planning to engage in some other activities for the expansion of her business. Now Lelia has gained access to GDMPC and has decided to borrow a loan to be used for buying more grocery and useful items such as coffee, sugar and noodles, to sell and have a greater sales. Lelia’s plan for the future is to save more money for the educational of her children when they get into college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as coffee, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita's main source of income is by means of fishing. She sells fish, crabs and clams to the locals in her place. Her husband is a fisherman. They support each other to provide the needs of their entire family. She is a 58-year-old married woman and has two grown children.

She is asking for a loan to purchase materials like plywood, nail epoxy (adhesive) and paint for pump boat repairs. These will help Lolita rebuild her fishing  boat, to be able to have ease in transporting her husband's catch. In that way, she could slowly gain higher yields and set aside some of the profits for future use.

Lolita is looking forward to continuously seeking ways to become successful and to invest in other sources of income towards becoming financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plywood, nail epoxy (adhesive) and paint for pump boat repairs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old, married and has three children. She borrowed a loan to buy more goods for her sari-sari (mini grocery) store.

By venturing into this business, she was able to help her husband, who is working abroad, in financial matters. She was able to provide for some of the immediate needs of her children.

She wants to be successful in this business, expand the sari-sari store and be able to help her family, including her parents and relatives who are in need.

loans.use: to buy for more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a Kiva borrower with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be too few sewing machines.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another sewing machine. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en: Weldon is a married man. He has 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock  of clothes. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock  of clothes

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia works hard to support her family. Irenia is married and has a buying and selling of spices business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of spices for her business.

Irenia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Irenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of spices for her business.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en: Pearly is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pearly is 35 years old and has two children who are in school. Pearly has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Pearly has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other supplies for her business. Pearly has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, Pearly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom attend school. Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Jean runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Jean has been in this business for ten years.

Jean would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a 60-year-old widowed mother of six children. Felicidad works very hard to provide for them.

Felicidad runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages and other groceries.

Felicidad has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a beautiful 23-year-old woman who is married without ‎children. She decided to start her own business to be able ‎to insure ‎good future for her coming children as she does not want to be mother ‎without be able to provide a living for her ‎children. She has done nothing ‎but strive to offer them a decent life, so they will have everything they ‎need to grow up ‎healthy, happy, and well fed.
‎
She is selling blankets and bed clothes to help her husband and to save money for the future. Now she wants to be ready ‎for the winter season; therefore she applied for a loan to buy more products and blankets to sell to increase her income.‎

loans.use: to buy more products and blankets to sell to increase her income.

loans.name: Mkala

texts.en:
Mkala is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Mkala has operated a poultry selling business for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mkala dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Bujubuli Abango Clan Development Group

texts.en: Milia whose hand is raised up is a member of Bujubuli Abango Clan Development group,a very committed client who works for the betterment of her group. She is 39 years old married and with children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She basically deals in the sale of secondhand clothes at attractive prices. She is also a farmer and gets additional income from sale of surplus. She got involved in these businesses to earn income and meet her increasing demands. She is challenged by low capital base that affects her business plan of having a big well stocked shop of second hand clothes. Milia has asked for a loan to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gullnaz

texts.en:
Gullnaz is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore, Gullnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Gullnaz is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Mujë

texts.en:
Muje works as a master of electricity and water but he also cultivates herbal tea on his land. He works a lot on his land, growing his tea and selling them for 10 Euros a kilo, making much profit. He has a lot of demand and sells his team at various markets around Kosovo.

He is hoping to expand his business even more and is asking for a loan of 700 euros to expand his land and harvest more herbal tea in the spring. He really appreciates the help of the lenders in reaching his dream.

loans.use: to expand his land and harvest more herbal tea in the spring.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is aged 37 and married to a carpenter. They're blessed with two children. She has been managing a food-vending business in their village for almost two years. She earns a net income in this business amounting to PHP 1,500 a day.

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase popcorn, cookies, and biscuits to sell in her food stall. She's hoping that her food-vending business will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase popcorn, cookies, and biscuits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Cristy Lou

texts.en: Cristy Lou runs a snack vending business for a living. She has a small grocery stall. At the age of 33, she has three children to provide for, while her husband is a motorcycle driver. That's why she has decided to expand her business and have more stocks. Recently Cristy Lou took a new loan to purchase goods for selling and to be able to increase her stall inventory. This will help her generate more income to provide for her family's daily needs. Cristy Lou wants in the future to save enough money from her business and successfully provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 46 years old, married and has three children. His wife does not work.Gerald is a former employee in her barangay as a barangay treasurer but he resigned because of health problems. He is engaged in a new business which is a piggery. He has a pair of pigs. Gerald took a new loan because they want to renovate his pig fence as well as to buy additional materials for his pig fence. And now Gerald can successfully renovate his pig fence. He already has a lot of piglets in his pig fence and will improve their family's living through this business because of his earnings.

loans.use: to pay for materials for his pig fence renovation

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is grateful that the loan that was granted by Kiva and its lenders has really helped sustain her "ukay-ukay" (selling slightly used clothes) business. Her earnings support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

To help her expand the business, she is requesting for a Php 50000 loan to buy additional used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. Now that Christmas is fast approaching she expecting a higher demand of clothes. She is encouraged by a good return on her investment which surely helped fund their everyday needs and for the school needs of her children.

Marietta aims to have her own space in a commercial are to attract and serve more customers. She dreams to see become professionals someday. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for slightly used or surplus clothing to sell.

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arleen is 41 years old and has four children who are in school.

Arleen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arleen requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, etc.

Arleen has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Arleen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, fish, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with five children. Carmelita is 49 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Carmelita has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Carmelita has been in this business for nine years.

Carmelita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other maintenance items for her business.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other maintenance items for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 43 years old and has seven children.  Ma. Gina is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Gina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Gina has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of thrree children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell curtains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Teresita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more curtains to sell for her buy and sell curtains business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more curtains to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 45 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell spices in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sack of spices to sell.

Elma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell spices for 15 years and also earns an income from general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sack of spices to sell

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida, de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa, sus 5 hijos ya están casados y viven con sus propias familias, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 

Elida, se dedica a la venta de platos típicos todas la tardes en la acera de su casa y tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, específicamente vende papas fritas, pastelitos de papa, empanadas de plátano y también hace paletas de fruta congelada. 

Elida, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para la elaboración de sus platos típicos y además para comprar paletas de helado. 

Los sueños de Elida, son continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Elida is 60 years old and lives with her husband. Her 5 children are all married and live with their own families. Her husband works in agriculture.

Elida sells staple dishes every afternoon by her home. It has been over 20 years in this business. Specifically, she sells French fries, potato cakes, banana pies, and frozen fruit popsicles.

Elida requests a loan to buy products to prepare the dishes and to buy popsicles.

Elida's dream is to continue working.

loans.use: to buy products to prepare the dishes and to buy popsicles.

loans.name: Romdoul's Group

texts.en:
Romdoul is a widow who lives in a rural village of Battambang province and she is 31-year-old. The primary source of her income is from growing rice and she can earn additional income via working for others for a fee to support her lifestyle for 8 years. She can earn income about 6USD per day and she is able to save around 3USD each day after expenses. Due to lack of fund, she decides to get a loan with VisionFund to support her business.

She is now leading a group of two, in order to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide to increase productivity of her rice crop. This will be the first loan cycle for her and her group member whose name is Robeap. She hopes that this loan will allow her to gain more outputs so as to earn more income for upgrading her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase productivity of her rice crop, which expected to increase outputs so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en: Nigina was born in 1987. She is married and has 2 children. Her children are little. Nigina is a very hardworking and smart woman. Her husband is a farmer. Nigina is also a farmer. She has a land where she grows different vegetables. She works in this field for more than 5 years now. Little by little with the passing of time developed her business. She sows twice in a year, in spring and in the autumn. Nigina is going to make an autumn sowing and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a new sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for a new sowing season.

loans.name: Mahingul

texts.en:
Mahingul is a kind woman. She is married and has 3 children. She has been running her own business more than 10 years. Mahingul sews a variety of women's clothes, with high quality.

Mahingul has a workshop and she has 3 pupils. Mahingul also has regular customers, thanks to her good service.

Mahingul is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for increased working capital.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 39 years old, married and has seven children. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living and to help her husband as carpenter in the town. Due to an increase of family needs, Gina wants to increase her store inventory and increase her income so she can meet needs to purchase additional goods to sell and have more sales in order to generate more income. To make this, she has availed herself of a loan amounting PHP 12,000.00. Gina wants in the future to expand her business in order to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a divorced woman. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family standards of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
This is Maricris, who is 30 years old and from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Life in a third-world country is quite hard, and most families struggle to make ends meet. Her husband's salary as a driver is not enough to meet their daily household needs, so Maricris thought of putting up a small general store to augment their income.

Maricris has been running her store for two years now and is doing quite well. She buys essential food items and toiletries from wholesalers and then sells them at retail prices. To help her expand operations of her store she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, charcoal, toiletries, etc., to sell at her small store. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help.

Maricris dreams that someday she will own a bigger grocery store. She plans to send her child to preschool. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it is there that she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 64 years old and a widow with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Nenita has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Asasio

texts.en:
Asasio is married with children. He has butchery business and also does farming and motorcycle for transport business for income generation. His family desire is to build a good home and he is starting off to achieve this dream.

His business dream is to have a modern butchery with a preservative machine to keep the meat fresh. He has most materials on site, but lacks few like timber. He is requesting for money to buy timber and kick off constructing his residential house.

loans.use: to buy timber and kick off constructing his residential house.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot is 39 years old and she is married with six dependent children. She lives in the Battambang province, where she and her husband have been making a living through working as soldier and working as construction worker for a fee. She is now requesting a loan from VisionFund, which is her first time, to buy a decent motorcycle to commute from home to workplace. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to save much time and save more money to support a living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to workplace.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay works hard to support her family. Gay is married and has a buy-and-sell root crop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

Gay has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Gay would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Obrah Group

texts.en:
This group was created since the first cycle of the 'Obrah’. It is composed of women from the same neighborhood united by good social and professional ties.

Georgina is the group’s official. She is 35 years old married woman.

She is active in the selling of beans,gari (powdered cassava) and oil in her town.

With her new financing of 800GHS, she is going to purchase more baskets of beans to be cooked and prepared. She makes use of proven experience in this domain for having worked at it for a long time. The profits earned will enable her to meet the food needs of her customers and to bolster her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more baskets of beans to be cooked and prepared.

loans.name: Dragan

texts.en:
Dagan is involved in agriculture based on a family tradition. He earns a living by working on his land, planting wheat and corn which he sells for a profit. Sometimes his wife helps him and he is very satisfied with the life he has in the village and the work that he does.

Dagan is requesting a loan to purchase a new machine for his tractor to work on the land. The loan will help him to be able to work more effectively and efficiently, increasing his profit. He hopes that he will always be able to continue his work in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for his tractor to work on the land

loans.name: Sokhary

texts.en: Sokhary is 24 years old and she is a nursing student in her third year at university in a city. She is from the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Her parents are rice farmers. Due to the fact that she is short of finances, Sokhary would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. With this loan, she will be able to graduate successfully with a skill to build her future. For her dreams, Sokhary is going to find a good job with a decent salary, so she will be able to build a new proper house for her parent’s. If she gets children, she wants her children to study and pursue a bachelor or master if she can support it.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is a young and hardworking woman. She is single and lives with her parents. Dilorom this year graduated from school with excellent marks. She has applied to the Medical Collage in her region and she is a student of the first class. Dilorom is studying pharmacy. She will work in any pharmacy after graduating Collage. Dilorom is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a retail business where she sells utensils. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale shop. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a single woman. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes. 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Askanaz

texts.en:
In Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region lives Askanaz with his wife and their single son. Askanaz is a farmer and since his son and wife are also unemployed, all of them are engaged in farming.

On his farm Askanaz has cows, calves, heifers, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. With his wife Askanaz sells his farm products at the city’s wholesale market and these are milk, cheese, macun (national dairy-product), curd, meat and eggs. Askanaz also has plot of land on which he cultivates potato, cucumber, peppers, tomato and garlic. These vegetables he also sells at the wholesale market.

Askanaz mentions that with the coming of cold weather, his income from especially the agricultural part stops, since vegetable sale also stops and the income comes only from the sale of dairy-products and meat.

This loan will be great for him as he has no finance to store fodder for his farm cattle for winter; this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he will use for the purchase of a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of a lot of fodder for his farm cattle for winter

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her business.

Delia has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 40 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 54 years old and married with four children. Patricia works very hard to provide for them.

Patricia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Patricia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Patricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennifer is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Jennifer has a egg vending business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a 35 year hardworking single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her previous loan was intended to finish up her residential house, but did not because of bad weather. She still operates a restaurant as her main source of income, though she also grows food crops as a side income business. Apart from that, she owns rentals which give her an additional income. She got her startup capital through a village bank where group members guaranteed her to acquire a loan and has been doing this business for over five years. She wants all her children to study up to the university level, however her main challenges are bad debtors in her business and inadequate capital.

With the requested loan, she hopes to buy more building materials to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to complete her residential house.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman and she owns a house that neither has piped water or electricity .Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kache has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. In addition she also operates a motorbike business that earns her another source of income.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: The person appearing in the photo is called Winfred. She is 31 years of age, married and is living with her husband. Winfred joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings' on enterprise management. She is applying for her first Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farm. She looks forward to more productivity and thus more income to cater for her family needs. Winfred appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farming.

loans.name: Alh. Alkasim

texts.en:
Alh. Alkasim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Alkasim is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Alh. Alkasim would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Alkasim will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alh. Alkasim now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: The person appearing in the photo is Angelica. She is married and is a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2014 and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management. She sells foodstuffs such as bananas and bread. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock to help improve sales. She hopes that her profits will increase and that she will be able provide a better diet, clothing as well as to pay fees for her children. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to pay well.

loans.use: to buy more kales, tomatoes and onions that will boost her grocery business.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is an industrious woman. She is married and has 4 children. Mahbuba has been busy with selling shoes more than 13 years. She has a selling place in a local market. Mahbuba buys shoes from China and sells in a local market.

Mahbuba every season renews the assortment of her goods. She is going to renew the assortment of her goods for the new season and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy shoes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season.

loans.name: Blesida

texts.en:
Blesida is aged 39, married and blessed with three children. She manages a livestock business, particularly hog raising and duck raising. She's been in this business for almost 15 years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 every three to four months. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of her daughter.

Due to inadequate capital to use in her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase hog feeds, duck feeds, and a hog to raise. She's hoping that her livestock business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds, duck feeds, and a hog to raise.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is the father of 5 children. He owns and manages his transport business to earn income and to be able to provide for his family needs while his wife takes care of their children. He has successfully paid his previous loan and now is taking another loan. As part of motorcycle maintenance, he needs to replace some parts of the motor and pay for renewal of his license to continue carrying passengers and thus increasing his income. Arnulfo wants in the future to buy a new motorcycle for expansion of their household income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for his license renewal in order to continue to run his business.

loans.name: Adulfa

texts.en: Adulfa is 54 years old, separated, and has 12 children to support. To earn for a living of her family by selling biscuits and candies outside of the school at the same time she can overlook her children in school. Adulfa wants to increase her  income; that’s why she needs financial assistance to increase her grocery stall inventory and increase her sales. To do this, she decided again to borrow a loan to buy additional goods to sell. Her plan for the future is to save money out from her business to buy a lot of her own.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Jolyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jolyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing supplies like nets, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc., for her fishing business.

Jolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing supplies like nets, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for over 15 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Marosyl

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marosyl works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Marosyl is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Marosyl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains for her business

loans.name: Përparim

texts.en:
Përparim lives in the Ashkali community together with is wife and two children. They are very poor and live under sup-par conditions. He recently started to work as a taxi driver. He used to work in construction but there was not enough profit and took too much of his energy and physical work to be successful.

Unable to completely provide for his family through his work, he decided to switch trades. He is now requesting a loan to be able to repair his taxi, in order to start his business and provide a better life and future for his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi in order to start his business and provide a better life and future for his family

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is 31 years old lady and a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been running his own school for past 5 years. Sana needs to purchase more furniture e.g wood tables, chairs and boards etc. But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these merchandises.

To fulfill the need of Sana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her to buy these items. That will be good for her to earn more income and this income will support her to fulfill her family's needs.

Sana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her school.

loans.name: Ma. Crestita

texts.en:
Ma. Crestita is a married woman from Estancia, Iloilo. She is a mother of a 10-year-old girl who is the center of their life. She patiently helps her husband in raising their daughter by operating a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. Thus, her husband is a fisherman. Ma. Crestita’s dream in life is to improve their livelihood to have enough money to send her daughter to a better school. To make it happen, she and her husband works hard.

Ma. Cristita is asking for funds to help her buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies. With this, it will help her increase her sales as to her profit. Additionally, she will also buy a fishing net to improve the catch of her husband.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips and a fishing net

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 34 years old and married with three children, who are in school, Rhoda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

Rhoda has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Rhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Genera

texts.en:
Genera is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genera is 52 years old now.

Genera has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Genera requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of vegetable to sell .

Genera has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Genera would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 44 years old and married with two children. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries.

Zenaida has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Ana Sylvia

texts.en:
Ana Sylvia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell rice.

Ana Sylvia dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is 49 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 3 years.

Abida's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items. Therefore Abida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A senhora Maria de 40 anos de idade é casada mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2 estudam 1 ainda é menor e os restantes 02 já maiores de idade com suas próprias casas, é pensionista militar e vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar areia, cimento, pedra para iniciar a construção de sua casa.
Planos para o futuro construção de sua casa em fases a 1ª faze construir 2 quartos a 2ª faze a sala e mais um quarto e 3ª faze varanda e cozinha.
Diz que além da pensão conta com ajuda de seu esposo que é pedreiro e será ele que vai fazer a casa e que irá solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, is married and the mother of five children. Two of them study, and one is still very young. The remaining two are adults and live in their own homes. She retired from the army and lives in a house she owns.

With the requested amount, she will buy sand, cement, and stones to start building her house.

In the future, she plans to build her house in phases. First, she will build two rooms. Then, she will build the leaving room, and finally, the front porch and the kitchen.

She says that besides her pension, she receives help from her husband, who is a mason; it is him who will build the house. She will apply for more loans.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and stones to start building her house.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A senhora Rosa, comerciante de 42 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filha,  ja maior de idade e a trabalhar, vive na casa própria e não sustenta a mais ninguem.
Com o valor do emprestimo irá comprar, chapas, cimento, barrotes, blocos, varões de ferro, janelas portas para concluir a sua casa.
O seu sonho é terminar a sua obra, mobilar, comprar carro pra lhe ajudar no seu negocio. O maior sonho é ter uma empresa de loja grande.
O seu maior desafio é lutar contra a pobreza e doenças, tem insuficiência de fundos, mas esta trabalhando para superar, com o credito anterior  legalizou o seu espaço e construir a casa em que vive hoje.
texts.en:
Rosa, a 42-year-old businesswoman, is single and has a daughter who is an adult and works. She owns the house where she lives, and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, she will buy metal sheets, cement, columns, bricks, iron bars, windows, and doors to finish building her house.

Her dream is to finish the construction works, and buy a vehicle that helps her with her business. Her biggest dream is to have a large store.

Her biggest challenge is to fight against poverty and illness. She does not have enough money, but she is working to overcome that problem. With the previous loan, she formalized the ownership of her land and built the house where she lives today.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, columns, bricks, iron bars, windows, and doors to finish building her house.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 30 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Cristine is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for cleaning and applying fertilizers.

Cristine has been farming sugarcane for 1 year and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land cleaning and applying fertilizers.

loans.name: Dioneta

texts.en:
Dioneta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market for her buy and sell fish business.

Dioneta has been in this business for 30 years. Dioneta earns more income from general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Dioneta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maricel is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maricel has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for one year. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Marline dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Danessa

texts.en: Danessa is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Danessa is 24 years old and has two children who are in school. Danessa has a buy-and-sell gasoline business in the Philippines. Danessa has requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy gasoline to sell in her business. Danessa has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Danessa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell in her business

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda is 50 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Wenefreda works very hard to provide for them.

Wenefreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Wenefreda has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Wenefreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a hardworking married lady living in Fort Portal Uganda. She owns a business of lodges, which she has been operating for nine years now. With the previous loan, she managed to buy land for expanding her lodges. She is still in the same lodge business in addition to selling matooke (green plantain) as well as also operating a salon to earn additional income. She is faced with the hardships of inadequate capital that limit her ability to expand in terms of opening up new branches. Besides that, she hopes to construct a good residence for her family. Peluce has asked for another loan facility to help her buy lodge equipment such as beds, blankets and bed sheets for her lodge business.

loans.use: to buy lodge equipments like beds, blankets and bedsheets for her lodge business.

loans.name: Bano Bibi

texts.en: Bano Bibi is a 35-years old married woman, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband drives a van in Lahore city, where he provides transportation to the passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous work, most of the parts of his van has depreciated and there is an urgent need for replacement with a new one. Therefore, Bano Bibi has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Bano Bibi hopes that through this amount, her husband would be able to buy the required spare parts so that he can drive it again. She belongs to a poor family - her husband being the only single earning source as she does not have any other source of income. Bano Bibi seems very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her husband's van.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a mother of two children at the age of 42. As a mother, She wants what's the best for the family. Her husband is a farmer, both of them are helping each other in their corn farm, at the same Marife owns a retail store in their village. She aims for a greater income because of the increased needs of the family.

Previously Marife took a loan to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm to produce good quality of corn and have a good harvest and now she availed a new loan to pay for labor in harvesting and some of the revenue will be proceed to her retail store. Marife wants to save money from her business to improve their house building.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for the corn harvest.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals.

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman with three kids, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Margaret operates a grocery vegetables selling stall - she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans for boosting her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell diesel business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from other business. Marilou is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to  buy more stock of diesel for resale for her buy-and-sell diesel  business. Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of diesel for resale.

loans.name: Dorovico

texts.en:
Doroviko maintains a coffee and banana plantation. He is also happily married with children and he provides for them as they deserve. He wants to educate all his children and he is working hard to achieve it.

He now wants to stock more coffee so that he does not disappoint his customers, since what he has is all booked for sale. He is requesting for money to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario es un agricultor de 30 años que junto con su esposa Reina se dedica al cultivo de diferentes productos de origen agrícola sus principales cultivos son el café y productos de hortaliza. Mario es creció viendo cómo funcionan los procesos de la agricultora y ahora quiere poner en practica algunos conocimientos que ha adquirido durante su vida, Mario tiene experiencia de campo en el cultivo de muchos productos su meta es poder producir de una forma diversificada para tener diversas fuentes de ingreso y además promover a que las personas consuman lo que se produce en la región.
Mario quiere iniciar un proyecto para la producción de tomates orgánicos bajo invernadero el producto cosechado lo comercializara por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, este cultivo es muy novedoso ya que el cultivo de tomate deja muy buenas ganancias además proporcionan fuentes de empleo para las personas.
Mario Solicita un crédito para iniciar a cultivar tomates orgánicos lo antes posible ya que él piensa que entre más rápido tengan nuevas fuentes de ingresos menos vulnerable será su economía ante la caída del precio de cualquiera de los productos que vende.
Un crédito ayudara a Mario a tener diversas fuentes de ingresos y por lo tanto le permitirá darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario is a 30 year old farmer. Together with his wife Reina he cultivates different agricultural products. His primary crops are coffee and vegetable products. Mario grew up seeing how agricultural processes function, and now wants to put into practice some knowledge he acquired during his life. Mario has experience in the field growing many products. His goal is to be able to produce in a diversified manner, in order to have different sources of income, and to encourage people to consume what is grown in the region.

Mario wants to start a project of producing organic tomatoes in a greenhouse. The product he harvests will be sold through COCAFCAL, in which he is a partner. This type of cultivation is very groundbreaking, as growing tomatoes provides very good earnings, and provides sources of employment for people.

Mario seeks a loan to begin growing organic tomatoes as soon as possible, as he thinks that the sooner he has new sources of income, the less vulnerable his financial state will be if the price falls on any of the products he sells. A loan will help Mario have diverse sources of income, and therefore will permit him to provide better opportunities to his children.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, nylon, wood, tomato plants, an irrigation system, and other materials needed for the construction of a greenhouse.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
ce groupe est composé de 16 membres qui habitent dans la même localité. Il a été crée en Janvier 2012. la représentante  Mously  est  mariée , elle est mère de 05 enfants dont 2 filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes au marché une étoile de Ndande où elle s'approvisionne.
Avec ce prêt , elle compte continuer son activité. Elle fait 04 livraisons par semaine pour 150000f.
elle a comme objectifs assurer les frais médicaux de ses enfants et la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group, created in January 2012, is made up of 16 members who live in the same area. The group representative, Mously, is a married mother to five children; three sons and two daughters. She earns a living through selling vegetables at the Ndande market, which is where she also purchases her stock.

With this loan, she plans to continue running her business. She completes four deliveries of vegetables per week, which earns her 150,000 FCFA. Her goal is to be able to provide her children with adequate medical care and food.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en: Elpedia is a 53 years old, married and has three children to provide for. To earn a living she is engaged in a banana production business. She sell harvested bananas to the market from her banana farm. To increase her income she needs to produce more bananas in the market. To achieve this she decided to borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer to fertilize the land  for good quality of bananas so that she can have more bananas to be deliver in the market. Elpedia plan for the future to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to give her land nutrients.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is happy that she was able to sustain her store through the untiring support of Kiva and its lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and is forever thankful for your help. 

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 15000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which sustained her family's basic needs. She is hopeful for your positive response. 

Sonia dreams to have a big grocery someday. She prays to be more financially stable. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Gerald
