texts.en: Gerald is a single man. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years now. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 40 years old and married with one child. Rowena works very hard to provide for them. Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries. Rowena has been in this business for 5 years now and sells a variety of items. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 41 years old and married with five children who are in school, Nena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

Nena has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future Nena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gloria has a buy and sell mineral water business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of mineral water to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used his previous loan to pay the school fees for his children. He is a hardworking business man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns rentals as well as earning a salary from the local government. He is faced with the challenges of inflation that increases his children's school fees and the overall standard of living. Joseph has the future prospects of of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Joseph has asked for a loan to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a woman who has six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tessie is 39 years old.

Tessie has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like nail polish, brushes, etc.

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Mexido

texts.en: Mexido used the previous loan to help pay for his motorcycle. Mexido deals in motorcycle transport, which he started with a hope of employing himself and earning an income for his family. The hardships of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital are hindrances to his dream of buying a car in order to provide better services for his customers and of building a permanent house. Mexido needs another loan to install electricity in his house.

loans.use: to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El socio Andrés es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor , él desea sacar adelante a su familia por eso el se dedica día a día a su trabajo. El socio es albañil, este trabajo lo realiza mucho tiempo y es una actividad muy pesada.
El socio solicito el préstamo para adquirir ropa de uso propio, ya que el necesita el dinero para comprar guantes de cuero y botas de jebe. Para poder laborar de forma segura y tranquila.
El socio está muy contento con el préstamo que le dio los inversionista de KIVA ya que gracias a ello seguirá laborando de forma segura , el se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Andrés is a hardworking and enterprising client who wishes to help his family get ahead so he works hard at his job every day. He is a bricklayer, a tough job that he's had for a long time.

He is seeking a loan to buy clothing for his own use: leather gloves and rubber boots. Then he will be able to work in a safe and worry-free way.

Andrés is very grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan from Kiva lenders. It is thanks to their help that he will be able to work safely. He promises to pay back the loan money punctually.
.

loans.use: buy leather gloves and rubber boots

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle breakdown.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service the motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to  wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy shirts, pants, etc. for her buy and sell ready to  wear business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is 55 years old and married with nine children. With two children in school, Jovencia works very hard to provide for them.

Jovencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, charcoal, home product care, and other groceries.

Jovencia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Jovencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, charcoal, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosemina

texts.en:
Rosemina is 67 years old and widow with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional can goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Rosemina has been in this business for 45 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional can goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman with 5 children. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motor vehicle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high of fuel.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to repair the vehicle. His business goal is to buy another vehicle within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school .She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a cyber cafe offering computer services to the neighbors and passerby for the past five years. She mentioned transportation and seasonality as a major challenge in her business

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase more computers to use in her business. She decided to join yehu to access loans and boost  her business.

loans.use: to purchase more computers to use in her business

loans.name: Pantaleona

texts.en:
Pantaleona is 55 years old and has nine children. She is widowed and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Pantaleona requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Pantaleona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  y  tres actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de materiales para la construcción de un vivero  para hortalizas y además comprar fertilizantes, fungicidas para la asistencia . Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miriam is 48 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three [children]. 

With the loan she intends to purchase materials for the construction of a nursery for vegetables and also to buy fertilizers, and fungicides for assistance. 

With these improvements to her crops she hopes to obtain a bit of earnings and improve the living conditions of her family.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR. 

She has not had any other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase materials for vegetables

loans.name: Bophal's Group

texts.en:
A 30-year-old woman, Bophal is a resident in Battambang province. She is married with two dependent children, one of whom is in school. She, together with her husband, has been growing rice and cassava to support family’s living for ten years. Moreover, she works for neighbors for a fee. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to farming business. 

Bophal, eight-cycled borrower, leads a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Past loans have helped her renovate her house to be in a better condition. As the group leader, she will use her loan to have her farmland plowed, to buy cassava seedlings and organic fertilizer to boost cassava yields. She hopes to earn more income and to buy more sacks of organic fertilizer to improve crop yields so that she can expand her current business and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to have farmland plowed and to buy cassava seedlings and organic fertilizer to boost cassava yields to keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house.

Ali is the only breadwinner for his family so they depend on him for support. Ali works in the construction field in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Ali took out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new crane to transport iron, stones and cement and help him in his work. He hopes that this new equipment will enable him to increase his efficiency and speed and eventually help him save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new crane to transport iron, stones and cement and help him in his work.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a retail business where he sells bags, shoes and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, bags. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, bags.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old, married and has three children.  

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest .

Conchita has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to for laborers' salaries during harvest

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old, married and has three children. two in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Irene has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel is 39 years old and married, and she has two children who are in school.

Licel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Licel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac intends to use the loan to buy building materials like cement and sand to construct his residence.. Isaac is a married man with children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Isaac owns a boutique, deals in a transport business, has rentals and also earns a government salary. He is able to provide for his family's needs, send his children to school and make other constructive investments.

His desire is to educate his children. Isaac is now focusing on constructing a well-furnished house for his family but lacks money to buy materials to start the project.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and sand to construct his residence.

loans.name: Buenaflor

texts.en:
Buenaflor is 48 years old and widowed with one child in school, Buenaflor works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell.

Buenaflor has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Buenaflor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel es un agricultor de 33 años que se dedica a cultivar distintos productos como ser: Café, repollos y tomate Manuel tiene como meta fortalecer sus ingresos por cultivos que no sean el café ya que en estos momentos el café es la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia.
El cultivo de tomate bajo invernadero es una técnica que se ha hecho muy popular en la región ya que permite a los productores obtener ingresos extras y además el cultivo es amigable con el ambiente ya que es 100% orgánico, Manuel está interesado en este proyecto ya que le ayudara a fortalecer su economía obteniendo ingresos de más de una fuente.
Manuel solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores para la construcción de un invernadero para la producción de tomates que comercializara por medio de COCAFCAL, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Manuel piensa seguir invirtiendo en proyectos para diversificar sus ingresos y hacer que su familia no sea vulnerable a quedarse sin una fuente de ingresos.
Un crédito le ayudará a Manuel a tener una economía más sólida que no dependerá de una sola fuente de ingresos, también le ayudara a tener ingresos extras para iniciar a formar un pequeño patrimonio para su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 33-year-old farmer who grows different types of crops, such as coffee, cabbage, and tomatoes. Manuel's goal is to strengthen his income with crops other than coffee, which is today the family's main source of income.

Greenhouse tomato growing is a technique that has become very popular in the region, because it allows farmers to receive an extra income. In addition, it is environmentally friendly, because it is 100% organic. Manuel is interested in this project, which will help him to strengthen his economy, by diversifying his sources of income.

Manuel is requesting a loan to start building a greenhouse to grow tomatoes. He will sell his produce through COCAFCAL. With the profits he gets from his produce, Manuel plans to invest in projects that allow him to diversify his economy and guarantee his family's income.

A loan would help Manuel to have a more solid economy, one that does not depend only on one source of income. It would also help him to receive an extra income, and start building a legacy for his family, and for the improvement of their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy covers, nylon, tomato plants, organic fertilizers, an irrigation system, and other materials he needs to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Frister

texts.en:
Frister is a kiva borrower. She has 3 children and describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, carrots, onions. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, carrots. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, carrots

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 47-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working married man who owns a retail shop he opened four years ago. He started his business by growing tomatoes and sewing torn clothes for people around his village.This enabled him get capital to open a retail shop to improve his family’s standard of living.
Wilson also needed to increase his income and educate his children to higher levels.

His business is doing pretty well and he desires to expand his shop into a wholesale and modern store. His business suffers from the high rate of defaulters and the purchase of expired items.

Wilson hopes to use the loan to stock more general merchandise like soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to stock more general merchandise like soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es: Laura de 19 años emprendió su negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios en el año 2012, con la finalidad de generar sus propios ingresos y costear su carrera técnica, sus padres se han dedicado a esta misma actividad por años y la apoyaron en su proyecto de negocio.  Laura es madre soltera de una bebe de apenas ocho meses de nacida y su vida ha dado un giro extraordinario, su amor y entrega a ese nuevo ser es el motor que la impulsa a buscar oportunidades que le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida y garantizarle a su hija un futuro promisorio. Como en su negocio un factor importante es mantenerse a la vanguardia de las tecnologías y accesorios, ella necesita de un capital de inversión que respalde sus proyectos, es por ello que encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para financiar sus compras de celulares de alta gama y accesorios: audífonos, carcasas, protectores, protectores de pantalla y demás. Su meta es culminar sus estudios y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
19-year old Laura learned about selling cell phones and accessories in 2012 so that she had a way of earning her own money and paying for her technical training. Her parents had the same kind of job for years, and they helped her with this business proposition.

Laura is a single mother with a baby just eight months old. Her life has taken an extraordinary turn. Her love for and dedication to this new human being is what drives her to seek opportunities that allow her to improve her standard of living and guarantee her daughter a bright future.

In her business an important factor is keep up with technological advances and the latest accessories, so Laura needs a loan that will support her activities. She found that a Kiva loan would give her the opportunity to connect her to financial assistance through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, enabling her to buy a wide range of cell phones and accessories: headphones, cases, screen protectors etc. Laura's goals are to complete her studies and grow her business.

loans.use: buy a wide range of cell phones and accessories: headphones, cases, screen protectors etc.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, a 31-year-old married man, has a transport business. He started this business three years ago with the goal of making some profit and educating his children. His greatest dreams are to improve his standard of living and to have many taxis on the road.

However, he faces the challenges of inadequate capital to buy more taxis to take other routes, poor roads that lead to quickly damaged cars, and high prices for spare parts.

Johnson hopes to expand his business and become a prominent businessman. He is requesting this loan to buy another car for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy another car for his transport business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 44-year-old married woman with children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She sells a type of footwear locally known as "bagagawale" which means "prosperity for all", everyone should put on shoes, even those at the lowest income level. This business has worked for her since the shoes are cheap for low-earners and, out of the proceeds, Margret is able to provide basics for the family supplemented by the husband's earnings. She is faced with the challenge of small capital to diversify her business to include a variety of shoes. Margret wants a loan to buy more rubber shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rubber shoes to sell.

loans.name: Coleb

texts.en:
Coleb is a 38-year-old married man with 7 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a business man dealing in the sale of coffee seeds, and he also offers a service for milling cassava in his village. He started these businesses way back in 2000 with the hope of earning an income and improving his family's standard of living.

Coleb is faced with the challenge of fluctuating coffee prices that hinder him from expanding. However, he is looking at buying a pick-up for easy transportation of coffee to markets.

He has asked for a loan to help him buy coffee seeds to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds to sell.

loans.name: Muriuki

texts.en:
Muriuki is a single mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Muriuki has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Muriuki dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 38 years old and has two children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. To provide for her two children she went into a rag-making business and her earnings cover their everyday needs and expenditures. She also sells ice scramble at a school near their house.

Candida's products range from round palm-sized rags to much larger doormats. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rags are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway.

Candida requested a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed to produce more rags. She will use part of the loan to purchase powdered flavored candies and ice to make her ice scramble. In the future, she hopes to produce a bigger volume of rags.

Candida meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cloths, needles, thread,  and other material used to make rags and powdered candy flavored to make ice scramble.

loans.name: Agilea

texts.en:
Agilea is 60 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Agilea runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Agilea has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell at her general store.

loans.name: Dilafruzjon

texts.en:
Dilafruzjon was born in 1984. She is married to the father of her 4 children. Dilafruzjon’s husband works in a state organization. His salary is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessary things. For this reason, 6 years ago, Dilafruzjon began a business by offering sewing services.

She sews a variety of national women's clothes. Dilafruzjon is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine to make better quality products as her present sewing machine works with low quality.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make better quality products.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael Angel , tiene la edad de 58 años, esta casada, vive con la esposa. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijoles  de buena calidad y que se adapte adecuadamente a las condiciones de suelo y clima de la zona, además que tenga una buena característica de cosecha adecuada al igual que el rendimiento del producto final, además de algunos fertilizantes para aplicarle al cultivo de frijoles, también realizar algunos trabajos de labores culturales como lo son la conservación de suelos por medio de realización de canales a nivel para que el agua de lluvia no pueda realizar lavados, principalmente en las partes con mas pendientes, con estas nuevas prácticas de trabajo espera cumplir con el objetivo de tener una plantación con mejor sanidad y un suelo con mas fertilidad y por ende una mejor cosecha. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
58-year old Rafael Angel is married and lives with his wife.

With his loan he plans to buy good quality beans to sow, beans that will adapt well to the soil conditions, local climate, and produce a good harvest and high yield. As well Rafael wishes to buy fertilizer to apply to the plants. He plans to work in the traditional way so as to conserve the land by making level channels ensuring that rainwater doesn't cause washouts particularly on steep slopes. With these new ways of working, Rafael expects to fulfill his objective of having healthier fields and more fertile soil resulting in a better harvest.

By buying appropriate products he will have a better-quality product for the consumer.

This is Rafel's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing him with easy terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy beans to sow and hire laborers

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene  seis hijos, vive con los hijos y la conyugue en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Luis  se dedica  a la siembra de papas, maíz, trigo, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas abonos fertilizantes y animales ademas papas, cebada y trigo. 

Lo que a el mas le gusta es pasar con los hijos y le fasina el carnaval.

Es un hombre muy responsable en su hogar y con la familia.
texts.en:
Luis has six children. He lives with them and with his partner in the city of Guaranda.

Luis grows potatoes, corn, and wheat. He also raises cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, animals, potatoes, barley, and wheat.

The thing he likes the most is spending time with his children, and he loves the city's carnival. He is a very responsible man towards his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, animals, potatoes, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María es madre soltera tiene 32 años de edad tiene una hija de 4 años de edad, vive en casa de la hermana junto a su hija en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, trigo y cebda y crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes ademas desea comprar pollos . 

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades de los animales y las plagas de los animales.

El sueña con tener un terreno para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María is a single mother. She is 32 and has a 4 year old daughter. She lives at her sister's, along with her daughter, in the city of Guaranda, province of Bolívar.

María makes a living through farming, growing potatoes, wheat and barely and raising chickens. She requests this loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers and she also would like to buy some chickens.

The challenges she faces are the animal diseases and pests.

She dreams of having a piece of land to continue working.

loans.use: to buy cattle and vaccines.

loans.name: Walter Josue

texts.es:
Walter Josué es un joven que junto con su padre se dedica al cultivo de diferentes productos de origen agrícola sus principales cultivos son el café y productos de hortaliza como ser: tomates, lechugas y repollos, Walter Josué tiene deseos de ganar experiencia en la producción agrícola 100% orgánica.
Walter Josué está interesado en la construcción de un invernadero para cultivar tomates orgánicos y de esta manera presentar opciones de alimentación saludables a las personas y así cuidar la salud de la gente y del planeta, Walter Josué quiere llevar a cabo el proyecto bajo el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Walter Josué ya tiene un mercado con COCAFCAL para su producto por lo cual quiere iniciar con el trabajo lo antes posible.
Walter Josué solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores en su invernadero y de esta manera empezar a cosechar tomate lo más pronto posible, con las ganancias obtenidas por el producto vendido Walter Josué espera ayudar a sus padres para que mejoren su calidad de vida.
Un crédito ayudara a Walter Josué a tener un invernadero propio para trabajar y obtener ingresos suficientes para ayudar a las necesidades de sus padres y sobre todo le ayudara a obtener más experiencia en el trabajo con invernaderos.
texts.en:
Walter Josué is a youth who together with his father works in growing different agricultural products. Their main crops are coffee and market garden crops like tomatoes, lettuce and cabbage.

Walter Josué wants to gain experience in 100% organic agricultural production. Walter Josué is interested in the construction of a greenhouse to grow organic tomatoes. In this way he can offer healthy food options for people and thereby care for the health of people and the planet. Walter Josué wants to carry out the project with the technical support of COCAFCAL of which he is a member. Walter Josué already has a market for his product in COCAFCA, so he wants to start the work as soon as he can.

Walter Josué is requesting a loan to start his work on his greenhouse and in this way start to harvest tomatoes as soon as possible. With the profit obtained selling his product Walter Josué hopes to help his parents improve their quality of living.

A loan will help Walter Josué to have his own greenhouse and obtain enough money to help with the needs of his parents and most important help him to obtain more experience in working with greenhouses.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, tomato plants, an irrigation system, nylon, plastic and other materials needed to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene a sus 57 años de edad muestra cada día sus ganas de salir adelante, actualmente se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, lo que le permite salir adelante y sostener a su familia. Él vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 18 años de edad a la que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Rene desea construir un construir una galera en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, alambre y mano de obra para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rene, 57, makes it clear every day that he wants to get ahead. He is currently working selling fruits and vegetables, which helps him to get ahead and sustain his family. He lives with his life partner and his 18-year-old daughter, whom he has managed to raise with lots of effort.

Rene wants to build a room at home, which is why he is applying for a loan at FUSAI. He will use it to buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and wire, and pay for the labor needed to build the room.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails, wire, and pay for the labor needed to build a room at home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elisabeth  tiene la edad de 51 años, está casada    y vive con  el esposo y un hijo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de dos  vacas de leche   .Ella  espera poder obtener más leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 51 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her child. She needs the loan to buy two milk cows. She wants to obtain more milk and cheese to sell to businesses and neighbors and fatten their offspring and sell them at an ideal weight and thereby obtain greater economic income. She hopes to provide her family with a higher quality of living and greater economic stability in the future and be able to continue to grow.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any loan previously from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with better terms and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
maria tiene 42 años de edad ella es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos,  se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, ocas, melloco, a demas tiene vacas lecheras, ovejas y caballos el dienro solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes y alimento para los animales.

Con las vaquitas ha podida dedicarse a la comercializacion de quesos ya que en nuestra provincia las personas consumimos mucho queso.

en los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and she is part of the Ventanilla Los Pinos communal bank. They work in agriculture and are 40 minutes away from the Pangua community office.

She makes a living growing potatoes, "ocas" and "mellocos" (root vegetables). In addition, she has dairy cows, sheep and horses. She is requesting the funds to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers and food for the animals. With the cows she could sell cheeses since the residents of this province consume a lot of cheese. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers, and food for the animals.

loans.name: Ronaldo De La Trinidad

texts.es: Ronaldo  tiene la edad de 22 años, está soltero  y vive con los padres actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is 22, single and currently lives with his parents. He wants this loan to buy tree seedlings and fertilizer and to help with a coffee plantation that they want to start. He wants to properly care for the crop in order to obtain better yields and, in turn, greater financial returns.

He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more financial security in the future. He also hopes to continue to grow as a person and a farmer.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never gotten loans from the national banks but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tree seedlings and supplies.

loans.name: Renefe

texts.en: Renefe is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She helps in providing for their daily needs by helping her husband through buying and selling home products in her village. After one year of running this business, she earns well enough to provide for her needs. With her micro-finance loan taken from GDMPC, she has bought more products like plastic plates, glasses, and water containers for resale. In the future, Renefe wants to see her business sustained and she wants to ensure a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic wares to sell.

location.town: Souht Westen Poblacion Calamba Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Nestor Vinicio

texts.es:
Nestor tiene 18 años es soltero se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas trigo y ademas tiene animales como vaca, chanchos y cuyes.

El credito lo solicta para la compra de semillas y alimento para los animales.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nestor is 18 years old, single, and makes a living from agriculture. He plants potatoes and wheat and has animals, such as cows, pigs, and guinea pigs.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and food for his animals.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and food for his animals.

loans.name: Elsa Morena

texts.es: Elsa de 47 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida. Elsa es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de productos helados como sorbetes, además de eso presta sus servicios domésticos lavando ropa en diferentes viviendas de su comunidad. Labor que realiza desde hace algún tiempo, y gracias a ello puede mantener la economía del hogar y también gracias a la ayuda que le brinda su compañero de vida. Elsa en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para construir las paredes de la parte delantera de su hogar, de esta forma ir mejorando poco a poco su hogar y así también su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. Elsa is a hardworking woman who sells ice cream products, such as sorbet. In addition, she offers domestic services doing the laundry in different houses in her community. She has been doing this type of work for a while. Thanks to this, she has been able to maintain the finances of her house, and also thanks to the help provided by her life partner.

Elsa is looking to improve her quality of life and is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, bricks and to pay the manual labor to build the walls of the front of her house. This way she can improve her house little by little and also her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, bricks and to pay manual labor to build walls for the front of her home.

loans.name: Karla Sarai

texts.es: Karla es una joven de 21 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde hace 3 años, además se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos para obtener mejores ingresos. Ella vive con sus padres en la casa de estos desde que era una niña, por lo que siempre busca la manera de apoyarles con los gastos de su hogar. Karla desea reparar el cuarto de la cocina, ya que las láminas con las que está construido se encuentra muy deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, cuartones de madera, clavos y alambre para reconstruir el cuarto de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Karla is a 21 year old young woman who has been making a living selling basic grains such as corn and bean for the past 3 years. She also makes a living by doing housework to get better income.

She lives with her parents at their house since she was a little girl, so she is always looking for ways to support them with their home expenses.

Karla would like to repair the kitchen, given the sheets with which it's built are very damaged, so she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheets, wood scantlings, nails and wire to rebuild the kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in sheet, wood scantlings, nails and wire to rebuild the kitchen.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single woman. She has one child. She operates a farm where she grows onions, cabbages and carrots. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes. 10,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
As a parent, Charlene works hard to support her family.

She has a shell craft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Charlene is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more shells and other supplies to use in her business.

Charlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shells and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 50 years old now.

Josephine has a internet café business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy a monitor, mouse, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a monitor, mouse, etc.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elias  tiene la edad de 53 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una novilla. El espera poder obtener crías y engordarlas y poder venderlas con el peso ideal   así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elias is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife. He needs the loan to buy a heifer. He hopes to take the offspring and fatten them to sell them at an ideal weight to obtain greater economic income. He hopes to provide his family a higher quality of living and greater economic stability in the future and to be able to continue to grow.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Zoila Yanira

texts.es: Zoila de 52 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida. Zoila es una mujer trabajadora que para poder obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas, este negocio lo ha administrado desde hace varios años lo que le permite contar con un número bastante grande de clientes que la prefieren. Zoila en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para finalizar la construcción de su hogar, proyecto que con anterioridad había empezado y por falta de liquidez económica no había podido finalizar. Y es por lo que acude a FUSAI para poder solventar dicho contratiempo.
texts.en:
Zoila is 52 years old and she lives in her own home with her life partner. Zoila is a hardworking woman. To be able obtain the necessary financial income to cover the household expenses, she works selling traditional meals. She has managed this business for various years, allowing her to have a significant number of customers that prefer her meals.

Zoila is trying to improve her quality of life and is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sand, cement and to pay the manual labor to finish building her home. This is a project she had started before, but due to the lack of economic resources, she was not able to finish. For this reason, she is reaching out to FUSAI to be able to resolve this setback.

loans.use: to invest in: sand, cement and to pay manual labor to finish building her home.

loans.name: Dado's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Juillet 2008 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture pendant l’hivernage. 

Madame Dado, âgée de 39 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée et en médaillon), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont 02 garçons et 06 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (riz huile raffiné et huile de palme du savon et d’autres condiments) qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sac de 50 kg de riz 02 bouteille de 20 litre raffiné et d’huile de palme, 02 cartons de 24 morceaux de savon de 250g  et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détail dans son village.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The group was founded in 2008 and its members share a strong sense of connection with one another. They cultivate relationships based on solidarity and mutual aid. They are mostly involved in the small-scale sales of goods and agricultural work during the rainy season. 

Madame Dado, aged 39 (sitting down with an arm raised in the far right of the photo), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of eight children, two boys and six girls. She is involved in the sales of food products (rice, refined palm oil, as well as soaps and other products), which she buys from the weekly markets. 

With this loan she plans to buy two 50 kg bags of rice, two 20 L bottles of refined palm oil, two cartons of twenty-four 250 g pieces of soap and other products, which she will then sell in her village.

The earnings will help her pay for everyday expenses and will strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy two 50 kg bags of rice, two 20 L bottles of refined palm oil, two cartons of twenty-four 250 g pieces of soap and other products.

loans.name: Artesanía Laureles Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosa una mujer sumamente muy responsable, seria pero muy trabajadora ella tiene 47 años de edad está casada desde hace 27 años con el señor José Vichis quien se dedica a la construcción de casas juntos formaron una familia con dos hijos de los cuales ya ninguno depende de dicha pareja.
Platica que tiene 20 años tiene un taller de bordado mazahua, dice que la inicio su negocio por necesidad, por querer ayudar en los gastos de su hogar y educación de sus hijos y además porque gran parte de la población se dedica a elaborar este tipo de artesanía.
En su taller ellos elaboran la prenda como colchas, bolsas, tapetes, edredones, chalecos, etc. Las cuales son elaboradas con tela estambrón o de lana, Pero ellas a mano elaboran el bordado mazahua sobre estas prendas, gracias a su experiencia y su buen  trabajo recomendado ahora ella es instructora de bordado mazahua.
“Con este préstamo podremos comprar materia prima como la tela, hilos estambres, agujas para elaborar mas prendas” Comento Doña Rosa es su primer crédito en VFMéxico se entero porque precisamente ella capacito a unas clientas VFMéxico por eso mismo le llamo la atención de solicitar crédito.
Ahora que llega temporadas de fríos debe trabajar muy fuerte porque son temporadas muy buenas, aunque dice que su dificultad es la falta de mercado en donde poder vender su artesanía. Además porque solo se vende cuando es invierno pero también Doña Rosa está pensado en realizar prendas para tiempos de calor sin olvidar el bordado mazahua.
Una de sus metas es hacer crecer su negocio y poder exportar su artesanía a otros Estados de la República Mexicana.
Los integrantes del grupo son Juliana, Martha, José Manuel quienes invertirán para la elaboración artesanal.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very responsible, serious and hardworking woman. She is 47 years old, and has been married for 27 years to José Vichis who works in the construction of houses. Together they formed a family with two children, neither of whom currently depends on their parents. She states that for 20 years she has had a Mazahua embroidery shop. She says she began her business out of necessity because she wanted to help with the expenses of the home and the education of their children. Also, a large part of the population works making this type of handicraft. In her shop they make items such as bedspreads, bags, rugs, quilts, vests, etc. They are made of worsted yarn or wool. They put Mazahua embroidery by hand on these items. Thanks to her experience and her good, recommended work, Rosa is now an instructor of Mazahua embroidery.

[More info on surroundings and client]

"With this loan we will be able to buy raw material like fabric, worsted yarns and needles to make more items," Rosa says. This is her first loan with VF México. She found out about it because she just trained some VF México borrowers, which drew her attention to seeking a loan herself. Now that the cold season is arriving, she must work very hard because these are very good times, and because she only sells in the winter. She says her difficulty is the lack of a market where she can sell her handicrafts. Rosa is thinking about making items for the hot weather too, without ignoring Mazahua embroidery. One of her goals is to make her business grow and to be able to export her handicrafts to other states in the Mexican Republic. The members of the group are Juliana, Martha and José Manuel who will invest in the making of handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, worsted yarns and needles.

location.town: Mina Vieja, San Flipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: Ma. Linda lives a simple life with her family in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and blessed with two daughters ages 10 and 5 years old. Early this year, Ma. Linda and her husband successfully started their handicraft business. They made fashion bags from sea shells. Thus, they need an additional capital to buy sea shells in making bags. That is why, she is asking for loan to help them finance for the materials to enhance their business. Additionally, you can help this woman improve her handicraft fashion bags business through the money CEVI entrusted to them.

loans.use: to buy sea shells

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is a married woman who lives in Tubigon, Bohol. She is 48 years old and earns a living by selling dry goods such as pails, plastic bowls, glass, ribbons, belts, shades and religious items etc. Her husband is helping her in running this business. They have been successfully started these two years ago.  Andresa is asking for a loan to buy the additional items mentioned earlier to help them augment their livelihood. Thus, she wants to improve their business in the future for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy pails, plastic bowls, glass, ribbons, belts, shades and religious items etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like root crops vending.

Gina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Rukmani's Group

texts.en: Rukmani is a widow and hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. Rukmani, standing in the middle in the photograph, counts herself as being unlucky as she could not continue her education beyond class VIII due to the financial constraints of her family. However, she has promised not to let the same fate befall her two sons and her daughter, for whom she wants to ensure a quality education, no matter what the price. It is with this single-minded objective in mind that she started weaving tablecloths and bed sheets and started supplying garments to the local market. Today, she is not only the preferred supplier of many wholesale and retail traders in the district, but she also fulfills bulk orders and retail orders from local folks too. Now, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR to scale up her business operations and increase her output. She will use her portion of the loan amount to repair her weaving machine for smooth running of her business and buy additional stock of colorful threads and fabrics. Her confidence and her conviction are sure to take her to great heights.

loans.use: to repair her weaving machine for smooth running of her business and buy additional stock of colorful threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a young man who has a barber shop, which has been open for the past seven years. He now has good experience and is well known in his city, Gaza City. Khalil loves his job and always thinks how to improve it. Khalil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and materials for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and materials for his barber shop.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is a 36-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has a 10-year-old son. Her husband is a Carpenter while Merlyn operates various businesses such as running a sari-sari store (general store), sells vegetables and raises pigs. Merlyn describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient capital. And that is the reason why she is asking for a bigger amount of loans. She will use the money to buy grocery items such as sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies. She will also buy feed to enhance the growth of her pigs. Her goal in life is to let her son finish his studies. Hence, Merlyn will be thankful with the people who can help her make her dreams come true. By giving her the amount she is requesting we can possibly help her reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies; feed

loans.name: Aksamina

texts.en:
Aksamina, 41, is a married woman living with her husband, Imanuel, a 47-year-old civil service worker. They have 3 children: Roby, 19, who has graduated from high school, Irma 17, in the third year of senior high school, and Febri 13, in first year of junior high school.

Aksamina owns a business of selling cakes at home. The business aims to help support her husband in meeting her family’s daily living and to providing the proper education for them as well.

Aksamina was thinking of producing and selling cakes in larger quantities, but she needs more money to make it happen. A neighbor introduced her to the loan product provided by TLM. She was very enthusiastic and she then applied the loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to buy more baking ingredients such as sugar, wheat, butter, cooking oil, etc.

She thanks Kiva, who has contributed to help her and the other borrowers. She believes the loan provided by Kiva; through TLM will give benefits for the business continuity.

loans.use: to buy more baking ingredients such as sugar, wheat, butter, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a married man with one child. he operates a retail business where he sells fish and charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. he says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

Alphonce will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and charcoal. he hopes that in the future he can open another business outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and charcoal.

loans.name: Clara Piedad

texts.es:
Clara tiene 23 años de edad es soltera vivie con los padres,

Clara es una mujer joven que se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, ocas, mellocos y maiz ademas tiene animales como: vacas, ovejas y cuyes, el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes ademas necesita compara mas animales y alimento para los animales.

Ella suñeña con tener un terreno propio y seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Clara is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents.

Clara is a young woman who makes a living in agriculture growing potatoes, oca (an Andean tuber), ulluco and corn. She also has animals such as cows, sheep and guinea pigs.

She requests a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers and she also needs to buy more animals and animal feed.

She dreams of having her own piece of land and continue farming.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell animal feeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and rice retailing.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy stocks of animal feeds to sell to her stall.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of animal feeds to sell to her stall

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Don Miguel de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 25 años al cultivo de maiz, maicillo y frijol la cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus productos a los comerciantes que viven cerca de su lugar de residencia y ya tiene clientes establecidos, Don Miguel esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Don Miguel, who is 57 years old, lives in a house that he owns with his wife. He has worked for 25 years farming maize, sorghum, and bean, which he started with his own capital. He sells his products to the retailers who live close to his place of residence, and he has fixed clients. Miguel is asking for a loan to buy fertlizer, pest control, etc., and be able to have a good yield and therefore a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio es un hombre que a sus 33 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad la cual logro terminar de construir con un crédito solicitado anteriormente, en la que habita junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad. Él mostrando sus deseos de sacar adelante a su familia, se gana la vida desde hace 11 años en un taller de estructuras metálicas, lo que le permite sostener su hogar. Mauricio desea construir la pila y el baño de su vivienda, ya que esta carece de estos servicios básicos en un hogar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pila y el baño de su vivienda, ya que al no contar con ellos su vivienda carece de la sanidad adecuada.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a 33 year old man who lives in his own home, that he was able to finish building with the previous the loan that he received. He lives with his life partner and their two children, ages 11 and 4.
He desires to provide for his family and has earned a living for 11 years working in a metal structures workshop. This has allowed him to support his home.
Mauricio wants to build a sink and a toilet in his house, as he lacks these basic services in his home. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a sink and a toilet in his house. This will help him to have an adequate level of sanitation is his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a sink and a toilet in his house.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 35 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad. Norma se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, con lo cual logra apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este ingreso económico. Norma desea construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda, ya que actualmente solo cuenta con uno de fosa, que deja malos olores en su vivienda, que están causando enfermedades a su familia, por la contaminación del aire, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, inodoro, hierro y ladrillo para construir el servicio sanitario de su vivienda y cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en: Norma is a hardworking woman of thirty five who lives with her partner and their two children aged six and fourteen. For the last four years Norma has made a living selling beauty products from a catalogue. This allows her to support her partner with household expenses; she is very happy to be able to rely on this source of income. Norma would like to build a bathroom in her house. At the moment there is only a latrine which leaves a bad smell in her house, contaminating the air and causing illness in her family. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, a toilet, reinforcement steel and bricks to build a bathroom in her house and take care of the health of her household.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, a toilet, reinforcement steel and bricks to build a bathroom for her house.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La socia Nicolasa sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores. La socia es muy dedicada a su trabajo y por eso está logrando salir adelante junto con su familia que le impulsa día a día.
La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas que le permitan tener una mejor producción.
La socia agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella y asegura que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente
texts.en:
Nicolasa continues working in agriculture and in the raising of small animals. She is very dedicated to her work and for this reason she has succeeded in moving forward together with her family that inspires her every day.

Nicolasa needs this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, thus allowing her to have better production. She is thankful to the Kiva investors for their confidence in her and she assures that she will make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: Sekanabo est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Aksante Mungu», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 3 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse d’arachides dans la rue de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 85kg d’arachides. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sekanabo is a retailer, a customer of the MFI Hekima, and a member of the "Aksante Mungu" loan group. She is married, 35 years old, and the mother of 3 children who attend school.

She has been selling groundnuts on a street in town for 10 years. She will buy 85 kilos of groundnuts. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 85 kilos of groundnuts.

loans.name: Melvin De Los Angeles

texts.es: Melvin   tiene la edad de 27 años, está en unión libre   y vive con  la esposa   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una novilla. El espera poder obtener crías y engordarlas y poder venderlas con el peso ideal   así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Melvin is 27 years old. He lives in common law with his partner. He wants the loan to buy a young cow.  He hopes to be able to raise it and fatten it to sell it at an ideal weight and have more income.  He hopes in the future to be able to provide his family a better quality of life and more economic stability to continue growing.  This is the first loan he gets from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with more facilities and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 58-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has nine children; six adult and three school aged children. Her husband is a fisherman while Helen operates various businesses such as vegetable selling (out from her harvest), food selling, and fishing. Helen describes her biggest business challenge is to have insufficient capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a bigger amount of loans. She will buy fertilizer for their plants and additional vegetables to sell. She will also buy food ingredients such as meat, spices and cooking oil. Helen’s main goal in life is to augment their livelihood as to own a sari-sari store in the future. She also wants to repair their house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for their plants and additional vegetables to sell; food ingredients such as meat, spices and cooking oil

loans.name: Mizero Group

texts.fr:
Fidèle  fait partie du groupe  Mizero et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 53 ans et est marié à Jeanne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, dont  1 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants orphelins qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de bière   depuis  16 ans. 

Il est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière à revendre  dans son bistrot pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait devenir un grossiste  de vente de bière.
texts.en:
Fidèle is a member of the group called Mizero, and he lives in Gitega. He is 53 and married to Jeanne, a farmer. Together they have four children. One of them is enrolled in school. He is also responsible for two orphans who are enrolled in school. He has been selling beer for 16 years.

Fidèle is on his sixth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he has requested, he will grow his working capital and buy a lot of cases of beer to resell in his bar so that he can earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler of beer.

loans.use: to grow his working capital and buy a lot of cases of beer for resale in his bar so he can earn more.

loans.name: Ebele's Group

texts.en:
Ebele is 38 years old and she is engaged in full-time palm oil processing. This is a trade she has known since her youth, but because of limited capital, she finds it very difficult to meet her annual family responsibilities.

As a single mother, she has the responsibility of taking care of her three children living with her.

Since she joined Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society, she has learned to save through our weekly Osusu contribution, and this has helped her to manage her income wisely. This loan will help her and her group members to increase production this season, so as to be able to increase her income and support her family.

Thanks to all Kiva lenders who find time to read through and support this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Malititi  -  Masaka Bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Safura is a hardworking 57-year-old woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. She is married and has six children. Safura is the individual in the middle of the photo with both hands raised among members seated. Safura is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for a decade now. The name of the group is 'Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla'. Safura earns a good profit from her shea butter business. She sells her products in the local markets and sometimes to exporters.
Safura and Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla Group have asked for a third cycle loan of GHS 12,450.00, after having successfully paid-off a previous loan of same amount. Safura’s share of the loan is GHS 500.00, which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Safura aspires to earn more income and expand her business as well as to repay this loan and support her family. Safura thanks Kiva lenders for their continuous support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing to get more income to grow her business.

loans.name: Zamaria Zarahi

texts.es: Zamaria, es madre soltera, desea un crédito para terminar su casa, y tener un patrimonio propio para ella y su hija, es una persona trabajadora, responsable y comprometida; ella maneja su propio negocio que consiste en una estética y salón de belleza.
texts.en: Zamaria is a single mother who is seeking a loan to finish building her home and have a legacy for her and her daughter. She is a hardworking, responsible and committed woman. She runs her own cosmetics business and beauty salon.

loans.use: pay for materials and construction expenses to finish building her home.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia es una mujer luchadora y continua dedicándose a su negocio de siembra y cosecha de verduras, para poderlo vender en los distintos mercados.
Como la socia quiere salir adelante desea producir más y mejor para eso ella solicito el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas.
La socia esta agradecida con los inversionista de KIVA por confiar en ella y brindarle el crédito, por ello se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Lucia is a determined woman who continues to work at her business of growing and harvesting vegetables to be able to sell them in the different markets.

Since she wishes to move forward and produce more and better vegetables, she is requesting a loan to buy manure and seeds.

Lucia is thankful to the Kiva investors for their confidence in her and providing her with the loan. She commits to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa, aged 48, is from the province of Dasmarinas, Cavite. She is married to Ramon, a businessman, and has three children. She has run a funeral parlor for eleven years, which has helped fund her family's personal and household needs.

She is requesting funds in the amount of PHP 10,000 to pay for materials such as wood, iron, nails, glue, and paint to make caskets. Her funeral parlor has established a good reputation for rendering good service in her community. Your valued help will be highly appreciated, as it will enable her to continue the services of her parlor.

Nimfa hopes to expand her services at her funeral parlor to better serve the needs of her town. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make caskets and for other costs incurred in her funeral parlor.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Noralyn has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Aydee Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Aydee continua dedicándose a sus negocios de crianza de animales menores y a la venta de verduras, con estas dos actividades está logrando sacar adelante a su familia.
La socia es muy trabajadora y emprendedora se dedica gran parte del día a sus negocios, ella desea mejorar su producción y por eso solicito el préstamo para comprar gallinas y cuyes.
La socia está satisfecha y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito asignado, y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas en los días acordados.
texts.en:
Aydee continues working at her business of raising small animals and selling vegetables. With these two occupations, she manages to support her family.

She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who dedicates most of the day to her businesses. She wishes to improve her production, and for this reason is requesting a loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

Aydee paid off her previous loan and she appreciates the Kiva investors for the loan. She promises to make her payments at the scheduled times.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 32 years old and single. He lives in Pan-ay Diot, Clarin with his parents. He wanted to help his parents meet the family's needs, so he engaged in a transport business to earn income.

His previous loan was successfully repaid, and he is accessing another loan. He requested the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle. This will allow him to continue to transport passengers and generate more income.

In the future, Eric plans to save money from his business and continue to sustain his parents' needs and to settle down.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a M-pesa business and a general shop where she sells bread, soda, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float and to buy more stock of bread, flour, soda, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float and to buy more stock of bread, flour, soda, and other items.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
