Linda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Linda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anicia

texts.en:
Anicia is 41 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anicia has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Anicia requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thanking Kiva and its lenders for their continuous support of her livelihood. The loans granted to her have really sustained her burger house. Her earnings helped cover her family's daily sustenance.

To expand her burger house, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy several dozen buns, hamburgers and hot dogs, as well as oil and fuel needed to make more sandwiches and serve more customers. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she increases her business. This will allow her to support her loved ones.

Erlinda aims to open branches in the nearby towns. She hopes to buy a vehicle and to buy a house and a car someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for buns, burgers and hot dogs to sell at her burger stand, as well as oil and fuel to prepare them.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda operates a general store which she has been doing for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for sustaining her family's basic needs.

Belinda's dream is to see all her children go to college and her store to become a big grocery. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a multicab transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Judith is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her multicab transport business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her multicab transport business.

loans.name: Maria Evelyn

texts.en:
Maria Evelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Maria Evelyn has a buy-and-sell purchase card business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more purchase cards to sell.

In the future, Maria Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more purchase cards to sell.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella continúa dedicándose  a vender productos artesanales. La socia esta ya mucho tiempo en este negocio y aporta a su familia.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar chalinas, guantes y chompas para poder ofrecer más productos a los turistas que son sus clientes.
la socia agradece a los inversionista de KIVA por confiar en ella, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a very hard-working woman. She continues to make a living selling artisan crafts. She has been working in this business for a long time and contributes to her family.

Alejandrina requested the loan to buy scarves, gloves and sweaters to be able to offer more products to the tourists that are her customers. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for believing in her, and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy scarves, gloves and sweaters.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: Irish, 32 years old, is married and has two children; the family lives in Liposong, Ozamiz. Irish has been selling farm products such as copra and corn in town. Her husband earns an income from driving. Irish has to earn an income for the family's basic needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase seedlings to grow. She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Irish hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He managed to buy a third motorcycle for transportation with his previous loan. Stephen has dealt in motorcycle transport for 10 years. He started this business with a little capital he got after using other people's motorcycles but later on acquired his own.

Stephen not only has a transport business but also does dairy farming, which earns him more income. His main challenges are theft, poor roads and high fuel and transportation costs. Besides these two businesses, Stephen is looking at constructing rentals in the future and educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Stephen has asked for another loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sugeivi Del Carmen

texts.es: Sugeivi de 26 años es habitante de Malambo, un municipio del Atlántico en donde reside en compañía de sus dos pequeños hijos y en su rol de madre soltera responsable de su crianza y sostenimiento, emprendió su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos motivada por su hermana quien también se desempeña en esta actividad y que ha sido su principal apoyo, al no contar con un cónyuge que le aporte a los gastos en el hogar.  Alternamente también oferta productos por catalogos especializados y en su vivienda tiene una vitrina surtida de productos de tocador, peluquería y aseo personal. Sus compras de electrodomésticos las realiza en almacenes de cadena donde encuentra promociones, además de ser financiados por créditos que maneja su hermana, sin embargo ella desea vincularse a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en encargos de su clientela: neveras, lavadoras, televisores, hornos y demás. Esta inversión le permitirá responder oportunamente a las solicitudes de sus clientes y tener menos imprevistos. Su meta a futuro es aumentar su clientela y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sugeivi is 26 years old and is a resident of Malambo, a municipality in Atlántico department where she lives in the company of her two small children. In her role of a single mother responsible for raising and sustaining her children she started a business of selling appliances She was motivated by her sister who also works in this business and has been her main support, not counting her spouse who contributes to the household expenses. On the side, she also offers products from specialty catalogs. And in her home, she has a cabinet stocked with various products related to hairdressing, toiletries, and personal products which she sells. She makes her appliance purchases from chain stores when they are on sale. Besides being financed by loans that her sister manages she wants to be connected to a loan from Kiva, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in orders from her clients: fridges, washing machines, televisions, ovens and others.

This investment will allow her to respond opportunely to requests from clients and have less unexpected orders. Her goal in the future is to increase her clientele and improve her quality of living

loans.use: to invest in orders from her clients: fridges, washing machines, televisions, ovens and others.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 38 years old, is married and has six children, two of them in school. Alma works very hard to provide for them. For the past three years, Alma has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as coffee, junk foods, biscuits, juice, salt, oil, sugar, soy sauce and groceries.

Alma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 32-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of selling scrap for bicycles and repairing them. He has been doing this kind of business for four years now. He started with very little capital, but kept on growing slowly by slowly.

Francis is hindered by inadequate capital in his dream of constructing a permanent residential house.

Francis has asked for a loan to help him buy scrap items to sell.

loans.use: to buy scrap items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a 47-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Rael has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business. Rael is requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Geraldine Odett

texts.es:
La socia Geraldine esta una joven trabajadora y emprendedora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de productos artesanales, tales como chompas de alpaca, chalinas y chullos, que son típicos de la región del Cusco.
La socia Geraldine solicito el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y tener más variedades de productos en su stand. Ella necesita comprar chullos y ponchos.
la socia está satisfecha con el préstamo dado por los inversionista de KIVA y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas
texts.en:
Geraldine is a hardworking and enterprising young woman. She continues to make a living in the sale of artisanal products, such as alpaca sweaters, scarves and chullos [Peruvian style hats], which are typical of the Cusco region.

Geraldine requested the loan to expand her business and to have more variety in the products at her stand. She needs to buy chullos and ponchos.

Geraldine is happy with the loan given by the Kiva lenders and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy Peruvian style hats and ponchos.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has one child. She describes herself to be honest. For the past four years, Grace has operated a retail business selling clothes. Her primary customers are locals. Grace describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is Grace's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 61 years old and married with seven children.

Bibiana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Bibiana has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Bibiana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa, age 46, is a local farmer from Battambang province and a married mother of three dependent children. Her family has a few businesses: selling traditional sweets, tailoring and radio repair, which earn them a decent income to support themselves.

Channa is now leading a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Channa will use her portion of the loan to buy ingredients to make traditional sweets to sell and to buy tools to support a radio repair business. She hopes to earn more income to make a better living and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools to support a radio repair business and to buy ingredients to make traditional sweets to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, 33 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past twelve years, Janeth has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Janeth has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as spices, sugar, coffee, milk, chips, soft drinks and other items, to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. Janeth aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as spices, sugar, coffee, milk, chips, soft drinks and other items, to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jenelyn requested her third loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of canned goods, egg, milk, coffee, chips, soft drinks, etc. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, egg, milk, coffee, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Rebecca dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of maize flour, maize, rice and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, maize, rice and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar , age 50, is a mother of four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, and it is the family's only source of income. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including thread, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally; however, due to lack of money he finds it difficult to make these purchases.

Munawar is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the necessary items with the help of the loan. Munawar is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and tailoring materials such as thread, needles, clothing, etc. for her husband's tailoring services.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
La socia Yesica es una persona muy trabajadora y continúa dedicándose a su negocio de Internet y teléfonos celulares, este negocio lo tiene en marcha ya varios años y le va muy bien, su deseo de sacar adelante a su familia la impulsa diariamente
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar repuestos de celulares. Para poder dar más opciones de compra a sus clientes y ampliar su negocio.
La socia Yesica está contenta con el préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
The member Yesica is a very hardworking person and she continues to run her Internet and cell phone business, which has been functioning for several years now and is doing very well. Her desire to make a living for her family motivates her every day. 

Yesica is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for cellphones, so she can offer more purchasing options to her customers and expand her business. 

Yesica is happy to have this loan and thanks the KIVA investors.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cellphones

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married and has two children. She describes herself to be patient. For the past four years, Josephine has operated a tailoring business where she makes sweaters. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more knitting materials. Josephine hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more knitting materials.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with one child. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, cooking oil, washing soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a favourable place and his primary customers are locals.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar, bread, cooking fat, and other items to sell. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, bread, cooking fat, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira, 43 years old, has six children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year, Elvira has had a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has two children. He is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing rice. He supplements his crop by buying from other farmers for selling. For extra income, he owns a retail shop and a beauty salon. Daniel started these businesses in 2007, and he had a vision of generating more income for his family. He faces a challenge of unpredictable weather changes especially the heavy rains that destroy his crops.

Daniel requested a loan, which he will use to purchase a rice garden harvest to sell. In future, he has hopes of building a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a rice garden harvest to sell.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en: Johana is a single man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a buy and sell livestock business.

Lolita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 45 years old now.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

Maribel has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Francisca is 25 years old now.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as, sugar, flour, vegetables, etc.

Francisca has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as, sugar, flour, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like needles, fabric, linen, etc.

Leonarda has been in this business for 39 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like needles, fabric, linen, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 26 years old and has one child, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, Margaret has operated a m-pesa (mobile money transfer business), serving people from a shop. She mentioned theft as a major challenge in her business. Margaret is requesting a loan to add a money float to her business.She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to add a money float to her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Jovita es una socia muy trabajadora que saca adelante a sus dos hijos, ella se sigue dedicándose a la venta de verduras en el mercado.
La socia solicito el préstamo para poder comprar zanahoria y tomates. Para poder ampliar su negocio ella lucha diario y conseguir su meta.
La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo que le otorgo los inversionista de KIVA. y se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas
texts.en:
The member Jovita is a hardworking person who is supporting her two children. She continues to sell vegetables at the market. 

She requested this loan to buy carrots and tomatoes. She works hard every day to expand her business and meet her goals. 

Jovita is very grateful for the loan offered to her by KIVA investors. She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a food kiosk where she makes tea, mandazi (donut-like pastries), and coffee to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are regular.

Teresiah says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food for her kiosk.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is so encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. They have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in her family's daily sustenance.

She is again humbly asking for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past two years which sustained her family's basic needs.

Ma. Dolores dreams of becoming a wholesaler of food products soon. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, 56 years old, is married and has two children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past thirty years, Alicia has had a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as lotion, etc. to sell. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as lotion to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, 39 years old, is married and has three children, one of them in school. Gemma works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, Gemma has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items. She has requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as condiments, noodles, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as condiments, noodles, home care products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años es soltera no tiene hijos vive sola.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas trigo, sebada ademas tiene animales como. chanchas, ganado, voregod y un poco de ganado el credito lo solicita para la compra de animales como vacas para que le produzcan leche y un poco de semillas.

El sueño de Maria es tener un poco mas de dinero para incrementar la produccion y poder sembrar mas cosas.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old, single, and has no children.

She is a farmer and raises potatoes, wheat, and barley and also has some animals such as pigs, cattle, and sheep. She is asking for a loan to buy some seeds and also some animals such as cows so they can produce milk.

Maria’s dream is to have a bit more money so she can increase her production and be able to plant a few more items.

loans.use: to buy livestock like cattle and some seeds.

loans.name: Yubu

texts.en: Yubu used his previous loan to buy feed for his pigs. For over four years, he has operated a taxi transport business with a hope of earning an income. He has a duty of looking after his household and paying school fees for his children. Yubu's main business challenges are the bad mechanical condition of his vehicle and bad roads that are impassable. However, he is looking at buying another vehicle for transport to boost his income and boosting his piggery project. Yubu has asked for a loan to carry out general repairs on his vehicle.

loans.use: to carry out general repairs on his vehicle.

loans.name: Dua's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dua, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been part of the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since 2006. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. After deducting costs, the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and a small saved amount. She wants to invest in raising breeding fishes but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the fish breeding. Selling the first breeding fish herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in raising breeding fishes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 29-year-old, married man from Tubas, Jinen City. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Ahmad has a farm for beekeeping and honey production in the city. It is an amazing business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the west bank is bad because of the latest conflict. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new beehives and breed them on the farm. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his efficiency and speed and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new beehives and breed them on the farm.

loans.name: Santander

texts.es: Santander de 56 años, creció en un humilde barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en donde la calidez humana de los habitantes los mantenía siempre en unión y en esta comunidad muchas personas se desempeñaban en la fabricación de almohadas, arte que aprendió de sus vecinos cuando era un adolecente y que adoptó para emprender su propio negocio.  Hoy en día lleva 30 años ofreciendo sus productos en diferentes municipios del departamento, los cuales visita con una frecuencia de cada ocho días, para realizar las entregas de productos y nuevamente la labor preventa. Santander desea aprovechar la temporada decembrina para elaborar cojines navideños y encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar este proyecto, así logrará comprar telas con decoraciones navideñas, hilos, esponjas de diferentes tipos y demás accesorios.  Esta inversión le permitirá responder a los pedidos de sus clientes y obtener excelentes utilidades.
texts.en:
Santander is 56 years old, and grew up in a humble neighbourhood in the city of Barranquilla, where the human warmth of its inhabitants always united them. Many in the community worked making pillows. Santander learned this art from his neighbours when he was a teenager, and he adopted the trade to set up his own business.

Today, he has been offering his products in different towns in the department for 30 years. He visits these towns every eight days to deliver products and carry out more pre-sales work.  

Santander wants to make the most of the December season to make Christmas cushions, and he found in a loan from Kiva the opportunity to access finance through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to fund this project. This will allow him to buy fabric with Christmas motifs, thread, different kinds of sponges and other accessories. The investment will enable him to fulfil his customers´ orders and make good profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric with Christmas motifs, thread, different kinds of sponges and other accessories.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. With the previous loan, he managed to buy wood, pay labor, and hire a venue for tea planting. He is involved in a number of businesses like brick making, growing tea, and selling firewood. He started these businesses 10 years back.

He had in mind a vision of generating more income for his family, and his friends inspired him to start those businesses. However, hardships of inadequate capital, unpredictable weather changes, and the high cost of sprays, which affect his output, are limiting his dream of constructing a good house.

James is thankful to Kiva and Kiva lenders who lent him their support and allowed him to successfully develop his businesses. James needs another loan to buy firewood and pay labor for preparing the firewood.

loans.use: to buy firewood and pay labor for preparing the firewood.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and transportation as major challenges. Lucy dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Nho's Group

texts.en:
Nho, born in 1965, is a Thai ethnic woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 1994. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation. The income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and a small saved amount. Her daughter is studying at a university in the northwest of Vietnam so Nho wants to borrow a loan to pay for her daughter's education fee because the saved amount is not enough.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her daughter have a better condition for studying and that she will have good job with a good and stable income.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education fee.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2006. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the meager retirement salary of her and her husband. The income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and a small saved amount. She wants to raise pigs to sell for meat but the saved amount is not enough for her to invest in the breeding. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in the breeding with high productivity. When selling the first pig herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit. In addition, for herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Tam is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2006. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding. The annual income from selling 2 to 3 pig herds after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and a small saved amount. She wants to raise a breeding sow but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise a breeding sow.

loans.name: Rosario Elena

texts.es: Rosario es una madre soltera de tres hijos que al no contar con el apoyo de un cónyuge, tomó la determinación de buscar alternativas para generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.  Ella le pidió el favor a una amiga que vendía productos por catálogos que le permitiera vender por intermedio de su afiliación y como ella es una persona honesta y responsable su amiga aceptó.  Tiempo después Rosario comprendió que podía vincularse directamente con una empresa multinivel y acceder a los beneficios que se obtenían al cumplir con cierto tope de venta; premios, puesto que no le eran suministrados por su amiga, a pesar de que el mayor porcentaje de ventas lo lograba ella, su amiga aceptó y ella continuó su labor como una nueva consultora y le dijo que desarrollara su negocio con los clientes que ella había captado.  Rosario cuenta con 20 años de trayectoria y su lista de clientes es mucho mayor, es por ello que su capital no le es suficiente para cubrir todos los requerimientos de la clientela y encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para financiar sus pedidos de mercancías: pantalones, camisas y calzado. Esta inversión será de éxito por la creciente demanda de estos artículos a causa de las festividades decembrinas y le beneficiará en el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a single mother of three and do not have a spousal support. She was determined to find the alternatives to generate income in order to support her family. She asked a favor to a friend who sold products through catalogs. It allowed her to sell through the membership. Her friend accepted as she is honest and responsible.

Later Rosario realized that the work could be linked directly to a multilevel company and access to the benefits obtained by meeting certain sales ceiling. Since awards were not administered by her friend, despite the higher percentage of sales she had, her friend agreed for her to work as a new consultant. She told her to develop her business with the customers she had captured. Rosario has 20 years of experience and her customer list is much bigger.

Rosario does not have the sufficient capital to cover all customer requirements. Finding credikiva was the opportunity to be linked to the financial life through Foundation Mario Santo Domingo. It will enable her to finance the orders for goods including pants, shirts and shoes. This investment will help meet the growing demand for the holiday season and benefit the sales and revenue.

loans.use: to finance the orders for goods including pants, shirts and shoes

loans.name: Gimmer Orlando

texts.es:
Gimmer, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, tienen 6 años de haber formado su hogar y sus hijos aún no tienen edad para asistir a la escuela, su pareja se dedica a la venta de verduras en los alrededores de su domicilio, mientras que él se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su tío quien desde pequeño lo llevaba a realizar trabajos de campo; cuando el creció vio la necesidad de hacer algo para sobrevivir y fue así como se incorporó en este oficio y lo hizo con fondos propios.
Con el crédito pretende comprar dos cabezas de ganado para poder incrementar su inventario y obtener más ingresos para continuar teniendo estabilidad económica para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.
Los sueños de Gimmer, es poder percibir buenas ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar y además de eso pagar a tiempo su crédito.
texts.en:
Gimmer lives with his partner and two children. He and his partner set up home six years ago, and his children aren´t yet old enough to go to school. His partner makes a living selling vegetables in the vicinity of their home, while he works raising livestock and farming. He learned this trade from his uncle, who took him out to work in the countryside from a young age. When he grew up, he saw the need to do something to make a living, which is how he became a farmer using his own funds.

Gimmel plans to use the loan to buy two cows in order to increase his herd and boost his earnings, to ensure continued financial stability and fulfil his responsibilities.

Gimmer dreams of being able to make a good living to improve his family´s living conditions, and of paying his loan back on time.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase his herd and boost his earnings.

loans.name: Tham's Group

texts.en:
Tham, 21 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province. The married couple is looking forward to having their baby soon.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee field, but the saved amount is not enough to buy it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan via M7 MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family to fertilize the coffee field well and that the coming harvest will bring her family a yield of half as much again as the previous harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yeu's Group

texts.en:
Yeu, born in 1972, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her son. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover food for the family and to save a small amount. Her son is studying at a University of Agriculture and Forestry. She wants to borrow a loan to pay for his education fee because the saved amount is not enough.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan via M7 MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her son to complete his studies and that he will have a stable job with good income.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education fee

loans.name: Keyla Patricia

texts.es: Keyla de 24 años es madre de tres hijos menores de edad y bajo circunstancias difíciles de su vida sentimental, tuvo que tomar la determinación de emprender un negocio para responder por el sustento de sus hijos y su hogar.  Hace un año en medio de la separación con su pareja, quien decidió no corresponder con los gastos familiares y tampoco aportar para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, esta ama de casa, en medio de la problemática y muy angustiada por el destino de sus hijos, solicitó un préstamo de dinero a un particular para comprar alimentos con los que emprendió su vida como comerciante, los cuales ofreció a sus vecinos y familiares que conocían de su difícil situación contando con su apoyo.  En la actualidad ha logrado salir adelante con esta actividad y encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar los encargos de sus clientes entre ellos pescados, yogurt, carnes frías y pudines. Keyla desea ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y aspira a tener una casa propia para que sus hijos estén amparados.
texts.en:
Keyla, 24, is the mother of three underage children. She went through a difficult situation in her personal life, and had to make the decision of starting her own business in order to sustain her home and her children.

One year ago, during her separation (her ex partner decided not to help with the home expenses or the children's sustenance), this woman, who works as a housewife, despite her worries and problems, and concerned about her children's future, asked someone for money to buy foodstuff to sell. That is how she became a businesswoman. She sold her products to neighbors and relatives, who were aware of her situation and supported her.

She is now getting ahead thanks to this activity, and found in CrediKiva the opportunity to get to know the finance world, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and find resources to deliver her customers' orders: fish, yogurt, cold cuts, and puddings, among other things.

Keyla wants to offer her children better living conditions, and wants to have her own house so that her children can live safely.

loans.use: to be able deliver her customers' orders: fish, yogurt, cold cuts, and pudding, among other things.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 46 years old, with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Maria Teresa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maria Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben used his previous loan to buy more bulls for fattening. He is still a farmer who carries out cattle fattening, which he supplements with a retail shop, banana and coffee selling to increase his earnings.

He has been a farmer for the last ten years and works throughout the week due to the nature of his work. He started his own farm because he had worked for other people for a long time and therefore thought it right to start up his own since he had major responsibilities of educating his three school-going children.

His cattle farm has a number of animals, which look healthy. However, it would be more attractive if he was not limited by diseases that attack his animals and capital.

Lauben is requesting a loan to buy more animals for his farm. With the profit from cattle fattening, he hopes to have enough income to give his wife and the school-going children a quality education and improved standard of living. A loan would help him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals for his farm

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, de 44 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo asistir a ninguna escuela, actualmente está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos se encuentran culminando sus estudios y los otros 2 trabajan.

Juan, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió atreves de sus padres, pero aparte de eso también presta sus servicios como seguridad en un centro educativo.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos de engorde, colocar una granja, comprar vacunas y vitaminas necesarias para un mejor desarrollo y crecimiento de los pollos. 

Su principal sueño, es tener un mejor crecimiento en su proyecto de compra de pollos de engorde y de esta manera poder comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Juan, 44, could not go to school due to his difficult financial situation. He is married, and his partner works as a housewife. He has four children; two of them are finishing their studies, and two of them work.

Juan works in agriculture. He learned everything he knows from his parents, but he also works as a security guard for a school.

Juan needs the loan to buy chickens to fatten, install a pen, and buy vaccines and vitamins for the development and growth of the chickens.

His biggest dream is to expand his business in order to be able to sell his chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, install a pen, and buy vaccines and vitamins for a better development and growth of the chickens.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is thanking KIVA and its supporters and CCT for their tireless support of small business owners like her. The loans she received were a great help in growing and sustaining her ornamental and landscaping business. She trusts your continuous help with her livelihood.

Once again Evelyn would like to request a loan in the amount of Php 50000 loan to buy fertilizer, pots, nets and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamental plants. Evelyn puts her whole heart and best efforts into taking care of her plants, as they are her source of income to feed and send her children to school.

She dreams of expanding her ornamental farm to augment her income and send her children to places of higher education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pots, wires and nets for her landscaping business.

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.en:
Leonilda is a 36-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. For five years now she has been raising pigs in the Philippines.

The recipient of two previous loans from NWTF, Leonilda has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Olga Yamila

texts.es:
Olga, es una mujer muy emprendedora, comenta que con el otorgamiento del  crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo realizar la inversión en variedad de ropa, de la que obtuvo buenas ganancias y por ende pudo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Hasta el momento su grupo familiar se mantiene y las condiciones de vida ahora son más favorables gracias al apoyo brindado.
Ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de flores por la temporada que se acerca del día de difuntos, también comprara de blusas, pantalones y camisas para damas y caballeros, con esto ella busca poder darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que tendrá más que ofrecer y podrá satisfacer las necesidades de los mismos; se verá beneficiada, ya que podrá obtener buenas ganancias y continuara con estabilidad económica para ella y su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Olga is a very enterprising woman and says that the previous loan was of great help to her because it allowed her to buy a large quantity of clothing that brought her good a profit, which allowed her to improve her family’s living conditions

Now she can support her family and maintain better living conditions thanks to the support.

She is asking for a new loan so she can buy seasonal flowers for the day of the dead that is approaching. She will also buy blouses, and men’s and women’s pants and shirts so she can better serve her customers. She will have more to offer and better satisfy their needs. She will benefit because she will be able to increase her earnings and her family’s financial stability will continue.

loans.use: to buy flowers, and men's and ladies'  blouses, pants, and shirts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana es una mujer luchadora y saca adelante a su familia con su negocio, ella se dedica al negocio de vender comida, esta actividad comienza desde la mañanita preparando los recados, para luego cocinar y después vender la comida.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comparar arroz, carne y papa, para poder ampliar su negocio, su deseo es tener un local amplio donde expender su comida.
La socia está muy contenta con el préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA. Ella se compromete a pagar  puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member Juana is a hardworking woman who supports her family with her business, which is selling prepared food. Her activity starts early in the morning preparing ingredients, so she can then cook, and then sell the food. 

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, meat, and potatoes, to expand her business. Her dream is to have a large space where she can expand her food business. 

Juana is very happy with his loan and thanks the KIVA investors. She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, and potatoes.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se integró un grupo para solicitar el apoyo de VFMéxico, su nombre es Girasoles debido a que en el lugar donde se reúnen todos los integrantes abundan estas lindas flores. No obstante no es raro encontrar distintas especies de flora y fauna pues la región está muy bien resguardada por los habitantes. 
    Doña Flor es una de las integrantes más entusiastas y lo que la motiva a trabajar arduamente es su familia integrada por su esposo Raúl y sus seis hijos de los cuales tres aún viven con ella. Ella y su pareja se dedican a la elaboración de figuras artesanales desde hace más de 15 años. Anteriormente su esposo fue empleado de una persona la cual le enseñó todo lo necesario para crear sus propias artesanías, tiempo después fue capaz de comprar sus propios moldes y materiales como yeso, pinturas, gasolina y abrió su propio taller. 
  Hoy en día, mientras ella realiza los ornamentos de las piezas, él se encarga de mezclar todos los materiales hasta conseguir una consistencia suave para después moldear cada figura con una dedicación única.  Los motivos más recurrentes utilizados por Doña Flor son caballos, gallinas e imágenes religiosas. Vende en los mercados de su localidad pero también cuentan con una lista de clientes quienes les solicitan mercancía personalizada. 
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con la oportunidad del préstamo ya que podrá comprar yeso, pintura, tablas, alambrón, solventes y gasolina; “con cada inversión que hago puedo fortalecer mi negocio, además puedo comprar ropa zapatos y cubrir gastos del hogar y la educación de mis hijos” comenta. De igual modo pudo realizar mejoras a su casa y adquirir un automóvil en el cual transportar sus artesanías. La meta que tiene en mente es aumentar su número de clientes para asegurar la educación profesional de sus hijos. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Ma. Elena quien invertirá en pañales y productos de belleza; Eliberta, en pintura; María del Carmen, en papelería; Lorenza Jacoba, en tejidos; Martha, en pan y macetas; Silvia, en dulces; Maricela, en ropa interior; Edgar, en artesanías.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la comunidad, detrás de ellos se observa el barro con el cual Edgar elabora las piezas, Doña Flor es quien viste la playera negra.
texts.en:
In a community in the State of México, there is a group, which was created to request the support of VFMéxico. The group is appropriately named Girasoles (sunflowers), as where the group meets there is an abundance of beautiful flowers. However, is not unusual to find different kinds of flowers and animals and so this region is well protected by its inhabitants.
Flor is one of the most enthusiastic members and is motivated to work hard is because of her family, who is made up of her husband Raúl and their six children, three of whom live with her.
She and her husband have been working making hand-crafted figurines for more than 15 years.
Previously, her husband was employed by a person who taught him all that he needed to know to create his own handicrafts. In the time since, he has been able to buy his own moulds and materials, such as plaster, paints and gasoline and opened his own workshop.
Today, as she decorates the pieces, she also looks after mixing all the materials until they reach the smooth consistency required to afterwards mould each figure with unique dedication.
The themes most frequently used by Flor are horses, chickens and religious images. She sells them in the markets in her town and they also have a list of customers who request personalized items.
For the other side, she is very grateful for the opportunity to receive the loan. It will enable her to buy plaster, paints, tables, wire rods, solvents and gasoline.
"With each investment that I make I can strengthen my business. I can also buy shoes, clothing and cover the costs of the home and the education of my children." she comments. In the same way, she could make improvements to her home and buy a vehicle in which she can transport their handicrafts. The goal that she has in mind is to increase her number of customers, in order to secure a professional education for her children.
The other members of the group are Ma Elena, who will invest in diapers and beauty products; Eliberta, in paint; Maria del Carmen, in stationary; Lorenza Jacobs, in knitted products; Martha, in bread and flower pots; Silvia, in candies; Maricela, in underwear; and Edgar, in handicrafts.
*The photo was taken in the community, behind them one can see the mud with which Edgar makes handicrafts. Flor is the one wearing the black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy paint, plaster and gasoline tables.

loans.name: Cristo Es Vida Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Cristo es Vida” en este nuevo ciclo está conformada por 5 personas que siguen demostrando su responsabilidad y firmeza en cumplir sus objetivos, que viene siendo representada por su presidenta la Sra. Alicia de 49 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos que aun dependen de Ella. Tiene como fuente de trabajo desde hace algunos años la venta de bebidas como emoliente que ella misma prepara. Es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio comprando los insumos para preparar las bebidas y renovar los utensilios que necesita para su negocio. En la foto grupal Alicia se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeros sentados.
texts.en:
The “Cristo es Vida” communal bank is currently made up of five persons who have demonstrated their responsibility and firmness in achieving their objectives. 49-year-old Alicia is their president. She has three children who still depend on her.

She has been selling beverages, such as emollients that she prepares herself, as a source of income for a number of years. She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to prepare the beverages and replace the utensils she needs for her business. Alicia is standing in the center of the group photo and the other members are sitting.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 45-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in Kutaisi district.

Irma is unemployed and decided to start a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of USD 800.

With the received credit, Irma will purchase clothes and linens and will start her trading business. Irma will have a stable income and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes that the business will be successful and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and linens to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Rosibel

texts.es:
Sandra, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo se dedica a administrar la finca de café de la mamá de él, tiene 1 hija, la cual se encuentra culminando sus estudios en el primer grado.

Sandra, le ayuda a su esposo en la finca, porque su familia le inculco los trabajos agrícolas y a través de esta enseñanza a podido ayudarle a su esposo para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para sembrar plantas de café, para darle el mantenimiento adecuado y obtener mejores resultados y que generen buenos ingresos, para mejorar las condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.

Sandra, sueña con poder continuar sus estudios, para tener mejores oportunidades dentro de la sociedad y así mismo optar por un empleo mejor.
texts.en:
27-year-old Sandra studied until her diploma. She is married--her husband earns a living managing his mother's coffee plantation. She has one daughter, who is finishing her studies in the first grade.

Sandra helps her husband on the plantation, because her family taught her agricultural work and through this training, she has been able to help her husband cover their family's necessities.

Sandra needs the loan to plant coffee plants. This is in order to give adequate maintenance and get better results and gain good income to improve her and her family's living conditions.

Sandra dreams of being able to continue her education in order to have better opportunities in society and likewise aim for a better job.

loans.use: to plant coffee plants.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 24 years old and has two children who are in school.

Christine has a pig-raising business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Christine has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Merry Gin

texts.en:
Merry Gin is 33 years old and married, with one child to provide for.

To earn a living, she runs a retail business, selling cellphones and cellphone accessories.

Merry Gin wants to improve her family's living conditions, so she needs to increase her income. That's why she borrowed a loan to buy the latest accessories to sell.

Merry Gin's plan for the future is to expand her business, using her income.

loans.use: to buy the latest cellphone accessories, in volume.

loans.name: Río Blanco Group

texts.es:
Río Blanco es el nombre de un grupo ubicado en una de las colonias de "La novia del sol": nombrada así por los poetas locales debido a que durante todos los días del año el clima es caluroso. En tanto que el nombre del grupo hace referencia a un lugar común para todos los integrantes quienes se encuentran muy orgullosos de su origen. Dichos integrantes son: José y Leticia quienes invertirían en material para construcción; Beatriz M., cosméticos; Carlos, material de construcción y servicio de taxi; Ana, dulces; Iliana, Cynthia y Xóchitl, artículos de plata; Beatriz, postres; María T., calzado y María V., comida.
    José Concepción es conocido por todos como "Concho" y es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales 3 aún dependen económicamente de él. Motivado por sus padres, comenzó desde hace 20 años con la venta de material para construcción, sobre todo arena, grava,  ladrillo, cemento, etc., el cual almacena en grandes bodegas. "Mi padre siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad, ahora es una herencia familiar ya que queremos seguir su ejemplo" expresó con una gran sonrisa. Sin duda lo que más disfruta es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que con su labor éstos pueden cumplir sus sueños de construir casas, puentes, escuelas o cualquier necesidad de la comunidad; "espero que la actividad trascienda y perdure por muchas generaciones" agregó.
   Cada uno de los apoyos que ha recibido de VFMéxico le ha sido de utilidad pues ha enriquecido de manera gradual su actividad ya que actualmente brinda empleo a 12 personas. En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arena, relleno, piedra y 2 llantas para el camión con el que transporta el material más pesado. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la mamá de Concho donde guardan los camiones; el taxi que se observa detrás es de Daniel quien también vende material para construcción. Concho es quien viste un chaleco fosforescente.
texts.en:
The Río Blanco group is located in the community of "La novia del sol" (The Bride of the Sun), named by local poets for the fact that the climate is hot every day of the year.  The name of the group refers to a common place for all of the members who are very proud of their origins. The group is made up of: José and Leticia, construction materials, Beatriz M., cosmetics, Carlos, construction materials and taxi service, Ana, sweets, Iliana, Cynthia, and Xóchitl, silver items, Beatriz, desserts, María T., footwear, and María V., food.  

José Concepción is known by all as "Concho" and is father to 4 children, 3 of whom are still dependent on him economically.  20 years ago, his parents encouraged him to start selling construction materials, primarily sand, gravel, brick, cement, and the like, which he stores in large storerooms.  "My father dedicated his life to this business, and now it will be passed down through the family since we want to follow his example", he noted with a big smile.  Without a doubt, what he enjoys the most is fulfilling the needs of his customers, since his labor allows them to carry out their dreams of building houses, bridges, schools, or anything that the community may need.  "I hope that this business expands and endures for many generations", he added.  

Each time that he has received support from VFMéxico, it has been useful for him since he has enriched his business in a gradual manner and presently provides employment for 12 people.  This time, he will use the loan to buy sand, filler, and two tires for the truck that he uses to transport heavier materials.  

*This photo was taken in Concho's mother's courtyard where they keep the trucks.  The taxi pictured in the background belongs to Daniel, who also sells construction materials.  Concho is wearing a fluorescent vest.

loans.use: to buy sand, filler, stone, and two tires.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. She helps her husband earn a living.

Thelma is engaged in her banana production business and sells bananas in their community and at other nearby markets. It is a good business because it helps them meet their daily needs. Most of the income earned is used to finance their children's education.

Thelma wants to increase her income. That's why she has decided to take a loan again to buy fertilizer to fertilize her land.

In the future, Thelma hopes to improve their house for safe living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Eucaris María

texts.es: Eucaris es una mujer de 53 años, que desde pequeña su madre la formó para ser comerciante al darle la oportunidad de ayudarla en su negocio de venta de mercancías varias, actividad de acogió para su vida y con la que ha podido solventar a su familia. Alternamente elabora comidas rápidas, principalmente asados, una actividad que le genera un ingreso muy representativo. Ella es separada y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad y durante sus 15 años en la labor comercial, les ofreció bienestar con los frutos de su trabajo. Hoy en día su meta a futuro tener una almacén en su vivienda que le permita incrementar sus ingresos. Eucaris encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  para comprar carne de res, pechuga, cerdo e insumos que utilizará en su venta de comidas rápidas, inversión que le permitirá trabajar sin contratiempos.
texts.en:
Eucharist is a 53-year-old woman.  Since she was little, her mother brought her up to be a merchant and gave her the opportunity to help her with her business selling various merchandise, a career that she took on for her own life and one that has allowed her to support her family.  She also prepares fast food, mainly fried, a business that allows her to generate a representative income.  She is separated and has three adult children.  During her 15 years in commercial labor, she provided for their wellbeing with the fruits of her labor.  

Today, her goal for the future is to have a grocery store in her home will allow her to increase her income.  Through Kiva loans, Eucharis found the opportunity to link up with a better financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will  buy beef, brisket, pork, and ingredients that she will use in her business selling fast food, an investment that will allow her to carry out her work without setbacks.

loans.use: to buy beef, brisket, pork, and ingredients that she will use to sell fast food.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a proud Ugandan farmer living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the past 16 years, and he lives at home with his wife, children and two dependents. Not long before Godfrey started farming, he suffered a loss of wages and fell behind on his monthly bills. Godfrey’s credit took a hit that would have been small for someone who had an established credit history, but for him it was a major hit as he did not have many open lines of credit to begin with. Because they live on very little income, he tries to cut spending and bills as much as possible. He is looking to make his home more energy-efficient and cost-effective by also running a retail shop alongside working with a farmers’ company to earn extra income. Not only will he be able to make his home more energy-efficient, but he will also be able to rebuild his credit with this loan. Godfrey will use his loan to buy mulch and  fertilizers for his banana farm and more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy mulch and  fertilizers for his banana farm and more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem, a 62-year-old widow with 5 children, earns a living by farming in Koh Pdao village. Having spent almost all of her time rising 5 children, she has now reached retirement age. She wants to have a comfortable life. Currently she is still farming and helps with her children's business.

Khem has difficulty using a car battery for her home's energy. She needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of continuing to use the car battery, her children support her decision to buy a home solar power system and have promised to financially support this choice.

As a result, Khem decided to apply to Kamworks for a Kiva loan to buy a home solar energy system. She believes solar power can raise her living conditions to a comfortable level.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar power system.

location.town: Koh Pdao Village,Kampong Cham Commune,Sambo Distri

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her biggest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge. Margret dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una joven estudiante de Odontología, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Cristina tengo 29 años de edad soy la penúltima de siete hermanos, nací en una comunidad llamada Guayabal en la provincia  de Azua, allí vivía con mis padres y hermanos hasta los nueve años cuando mi madre decidió separase de mi padre. Mi madre se empleó para limpieza doméstica en una casa de familia y se esforzaba en trabajar para mantenernos, pero con su salario no daba abasto con los gastos del hogar, por ello inicié a trabajar desde muy temprana edad para ayudar a mi madre con los gastos de la casa. Actualmente resido en Guaricanos estoy casada y tengo un bebe de 4 meses.
Termine mis estudios secundarios a los 19 años, al terminar  quería cursar la carrera de odontología en la UASD, tome los exámenes de admisión y los aprobé, pero debido al alto costo de esta carrera las psicólogas de esa  universidad me recomendaron estudiar Psicología Social. Durante dos años curse los estudios según sus recomendaciones, pero mi desencanto y mi falta de pasión hacia esa área  hicieron que dejara de cursar dicha carrera.
A finales del año 2012 decidí no darme por vencida y perseguir mis sueños de estudiar odontología, por lo que me inscribí en la Universidad Federico Henríquez y Carvajal (UFHEC) y hasta el momento he cursado 18 materias. A mediados del año pasado tuve que paralizar mis estudios debido a complicaciones con mi embarazo. Al nacer mi hijo tuvo una complicación y entre los medicamentos, honorarios médicos y demás compromisos en el hogar los ingresos en  esta ya no son suficientes para poder costear mis estudios universitarios.
Tengo un compromiso conmigo misma de alcanzar mi meta, de convertirme en una odontóloga exitosa y de darle a mi hijo una infancia mejor que la que yo tuve, pero esta meta no podré lograrla sola, es por esta razón que me dirijo a FUNDAPEC / KIVA para pedirles una ayuda y yo poder completar mis estudios. Sé que con su ayuda finalmente alcanzare mi sueño.
Si FUNDAPEC / KIVA me toma en cuenta y logro convertirme en una profesional, mi objetivo es contribuir con la salud bucal de las personas de escasos recursos ofreciéndoles servicios de forma gratuita y así poder retribuir un poco la ayuda recibida.
texts.en:
Cristina is a young dental student. She is seeking a loan to be able to cover the costs of her education. This is her story: "My name is Cristina. I am 29 years old and I am the second youngest of seven siblings. I was born in a community called Guayabal in the province of Azua. I lived there with my parents and siblings until I was nine years old, when my mother decided to separate from my father.

My mother got a job cleaning a family home, and she worked hard to support us, but her salary did not cover the household expenses. This is why I started working at a very early age to help my mother cover the costs of the home. I am currently living in Guaricanos. I am married and have a four month old baby.

I completed my secondary education at 19. When I finished I wanted to study dentistry at UASD. I took the admission exams and passed them, but due to the high cost of pursuing this degree, psychologists at this university recommended that I study social psychology. Following their recommendation, I pursued these studies for two years, but I was disappointed and my lack of passion for this subject caused me to leave the program.

At the end of 2012 I decided not to give up and to follow my dreams of studying dentistry. I enrolled in the Universidad Federico Henríquez y Carvajal (UFHEC), and to date have studied 18 subjects.

The middle of last year I had to suspend my studies due to complications with my pregnancy. At birth my son had a complication, and between medications, medical expenses and other commitments at home, there is not sufficient income to cover the cost of my university studies anymore.

I have promised myself that I will reach my goal of becoming a successful dentist and giving my son a better childhood than I had, but I can not reach this goal alone. This is why I have come to FUNDAPEC / KIVA to ask for help for me to be able to finish my studies.

I know that with help I can finally reach my dream. If FUNDAPEC / KIVA will consider me and I am able to become a professional, my goal is to contribute oral health to people with few resources, offering them services free of charge, and in that way pay back a little bit of the help that I have received."

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca es común apreciar la riqueza de la tierra reflejada en los sembradíos de caña, maíz y frijol; también en los arboles de mango, naranja y limón. Para poder llegar a la comunidad se deben recorrer 3 ríos siendo el de Chichicazapa el más atractivo pues el agua está limpia y suele haber personas de la comunidad mitigando el calor y teniendo un tiempo de esparcimiento. 
   En otra comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Los Girasoles cuyos miembros se comparan con esta bella flor ya que su jornada empieza y termina con la luz del sol. Ellos son: María Del Carmen quien invertirá en un club nutricional; Andrea, comida; María Elena, ropa; María Esther, pollo; Daniel, carpintería y carnicería; Trinidad, mariscos; Viridiana, pescado; Ángel, abarrotes y Adrián, servicios de albañilería. 
   Daniel es mejor conocido como el "chalan" ya que este nombre reciben los ayudantes de algún oficio como la carpintería o la albañilería y aunque ahora ya es maestro sigue conservando el mote. Hace 5 años decidió abrir su propia carpintería para lo cual adecuó su patio trasero para poder disfrutar del clima fresco mientras trabaja. No obstante al inicio tuvo muchos retos que superar, "como comúnmente decimos aquí: apreté la panza para gastar menos y poder comprar mi herramienta" comentó orgulloso. 
   El éxito que ha cosechado le ha permitido brindar empleo a una persona más y ampliar su taller. Asimismo desde hace 4 meses, con ayuda del préstamo y las ganancias obtenidas, inició con la venta de carne de cerdo en un puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal. Entre sus planes inmediatos están el ser la carnicería más grande de la región para que de esta manera puedan generar mayores ingresos y empleos. 
    El préstamo que ha recibido le será de utilidad para la compra de 1000 pies de madera y 10 cerdos continuando así con ambas actividades.
*La fotografía fue tomada en un viejo pozo, Daniel es quien viste una playera color café.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca, it is common to appreciate the richness of the earth reflected in the plantations of sugarcane, corn, and beans, as well as the mango, orange, and lemon trees.  To arrive at their community, one must travel around three rivers, the most attractive of which is Chichicazapa, since the water is clean and you can often find people from the community taking refuge from the heat and spending some leisure time.
