In another community, a group called Los Girasoles ("The Sunflowers") was formed, whose members compare themselves to this beautiful flower since the day begins and ends with the light of the sun.  The group members are:  María Del Carmen, who will invest in a nutrition club, Andrea, food, María Elena, clothing, María Esther, chicken, Daniel, carpentry and butcher shop, Trinidad, seafood, Viridiana, fish, Ángel, groceries, and Adrián, a bricklayer.  

Daniel is better known as "el chalan", since this is the name that is given to assistants of trades such as carpentry or bricklaying, and even though he has become a master of the trade he continues to keep the nickname.  The success that he has been able to achieve has allowed his to provide employment to one other person and to expand his workshop.  Likewise, for the past 4 months, with the help of the loan and the profits that he has obtained, he started selling pork from a stall in the municipal market.  His plans for the immediate future are to be the the biggest butcher shop in the region so that he can generate a better income and more employment.  The loan that he has received will be used to buy 1,000 feet of dry cedar and 10 pigs so that he can continue along with both businesses.  

*This photo was taken in an old well.  Daniel is wearing a brown T-shirt.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 feet of dry cedar and 10 pigs.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Living in a farming community, Hay devotes himself to a generation family business in order to support his family and his two children's pursuit of higher education. As a farmer for over 20 years, he wants his children to be educated up to at least a bachelor degree. However, his family is living in a remote area without access to the power grid. As a result, he is applying for a KIVA loan to buy a high quality solar home system for his family. His children will be able to study at night time better than before. His whole family also can live in a safer environment.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Pra Huot Village, Damrei Phong Commune, Chhlong Di

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 30 años de edad, es casada con una familia de un hijo, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rosa para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica al comercio con esta actividad lleva ya 5 años de realizarlo, gracias a la amabilidad que ella posee tiene ya mucha clientela.
Rosa con el afán de mejorar su vivienda y darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hierros y así construir  su casa pues el hierro es uno de los materiales más caros  por lo que ella ya no pudo comprarlo por esa razón solicita un préstamo.
Rosa tiene el anhelo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con esta construcción que comenzará.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 30 year-old woman. She is married, and her family consists of one child. This lovely family lives in the community of Sololá.

Rosa is in business in order to earn an income and help her family get ahead. She has been doing this for 5 years already, and thanks to her pleasant nature she has many customers.

With the desire to improve her home and give her family better living conditions, she has decided to seek a loan to buy metal and build her home. Metal is one of the most expensive materials, which is why she couldn't buy it, and is seeking the loan.

Rosa has the wish to improve her family's quality of life by beginning this construction.

loans.use: to buy iron by the quintal to build her house.

loans.name: Basheer

texts.en:
Basheer is a 28-year-old, married man from Qabatiya, Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small and old house. He is the sole breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support.

Basheer has a tractor. He uses it for transportation of agriculture products. He has a maize growing business which provides him with a good income. But the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict.

Basheer has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new trailer for his tractor. He hopes that this new equipment will enable him to increase his efficiency and speed. He also hopes to eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new trailer for his tractor.

loans.name: Susana Abigail

texts.es:
Susana, es propietaria de una pequeña tienda de la canasta básica, vive en casa familiar con su esposo, actualmente no tienen hijos, su negocio está funcionando desde hace 2 años, lo abre a las siete de la mañana y lo cierra a las siete de la noche.
Invertirá en lácteos, gaseosas, golosinas, cereales, huevos, aceite, etc., de esta manera tendrá su negocio más surtido de mercadería que sus clientes necesiten, tiene la fe de tener mayores ventas e ingresos para progresar.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más competitivo y reconocido en la zona.
texts.en:
Susana is the owner of a small grocery store. She lives in a family home with her husband. They do not have any children. Her business has been active for 2 years. She opens it at seven in the morning and closes at seven at night.

She will buy dairy products, soft drinks, sweets, cereal, eggs, oil, etc. and with this have better selection of merchandise that her customers need. She expects to have greater sales and income in order to make progress.

She dreams of having a business that is more competitive and recognized in the area.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, soft drinks, sweets, cereal, eggs, oil, etc. to have her business better stocked with the merchandise that her customers need.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Belonging to a generation of farmers, Yang and husband live with their 4 children in Prey Kor Village. Continuing with their family business, they are hardworking farmers. They always get up early to both prepare their equipment for farming as well as feed their pigs. They put in all their effort in order to provide their family with better living conditions.

However, their current home power won’t allow them to achieve their goal. Using a car battery costs money and is time consuming. Yang has charge the battery every 2 or 3 days.

After Yang discovered that solar energy is the source she needs, she decided to apply to Kamworks for a Kiva loan to pay for a good quality home solar power system. She believes a home solar system can reduce her burden and help achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar energy system.

location.town: Prey Kor Village, Donrei Phong Commune, Chhlong Di

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido para llegar a la comunidad donde viven los miembros del grupo Flor de Campo se pueden observar plantaciones de caña de azúcar, fincas de café y árboles de naranja. Todo se ve favorecido gracias al clima cálido y húmedo de la región, así como al cuidado de sus habitantes quienes sienten un gran respeto por la naturaleza. El nombre de este grupo hace referencia a la libertad que experimentan sus integrantes al vivir en una comunidad rodeada de vegetación y aire fresco. Ellos son: María quien vende comida y cosméticos; Alejandro, sandalias; Juana, comida y pan; Tomasa, abarrotes y pollo; Aurora, zapatos y cosméticos; Grisel, ropa y zapatos; Arturo, artículos de papelería; Tirso, relojes y servicios de jardinería; Luciana, ropa; Raúl, refrescos y botanas y Rosa, pan.
   Doña Tomasa es una mujer emprendedora y una madre responsable de 4 hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad. No obstante, su familia sigue siendo el eje de su vida y cada día da lo mejor de sí para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Junto con su esposo Federico se ha dedicado a trabajar en la siembra de café y caña de azúcar y ésta actividad la inculcaron en sus hijos los cuales la realizan con amor y un gran respeto.
   Desde hace 6 años doña Tomasita, como le llaman de cariño, decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes ya que, por salud, no debe realizar trabajos forzados. La nueva actividad ha tenido el éxito deseado y ahora integró la venta de pollo para que así sus clientes encuentren una gran variedad de productos al precio justo; “soy feliz por el éxito que he obtenido con mis actividades y por apoyar a mi esposo a generar ingresos” expresó contenta.
   El préstamo que ha recibido lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijol, sopa, aceite, azúcar, leche, refresco y 10 pollos para aumentar las ventas de su tienda. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de doña Tomasita quien viste falda verde y blusa negra con azul.
texts.en:
On the way to the community where the members of the Flor de Campo group live, you can see sugarcane and coffee plantations and orange trees.  These crops are favorable to the hot and humid climate of the region, which also cares for the inhabitants who feel a great respect for nature.  The name of this group refers to the feeling of freedom that the members experience through living in a community surrounded by vegetation and fresh air.  The group members are: María, who sells food and cosmetics, Alejandro, sandals, Juana, food and bread, Tomasa, groceries and chicken, Aurora, shoes and cosmetics, Grisel, clothing and shoes, Arturo, stationary, Tirso, clocks and gardening service, Luciana, clothing, Raúl, soft drinks and snacks, and Rosa, bread.

Tomasa is an entrepreneurial woman and a mother who is responsible for 4 children who are now adults.  However, her family continues to be the counterpoint of her life and every day she gives her best to be able to have a better quality of life.  Together with her husband Federico, she has made a living planting coffee and sugarcane and taught the business to her children who carry out their work with love and great respect.  

Tomasita, as she is affectionately known, decided to open a grocery store 6 years ago since she it was best for her to avoid hard labor for health reasons  The new business has had the desired success and now she has incorporated chicken sales so that her customers can find a great variety of products at a fair price.  "I am happy for the success that I have had with my business and for supporting my husband by bringing in income," she happily noted.  

The loan that she has received will be used to buy rice, beans, soup, oil, sugar, milk, soft drinks, and 10 chickens to increase sales at her store.  

*This photo was taken in Tomasita's store.  She is wearing a green skirt and a black and blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soup, oil, sugar, milk, soft drinks, and 10 chickens.

loans.name: Centro Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca existen comunidades que durante la temporada de zafra o cosecha de caña permiten disfrutar del aroma único de la caña quemada. Se puede observar a los jornaleros repartidos en cuadrillas cortando y juntando montones del producto para después cargarla hasta los camiones con ayuda de máquinas especiales. Una gran mayoría de los habitantes de dichas comunidades se dedican a esta labor año con año.
   En un municipio en especial se ha formado un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Centro ya que se encuentra justo en la cabecera del mismo. Sus integrantes son: Nisha quien invertiría en la cría de ovejas; Pragedes, cuartería; Eugenia, panadería; Lorena, cosméticos y ropa; María del Carmen, cosméticos y tamales; Porfirio, tacos; Martha, carnicería y Jesika con Felipa, ropa. 
   Doña Eugenia es una mujer con mucho carisma y entusiasmo,  está casada con Jorge quien se dedica a trabajar en el campo por las mañanas y a vender pan por las tardes. Ambos son productores de caña de azúcar y durante la temporada de zafra él se dedica únicamente al campo y ella a cuidar de la panadería la cual han mantenido por 5 años. 
   El trato hacia los clientes es grato, el pan tiene una consistencia y sabor que recuerdan a los hornos de piedra, además de que si los clientes compran más de 10 piezas se llevan un atractivo descuento. Estas cualidades la han llevado a posicionarse como una de las mejores de su comunidad a pesar de la competencia. 
   Para que el producto tenga siempre la misma calidad, debe levantarse en a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la  masa, engrasar las charolas e iniciar con la elaboración de diferentes piezas de pan. Las piezas que más destacan son los polvorones, las novias, los caprichos y los ya tradicionales bolillos. 
   El préstamo que ha recibido lo invertirá en la compra de harina, huevo, manteca, levadura, sal, leche, ajonjolí y gas pues sus clientes le han solicitado pan de muerto para la celebraciones de noviembre. Finalmente comenta, “me siento plena, feliz y estoy agradecida con Dios por todo lo que me ha dado, de igual manera estoy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible alcanzar nuestros sueños”.
*La fotografía fue tomada en una de las calles del centro, doña Eugenia viste blusa color rosa y pantalon beige.
texts.en:
There are communities in Oaxaca in which one can smell that unique odor of burnt sugar cane during the sugar or cane harvest. Workers can be seen in groups cutting and gathering piles of it to later carry it to trucks with the help of special machinery. A great majority of the inhabitants of these communities perform this work year after year.

In one municipality in particular, a group has formed that goes by the name of Centro, since they are right in the middle of it. The members are: Nisha, who invests in raising sheep, Pragedes, in room rental, Eugenia, a bakery, Lorena, cosmetics and clothing, María del Carmen, cosmetics and tamales, Profirio, tacos, Martha, a meat market and Jesika and Felipa, clothing.

Doña Eugenia is a woman with a great deal of charisma and enthusiasm. She is married to Jorge, who works in the fields in the morning and sells bread in the afternoons. Both of them produce sugar cane and during the harvest season, he works only in the fields while she looks after the bakery which they have run for 5 years.

They treat their customers well. The bread is of a good consistency and flavor that makes one think of stone ovens. In addition, if customers buy more that 10 items they get an attractive discount. These things make her one of the best in her community despite the competition.

To ensure that the product is always of the same quality, she must get up at 4 in the morning to prepare the dough, grease the pans and begin to make the different kinds of bread. The most noted kinds are "polvorones, novias, caprichos" and the traditional "bolillos".

The loan that she has received will be invested in the purchase of flour, eggs, lard, yeast, salt, milk, sesame seeds and gas, since her customers have asked her for "pan de muerto" [a sweet bread baked for the Day of the Dead] for the November celebrations. She says that finally "I feel fulfilled, happy and grateful to God for all that He's given me. Likewise I am grateful to the people who have made it possible for us to reach our dreams."

* The photograph was taken on one of the downtown streets. Doña Eugenia is wearing a pink blouse and beige pants.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, lard, yeast, salt, milk, sesame seeds and gas.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Эту милую и обаятельную женщину зовут Заррина. Ей 52 года. Заррина родом из Афганистана. Но большую часть жизни прожила в Таджикистане. Заррина работает в МДО "Хумо" вот уже 7 лет. Она самая очаровательная и чуткая женщина в этой организации. 
  Заррина обратилась за кредитом, чтобы оплатить свое лечение в клинике. Она уже много лет лечится и сейчас нужно пройти повторный курс лечения. Ее собственных средств не хватает для оплаты, и она нуждается в получении займа.
texts.en:
Meet Zarrina, a kind and lovely 52-year-old woman.  Zarrina is a native of Afghanistan, but she has spent most of her life in Tajikistan.  She's been working for MDO Humo for the past seven years, and she's one of the organization's most pleasant and thoughtful employees.

Zarrina is taking a loan to pay for her medical treatment at a clinic.  She has been undergoing treatment for many years and she now needs to go through a second course of treatment.  Her personal resources are not sufficient, which is the reason why she needs to receive this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her medical treatment at a clinic.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married mother of 5 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 3 years, Mercy has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge for her business.

With her 20,000 KES loan Mercy wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, a village chief and also a farmer, lives in Popel Pork Village with her husband and 2 children. Her husband works as a government officer.

Both Thea and her husband need energy to run a bright light at night. However, the car battery they use is not reliable. It has a short lifespan and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery runs out during the night.

After getting a good recommendation from their neighbor who uses a home solar system, Thea decided to apply to Kamworks for a Kiva loan to buy their own home solar energy systems. She believes this decision will not only save on energy costs but also improve her energy source to brighten her house.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar power system.

location.town: Popel Pork Village, Kouk Banteay Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Ulmas

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Улмас. (Улмас имя символическое и переводится как «не умирай», называют детей в семье, где часто рождаются мертвые дети). Улмас замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Ее сын студент. Улмас заботится об образовании сына, и все время интересуется его учебой. 
  В доме добытчиков является ее муж. И доход мужа сейчас не может покрыть медицинские расходы его супруги. Улмасу сейчас нужно пройти обязательный курс лечения, чтобы ее здоровье не ухудшилось. Она надеется, до ухудшения не дойдет.
texts.en:
This woman's name is Ulmas. Her name has a symbolical meaning: it is translated as "Do Not Die!" Such a name is often given to a newborn in a family in which there have been stillbirths. Ulmas is married and has one son, a college student. Her son's education is a priority to Ulmas, and she takes constant interest in it. 

Her husband is the breadwinner in the family. At present, her husband's earnings are insufficient to cover her medical expenses. At present Ulmas  must undergo a course of non-elective treatment  in order to avoid a worsening of her medical condition. She hopes it won't come to that.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana con 57 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su hija, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona urbana. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Mariana se dedica a la cría-engorde y posterior comercialización de ganado vacuno,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 11 años. Adicionalmente cultiva productos de pan llevar (vitucas, yuca, menestras y otros productos), y cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, patos y cerdos) para el consumo y en ocaciones para venta. El destino del crédito será para la compra de ganado vacuno para engordarlo luego de ello sacarlo ha la venta, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Mariana es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará sola.
texts.en:
Mariana is 57 years old, a widow, and lives with her daughter in her own home made of rustic materials. She lives in the disctrict of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, departament of Cajamarca, Perú, in an urban zone. She has very good personal and work references from her neighbors. The residents of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.
Mariana has worked raising and feeding cattle for fattening and later sale for 11 years. She also grows typical produce from the area like root vegetables and cassava and raises smaller animals (chickens, guinea pigs, ducks, and pigs) for consumption and sometimes for sale.
The loan will be used to buy livestock to fatten and later sell. This will allow her to obtain a better income to improve the quality of life of her family.
Mariana is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. She will be solely responsible.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin, actualmente vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería; oficio que aprendió gracias a su padre, trabaja solo por temporadas en el campo, de lo contrario él se dedica a la comercialización de ganado.
Con el crédito Marvin invertirá en la compra de insumo agrícolas para sus cultivos de granos básicos y la diferencia la invertirla en la compra de ganado, con esto busca tener una mejor producción de sus cultivos para generar mejores ingresos económicos para él y su familia.
Marvin tiene como propósito cancelar puntual su crédito y mejorar  la situación económica de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin currently lives with his two children and his wife. He works in agriculture and raises livestock, an occupation that he learned thanks to his father. He works only seasonally in the fields, and the rest of the time raises livestock.

With the loan Marvin will invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies for his crops of basic grains, and he'll invest what is left in the purchase of livestock. With this he hopes for greater yield from his crops, in order to earn a better income for himself and his family.

Marivin's goal is to make punctual payments on his loan, and to improve his and his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his crops of basic grains, and to invest what is left in the purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis mai 2007 et il est composé de femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Soda est la responsable elle est mariée et mère e 5 enfants dont deux filles et trois garçons tous scolarisés.
Elle est debout à droite de la photo la main levée. Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de fruits saisonniers. Avec son nouveau crédit de 400 000 francs CFA elle se payer des paniers de fruits composés de pastèques oranges et et des mandarines.
Actuellement son activité marche bien car ses produits sont bien aimés par sa clientèle. Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group has been created in May 2007. It is composed of women living in the same village and maintaining good relations as friends and fellow entrepreneurs. Ms. Soda, the group's leader, is married and has five children: two daughters and three sons. All of her children are in school. Ms. Soda is standing on the right raising her hand in the photo. She works selling seasonal fruits. 

With her new loan of 400,000 West African francs Ms. Soda will stock up on baskets of fruits: watermelons, oranges, and tangerines. At present her business is going  well as her products are very popular with customers. Her revenues will allow her to pay for food, schooling, and healthcare expenses for her children as well as  bolster her savings with the bank villageois.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to resell at retail prices.

loans.name: Grupo Canasteros Group

texts.es:
Antonio es hombre de 48 años de edad, es casado con una familia muy linda con la que vive en una comunidad  del cantón Chacap.
Antoni (el segundo de derecha a izquierda de camisa  rayada) para obtener sus ingresos   y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la albañilería, con esta actividad tiene  el 20 años de realizarlo, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una variedad de legumbres.
Antonio  desde hace algún tiempo ha empezado con la construcción de su casa  y hasta ahora no ha logrado finalizar la construcción por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción de su casa, tales como: cemento, cal, arena y hierros.
Su gran sueño es mejorar su vivienda, cubrir los gastos de la casa,  para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is 48 years old, married, and has a beautiful family residing in the community of Chacap. Antonio (the second one from the right wearing a striped shirt) has been working in construction for 20 years to obtain an income and get ahead his family. To increase his income he also works in agriculture growing different vegetables.
Antonio has been working on building his house but he hasn't been able to complete it. He's requesting a loan to buy construction materials for his house ,like: cement, limestone, sand, and iron.
His greatest dream is to improve his home, cover the house expenses and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house, like: cement, limestone, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro con 37 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Genaro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivos como maíz, fréjol, yuca, rocoto ingresos adicionales que le permites solventar el crédito.

Genaro es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Genaro is 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in his own home made of rustic materials. They live in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, in Perú. He has very good personal and work references from his neighbors. The residents of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.
Genaro has been growing coffee for 4 years. The loan will be used for agricultural purposes, application and incorporation of sanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest. This will help his harvest physiologically, morphologically, and will increase productivity, in addition to having a timely harvest with increased production, better quality, which will help him sell his product easily. He also grows corn, beans, cassava, and others which allow him to generate additional income to pay back his loan.
Genaro is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa and signs with a partner.

loans.use: for agricultural purposes, application and incorporation of sanitary products, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a divorced woman and she has three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past five years, Severina has operated a fruit and coconut-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Severina wants to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Isai Abenadat

texts.es:
Isasi, vive con sus madre y su padre, por todos en la familia son tres personas, el estado civil es soltero y no tienen hijos; económicamente de él solo dependen sus padres, se dedica a la agricultura y de vez en cuando presta sus servicios de albañilería. Isasi posee este negocio desde hace 4 años, quien lo fundó el negocio fue su padre, posteriormente se lo cedió, los horarios en que atiende esta actividad es de 3:00 p.m. hasta 5:00 p.m. la ventaja de este negocio es que el 80% lo comercializa y el otro 20% es de consumo en el hogar, lo que les ayuda en gran manera para el sustento diario.
Solicita este crédito para poder realizar la compra de fertilizante, herbicida e insecticida; con esto la busca obtener una excelente cosecha, para poder vender sus productos a un precio justo y generar buenas ganancias que le ayudaran a darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
Su mayor sueño es poder diversificar su negocio, tener mejores ingresos asi como una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isai lives with his mother and father.  There is three people in the family.  His marital status is single and he has no children.  Financially, his parents are his only dependents.

He works in agriculture and occasionally he also works in masonry.  Isai has been in this business for 4 years.  His father was the one who founded this business which was later passed onto him.  

His work schedule is from 3:00 pm to 5:00 pm.  The advantage of this business is that 80% of it he can trade and the other 20% is for household consumption, which helps them greatly with their daily livelihood.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide; with this he will achieve an excellent harvest and will be able to sell his products at a fair price and generate good profits that will help him give his parents a better quality of life.

His biggest dream is to diversify his business, have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide; with this he will achieve an excellent harvest and will be able to sell his products at a fair price

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, se encuentra acompañada, vive actualmente con su hijo quien está acompañado, su negocio es la elaboración de tortillas para vender, ya tiene muchos años de experiencia, anteriormente también tenía una venta de productos de la canasta básica, pero decidió cerrarla por problemas de delincuencia, trabaja de once de la mañana a dos de la tarde, es así como puede tener a su alcance los ingresos necesarios para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Para tener mayor cantidad de producto en su negocio, está solicitando un crédito con el que comprara maíz y leña, pretende tener todo lo necesario para elaborar las tortillas y satisfacer a sus clientes, espera mantener las ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es trabajar con capital propio y tener el sustento diario para aportar en los gastos famialires.
texts.en: Teresa has a domestic companion. Currently, she lives with her son who also has a domestic partner. Her business is the production of tortillas to sell. She has already many years of experience. Before, she used to sell basic staples, but she decided to close her store because of problems with crime. She works from eleven in the morning to two in the afternoon. This is how she can have the needed income to fulfill her obligations. In order to have more amount of products in her business, she is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood in order to have all she needs to make tortillas and satisfy her customers. Her biggest dream is to work with her own capital and have daily support to help with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to have everything she needs to make tortillas and satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a woman and 29 year old now. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lisa requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies .

Lisa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Lisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa, es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, vive con dos hijos actualmente y su esposo. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos como los abonos y plaguicidas necesarios para su bien desempeño. Ella cuenta con los terrenos ya sembrados y hace varios años atrás se dedica a la producción de granos básicos por lo cual opto por solicitar el crédito. Ella tiene como meta de generar en su plantación una mejor producción y así poder generar mayores ganancias económicas para ayudar con el bienestar de su familia. Ella ya ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR varios préstamos. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa is a 52 year old entrepreneurial woman. She is married, and currently lives with two children and her husband. With the loan she is going to buy supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides necessary for a good production. She already has her fields planted. Many years ago she worked growing staple grains, and chose to seek a loan.

She has a goal of generating a greater production from her fields, to thereby be able to generate greater economic income to help with the wellbeing of her family. She has received various loans from FUDECOSUR. She has no loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR has offered her loans with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to help with her corn crops.

loans.name: Paula Patricia

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer casada de 32 años de edad, madre de dos hijos adolescente de 20 y 15 años, se dedica a la venta de alimentos, un negocio que inició por necesidad económica puesto que fue madre a muy corta edad.
Ella trabaja diariamente, principalmente en horas de la mañana vendiendo productos fritos, pero quiere crecer, tener una nueva actividad económica que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y apoyar los estudios superiores de sus hijos.
Por ello Paula quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un carro de comidas, su idea es salir los fines de semana a vender hamburguesas, chuzos, chorizos, perros calientes, arepas rellanas.
Todo este esfuerzo lo quiere hacer por el bien de sus hijos y su familia, la cliente espera tu apoyo.
texts.en:
Paula is a married, 32-year-old mother of two young children aged 20 and 15.  

She works in the food selling business.  A business that started out of economic necessity since she became a mother at a very young age.

She works daily, mainly in the morning selling fried products.  However, she would like her business to grow, to have a new economic activity that allows her to increase her income and support higher education for her children.

This is why Paula is requesting a loan:  to purchase a meals truck.  Her idea is to go out on weekends to sell hamburgers, kabobs, sausages, hot dogs, tortilla pockets.  

All these endeavors are for the sake of her children and her family.  This member hopes for your support.

loans.use: Start with a business of fast food on weekends

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 37 years old woman and mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, selling fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes etc.

Sofia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits.

Therefore Sofia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She can help her husband to purchase the above items.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy fruits for her husband to increase his business.

loans.name: Kha

texts.en:
Kha, age 57, is a married woman who has seven children, two of whom live with her. Residing in Kampong Cham province, she grows rice to make a living. In addition, she is raising pigs and working for others for a fee earning a supplemental income to her family. Pests are the challenge to rice farming business.

This is her second cycle with VisionFund. Past loans have enabled her to renovate her house and improve her living condition. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve rice yields and to buy a decent motorcycle. She hopes that her living will be much easier after purchasing a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve rice yields and a decent motorcycle to support business. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hija de 21 años y sus hijos de  15, 18 y 19 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable que en busca de satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia se dedica a la confección de sabanas y cortinas, negocio que ha administrado desde hace 15 años, esto le permite tener una cantidad bastante grande de clientes quienes solicitan de sus servicios para la elaboración de estos productos, y de esta manera logra obtener sus ingresos económicos. Es debido a esto que maría solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela e hilo para poder aumentar la producción de sabanas y cortinas, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y así también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, and lives with her life partner, her 21 year old daughter, and her sons ages 15, 18 and 19. María is a very responsible and entrepreneurial woman, who in search of meeting the basic needs of her family, works making sheets and curtains. She has run this business for 15 years. It allows her to have a rather large quantity of customers who seek her services making these products. In this way she manages to obtain economic earnings.

Because of this, María seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in fabric and thread in order to increase her production of sheets and curtain. In this manner she will obtain greater income and also will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in fabric and thread to be able to increase her production of sheets and curtains.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is the parent of 4 children. She is kind and hardworking woman. Gulnora’s husband has been busy with farming and also he is a hired worker. Gulnora 6 months ago started her business with sewing, because she needs to the source of income. She sews national women clothes.

Gulnora took part in a course “To Get Ahead” of women organization and received a certificate. She found a lot of new information for herself which will be useful for her in the future.

Gulnora is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy fabrics, for increasing her working capital of new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to increase her working capital of new business.

loans.name: Badriyeh

texts.en: Badriyeh is a married Lebanese woman. She’s 53 years old and has two children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. Today, with the fact that the new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children's education fees. The family's only target and dream is to see the children achieving well in their education.

loans.use: to pay her children's education fees.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 40 year old married woman living with her husband. She is the mother of three children, all of them are still attending school and a housewife dedicated only for to her family. Her husband works in the construction sector and represents the main income provider in order to fulfill their family needs.

But because of their difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children educational installment fees. This is the second time that she requested Kiva’s support to pay the school fees and she is very happy because she will be able to register her children with the coming school.

loans.use: to pay her children educational installment fees

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nazarina

texts.en:
Nazarina is a married woman with five children, all of whom have completed school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 37 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Linga Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Annah, a member of Linga Women Group. She is 61 years old and married and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015 to benefit from training, especially about enterprise development. She implemented the training by embracing proper record-keeping and proper utilization of the profits.

She keeps poultry. She is taking out a Kiva loan to buy more chickens and quality chicken feed. This will enable her to earn more income to meet her family's expenses such as for food and shelter.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and quality chicken feed to boost her business

loans.name: Norma Yanira

texts.es: Norma es una mujer trabajadora de 39 años de edad que se cuenta con una granja de pollos de engorde, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive junto a  sus dos hijas de 15 y 17 años de edad a las que ha sacado adelante como madre soltera, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa. Norma desea comprar materiales para reparar la granja, pero además desea invertir en más pollos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas además de materiales para mejorar la granja.
texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking 39 year old woman, who has a chicken farm for broilers, which allows her to move her family forward. She lives with her two daughters, ages 15 and 17, whom she has helped succeed as a single mother. She is very proud of this.

Norma wants to buy materials to repair her farm, but she also wants to invest in more chickens. For that reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins, in addition to materials to improve her farm.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins, in addition to materials to improve her farm.

loans.name: Zoila Elizabeth

texts.es: Zoila de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive al lado de su hija de 8 años de edad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que en busca de sacar adelante a su hija se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, este negocio lo maneja desde hace varios años y gracias a ello ahora cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes que la prefieren. Zoila en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una plancha de cocina y maíz para poder establecer un negocio de venta de tortillas. De esta forma mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos y así poder ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 49-year-old single mother and lives with her 8 year old daughter.

She is a very hardworking person, who, in order to be able to raise her daughter, has to sell beauty products by catalog.  

She has been doing this type of business for several years and as a result she currently has a fairly large number of customers that prefer her. 

Zoila is looking to improve her quality of life and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: a cooking grill and corn to establish a business selling tortillas. 

This will significantly improve her income and thus she will be better able to offer a better way of life to her daughter.

loans.use: To invest in: cooking grill and corn to establish a business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es:
Ramos es un hombre de 33 años de edad es soltero con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre  2 y 6 años, está linda familia vive en agua escondida de Sololá.
Ramos para obtener sus ingresos  y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero haciendo todo tipo de actividades que se le presente, todos los días se esfuerza de sol  a sol para que no le haga falta nada a su familia. 
Ramos con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción pues en una parte de su casa es muy necesario la construcción de un muero, ella comprara  cemento, piedrín, cal y arena.
Su mayor anhelo es terminar la construcción del muro lo más pronto posible y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ramos is a 33 year old man. He is single, and lives with his beautiful family of two children between the ages of 2 and 6. This beautiful family lives in Agua Escondida in Sololá. To make a living and move his family forward, Ramos works as a day laborer, doing whatever type of job arises. Every day he strives from sunup to sundown so that his family lacks nothing.

With the desire of improving the living conditions of his family, Ramos seeks a loan he will use to buy construction materials. In one part of the house he really needs to build a wall. He will buy cement, gravel, whitewash and sand. His greatest desire is to finish construction of the wall as soon as possible and improve his home.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as cement, gravel, whitewash, and sand.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 50 years old woman and mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession. Robina's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits.

Therefore Robina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Living in a fishing community with her husband and five children, Vannak earns a living by fishing. She wants to expand the business, starting from a small boat to a bigger and bigger boat. With the help of her husband and support from their children, she never loses hope and is willing to work hard.

She and her husband want to get up early in the morning and work late to spend more time on work; however, it is a challenge for them because their house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. They have to get up when the sun rises high enough so they can see things clearly and go home early before the road is too dark. As a result, Vannak has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a home solar system. She believes she will have enough energy for her family's usage and also improve her working hours.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar system.

location.town: Prey Kor Village, Donrei Phong Commune, Chhlong Di

loans.name: Eni

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Eni, who is 55 years old. Eni is a housewife and her husband has been a builder for ten years. She has asked for a loan of 7,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Eni will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Tajiri village. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Samaila can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Samaila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Samaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 56 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida, su hija de 17 años y dos hijos mayores de edad. Pedro es un padre responsable que para poder mantener la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de minutas, paletas y siberianos, negocio el cual maneja desde hace 22 años y gracias a ello es bien reconocido en las comunidades en las que se desplaza ofertando sus productos. Pedro vive de forma muy humilde y para poder mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, ladrillo y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una fosa séptica. De esta manera poder tener un ambiente saludable y evitar posibles enfermedades. Y gracias a un crédito que obtuvo anteriormente pudo invertir en su negocio, dando como resultado un aumento en sus ganancias.
texts.en: Pedro is 56 years old and lives with his life companion, their 17 year old daughter and two adult children. Pedro is a responsible father who sells slushies, ice pops and popsicles, a business he has had for 22 years. Thanks to this job, he is well known in the communities where he travels offering his products. Pedro lives in a humble way, and in order to improve his quality of life he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: sand, cement, bricks, and to pay for hand labor to build a septic tank. This way he can have a healthy environment and avoid possible diseases. Thanks to the loan he received previously, he was able to invest in his business, which resulted in an increase of his earnings.

loans.use: To invest in: sand, cement, bricks, and to pay for hand labor to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Raúl Sandoval Group

texts.es:
Cerca del río Tonto y rodeada por árboles y sembradíos de caña de azúcar se encuentra una localidad en donde se integró un grupo de personas trabajadoras y entusiastas. La comunidad es además rica en recursos naturales y muchos turistas aprovechan para disfrutar de su tranquilidad y belleza. Los integrantes son: Hermila quien vende comida; Gladis y Rubicela, abarrotes; Martha, ropa y comida típica; Duvan, tacos; Guadalupe, servicio mecánico; Alondra, calzado por catálogo y comida y Ana, pescado y refrescos.
   Duvan es el único hombre dentro del grupo y se siente muy contento con la amistad que ha entablado con sus compañeras. "La escuela es algo que preferí dejar, así que mejor me dedico a trabajar" comenta sonriendo ya que desde hace 2 años se ha dedicado a la venta de tacos al vapor. Dicha actividad la inició su madre hace más de 10 años y él vende todos los fines de semana mientras que de lunes a viernes se dedica a trabajar en el campo. Poder desempeñarse como taquero ha significado una gran oportunidad de crecimiento y ahora ha planeado ampliar el negocio, "vender en otra comunidad y obtener más ingresos" expresa. 
   Cada fin de semana debe preparar la carne, limpiar y colocar las mesas, refrigerar las bebidas embotelladas, comprar las tortillas, elaborar salsas y, en fin, tener todo listo para atender perfectamente a sus clientes. Las personas que han disfrutado de su servicio vuelven indiscutiblemente ya que, además del sabor de los tacos, la atención que reciben es muy especial. 
   El préstamo que ha recibido por parte de VFMéxico le será de utilidad para comprar carne, tortillas, chile, refresco, y gas continuando así con el éxito hasta ahora obtenido. "Trabajando arduamente en la taquería pronto dejaré de laborar en el campo, y  podré ayudar a  más a mi madre con ingresos para la casa" comenta finalmente.
* La fotografía fue tomada en el patio donde realizan sus reuniones, Duvan es el único hombre en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Close to the Tonto River and surrounded by trees and fields of sugar cane, one finds a town where there is a group of people who are hardworking and enthusiastic. The community is rich in natural resources and many tourists take advantage of its tranquility and beauty.
The members are Hermilla, who sells food; Gladis and Rubicela, groceries; Martha, clothing and typical foods; Duvan, tacos; Guadalupe, mechanic services; Alondra, shoes by catalogue and food; and Ana, fish and soft drinks.
Duvan is the only man among in the group and is very happy with the friendship that he has begun with his fellow group members. "School is something that I preferred to leave in order to be better able to dedicate myself to working," he comments smiling.
For two years he has worked selling steamed tacos. His mother started this business more than 10 years ago. He works selling tacos on weekends, whereas from Monday to Friday he works in the country. To be able to work making tacos has been a great opportunity to grow and now he plans to expand the business, "selling in another community and earning more revenue" he expresses.
Every weekend he must prepare the meat, clean and arrange the tables, refrigerate the bottled drinks, buy the tortillas, make salsa and finally have everything ready to perfectly serve his customers.
The people who have enjoyed his service, always come back. The flavour of the tacos, as well as the service they receive is very special.
The loan that he has received through VF México will be used to buy meat, tortillas, chili peppers, soft drinks and gas to continue with the success that he has had until now. "Working hard selling tacos, will soon allow me to leave my work in the country and I will be able to help my mother more with income for the home," he comments finally.
*The photo was taken in the yard where they hold their meetings. Duvan is the only man in the photo.

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, chili peppers, soft drinks and gas.

location.town: Colonia Raul Sandoval, San Miguel Soyaltepec

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano was born in 1979. She is married and has five children. Her husband has been busy with feeding cows. Rano also has been busy with feeding cows. She has worked in this way more than 16 years and has a great experience in this field.

Rano buys cows, feeds them for four months, and sells them in a local market. She is going to increase working capital and in this way develop the business. Rano is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is responsible mother of 3 children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because its condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance.

Samina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Samina also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in the future.
Samina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 46 years old, married with three children to provide for. Arlene personally manage a sari-sari store in their village to serve the needs of the community, while her husband busy in managing their farm land. The couple wanted to increase their income for their children's education. So she decided to take another loan at GDMPC with the amount of 20,000.00 in order to purchase goods for resale and increase her store inventory to make more sales, resulting in increased income.Arlene plans for the future is to improve their house for better living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sukaesih

texts.en:
Sukaesih is a 47-year-old, married with two sons and two daughters. Sukaesih is a housewife and her husband is a driver. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sukaesih will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is the responsible mother of 5 children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her elder son has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 7 years. He needs to do maintenance on his taxi because it is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to do this.

Therefore Nasira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Nasira's son can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nasira also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her son's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Nasira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her son's taxi.

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
Rey is 59 years old living in a wooden house in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She struggles for a living via raising pigs for a long time and she can earn additional income via working for others for a fee to improve her living.

Now, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan to support her business and this is her fifth loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loans help her to have enough consumption for her family much better than before. As a group leader, she will spend her new loan portion on buying pigs feed to support her pig-raising business. She hopes to sell those pigs for a good profit and allow her to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.use: buy pig feed to support her pig-raising business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality transportation and theft in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour,,milk, bar soap and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, milk, bar soap and wheat flour.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en:
Muhammed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muhammed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Muhammed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Muhammed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Muhammed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marleni De La Cruz

texts.es: Marleni es una mujer que a sus 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 19 años al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de 21 años de edad además vive con ellos su nieto al que quiere mucho. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de pupusas, además vende fruta que cultiva en su hogar desde hace 11 años, por lo que obtiene mejores ingresos económicos, pero con el crédito que solicito anteriormente ella logro instalar una granja de pollos en su vivienda. Marleni desea invertir en más gallinas y pollos, ya que sabe que se acerca la mejor época para la venta de pollos como es la navidad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, gallinas, concentrado y vitaminas para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marleni is a woman who, at the age of 35, has lived in her own house for 19 years, along with her life companion and their daughter, who is 21 years old. In addition, her grandson, whom she loves very much, lives with them.

She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living with her business of making and selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas with a meat or cheese filling]. In addition, for 11 years she has been selling fruit that she raises at her home, for which she obtains better economic income. But with the loan that she applied for previously, she managed to set up a chicken-raising business at her home.

Marleni wants to invest in more hens and chickens, since she knows that the best season for selling chickens, the Christmas season, is approaching. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in chickens, hens, feed concentrate, and vitamins in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, hens, feed concentrate, and vitamins to increase her sales.

loans.name: Tamador

texts.en: Tamador is a 36-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their three children who are still studying. Her husband is responsible to manage their family’s affairs and to cover their daily needs. Her husband owns a shop in his town. With the requested loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l, she would like to pay her children’s educational fees. One of her greatest dreams is to save enough money to provide her children with anything that they need

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda has been doing farming and business in order to earn a living. She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC for many years and had repaid successfully her previous loans used for her farm, as well as for her retail store. She is now recently engaged in selling fish with the help of her husband. To earn and to sell more, he took a new loan to purchase more variety of seafood like fish and prawn to sell it in town.

With her plan in improving their living, she is so positive of expanding her farm and also her business to make more money for the better future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of seafoods like fish and prawn to sell it in town

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 40 years old and he lives in the frontier village Sevkar of Tavush region. Armen has higher education and specialty of electrician, but he has been in farming since a very young age. Armen is married and he lives with his wife, two children and his retired mother. He now mainly sells poultry and gardening. He cultivates beans, greens, peppers, tomato. In his fruit garden he has apple, fig and persimmon trees. All these harvests with his farm’s poultry and eggs Armen sells right from his farm.

Armen now has some new plans connected with his farm development and he greatly hopes to realize that plans, thanks to Kiva support. This loan of 150.000 Armenian drams Armen asks as he wants to buy piglets and start swine breeding, also since near to the New Year’s holidays pork is very in demand and popular among the people.

loans.use: to buy piglets and start swine breeding.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Amadu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Amadu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Amadu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Amadu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Umar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Umar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Umar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Umar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Umar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kuweta Na Kwika Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Damaris. She is a group member of Kuweta Na Kwika Young Mothers. She is forty-one years old, married, and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. This enabled her to acquire business management skills, and she has improved in business record-keeping.

She practices mixed farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings, and hence expand her farming, especially the tree nursery business. This will enable her to earn more income to cater for her family expenses, e.g. shelter and access to better healthcare.

Damaris is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings; hence expand the tree nursery business and earn more income to pay family expenses, e.g. shelter and medical.

loans.name: Muuo Wa Tanariver S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Alice; a member of Muuo wa Tanariver SHG Group. She is fifty five years old, married and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

She does vegetables farming in a green house as her main farming activity. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy quality inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides that will consequently increase her income. with increased income, she will be able to cater for her family expenses e.g.food, medical and school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming, hence earn more income.

loans.name: Flora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 43 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de cinco hijas de las edades entre 3 y 18 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Flora para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia es comerciante desde hace 35 años, ella con mucha dedicación trabaja todos los días con el afán de que a su familia no le haga falta nada.  Flora su mayor necesidad es la terminación de la construcción de su casa pues desde hace algún tiempo han empezado con la construcción pero por la falta de recursos económicos no han logrado terminarlo por esa razón solicita un préstamo para comprar cemento, cal y arena.
Flora tiene el anhelo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, terminar la construcción de su casa y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Flora is a 43 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of five daughters between the ages of 3 and 18. This humble family lives in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.
To earn money and provide for her family, Flora has been a businesswoman for 35 years. She works with great dedication everyday with the effort to ensure that her family does not lack anything. Flora's biggest need is to finish the construction of her home. The construction was started some time ago but because of a lack of economic resources they have not been able to finish it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan, to buy cement, lime and sand.
Flora has the goal of improving her family's quality of life, finishing the construction of her house and to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, lime and sand.

loans.name: Racha

texts.en:
Racha is a 28 year old married woman. She is living with her husband and her three children, all of them are still studying. She is a housewife where she is dedicated to her home and family. Her husband is the main income provider. He owns a small mini market in his town, but his income is barely sufficient.

That’s why today, she is asking to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy the school uniforms for her children. She said that this loan will surely helped her to ensure the school year for them, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy the school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 8 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations  et sont très solidaires. Elles s’activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
FATOU  assise sur la chaise au milieu de la photo  est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 garçons et 5 filles. Elle s’active dans le commerce de patte, d’huile d’arachide et l’embouche.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 100 kilogrammes d’arachide le kilo à 300 voire 400 FCFA qu’elle va ensuite transformer en patte d’arachide et 100 autre kilogrammes transformés en huile  pour obtenir  respectivement 5 seaux de 20 kilogrammes chacun, 2 seaux de 5 kilogrammes chacun pour la patte d’arachide et 80 litres d’huile qu’elle va revendre à 900 FCFA comptant le litre et à 1 000 FCFA à crédit. Pour la transformation, elle paye 15 000 FCFA. Après extraction de l’huile elle obtient aussi  60 kilogrammes de tourteaux qu’elle va revendre à 275 FCFA le kilo. Elle compte aussi acheter 2 moutons à 50 000 FCFA l’unité et aussi de l’aliment de bétail. Avec  le reste de l’argent elle fait un autre cycle de production puisqu’elle vend à crédit la plupart du temps.
Les bénéfices serviront à épargner au niveau du banc villageois mais aussi satisfaire les besoins de sa famille surtout la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of eight members and belongs to a banc villageois launched in June 2011. It is composed of women who live in the same village and maintain ties of friendship and solidarity. Their main line of business is raising livestock. Fatou, the one seated in the middle of the photo, is the star borrower. She is 48 years old. SHe is married and the mother of nine children: four sons and five daughters. She sells peanut paste and peanut oil and also raises livestock. With her loan, Fatou will buy 100 kg [220 lbs] of peanuts at 300-400 West African francs per kg, to prepare peanut paste, and an additional 100 kg to prepare peanut oil. She will obtain five 20-kg [44-lbs] pails and two 5-kg -11-lbs] pails of the peanut paste, and 80 liters [21 gallon] of oil to resell at 900 francs per liter for an immediate cash payment and at 1000 francs on credit. She pays 15,000 francs for processing. After oil is extracted, she will also obtain 60 kg [132 lbs] of peanut meal, which she will resell at 275 francs per kg.

Fatou also plans to buy two sheep at 50,000 francs each, along with animal fodder. She will use the rest of her funds for an additional production cycle, since she sells on credit most of the time. Her revenues will help her bolster her savings with the banc villageois as well as provide for some family needs, particularly for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 200 kg of peanuts and two sheep.

loans.name: Jhon Stiven

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad el cual se dedica a la elaboración y venta de paletas de diferentes sabores, siendo la de mango biche (ver foto) el producto más vendido. 
Desde muy joven demostró gusto y vocación pro el trabajo independiente, a pesar de la falta de recursos, él siempre ha buscado la forma de trabajar y vender sus productos, un joven con gran dinamismo que en verdad quiere triunfar y trabajar por su futuro.
El cliente quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos, principalmente frutas y endulzantes, vasos, palillos, para la elaboración artesanal de sus paletas, quiere tener surtido suficiente para atender la demanda de fin de año.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 20 year old entrepreneur, who works making and selling popsicles of a variety of flavours, green mango (see photo) being the most-sold product.
Since he was very young, he showed a preference and ability to work independently. Despite a lack of resources, he has always looked for a way to work and sell products. He is a dynamic young person who really wants to succeed and work for his future.
He wants to request a loan to buy supplies, mainly fruit and sweeteners, cups and popsicle sticks for making popsicles. He wants to have enough supplies to meet the demand until the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy fruit and cups to make popsicles.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is married, and she helps her husband manage their sources of living. They earn a better income from their banana farm, aside from taking care of their fishing business. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for improving their farm and buying nets.

Recently, Anie took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy organic fertilizer for the improvement of their farm. She wants to send her children to school to have a better education and hopes that someday , her children will be successful in their careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for the improvement of their farm

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 31 años de edad, persona emprendedora, pujante y luchadora, se dedica a confeccionar a terceros, gracias a su negocio genera el dinero para el sustento de ella y sus dos niños, uno de 14 y otro de 8, claro que es muy ayudada de su pareja, juntos trabajar para progresar en familia.
