Marcela pensando en mejorar sus ventas, poder sacar mayor producción, solicita a toda la comunidad Kiva un apoyo para la compra de una máquina recubridora e insumos de confección, el principal beneficio es que mejorara enormemente sus tiempos de producción.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 31 year old woman. She is enterprising, forceful and a fighter. She works sewing for third parties and thanks to her business she generates the money for her sustenance and that of her two daughters aged 14 and 8 years old. Of course she is helped greatly by her partner, they work together to progress as a family.

Marcela is thinking of improving her sales, and be able to get better production. She is requesting help from the entire Kiva community to buy a cover stitch machine and sewing supplies. The main benefit from this is that it would improve her production time enormously.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Grupo Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia con la visión de superación tiene 37 años de edad, está feliz mente casada con su esposo con el que ha procreado a cuatro hijos de los cuales son tres mujeres y un varón, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Mercedes (la primera del lado derecho en la forografia) para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica al comercio ella tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pero también se dedica a la venta de comida en horas de la tarde para mejorar sus ingresos.
Mercedes es una madre muy buena y con el afán de darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo junto a un grupo de personas para comprar materiales de construcción tales como; cemento, cal, arena, y piedrín, esto para empezar la construcción de una casa más digna para su familia. Su mayor anhelo es terminar la construcción de su casa lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a mother who dreams of success. She is 37 and happily married to her husband. They have four children together, three daughters and a son. This lovely family lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj.

Mercedes (the first on the right in the photograph) works in sales in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She has been in this business for 25 years, but she also works selling food during the afternoon hours in order to improve her income.

Mercedes is a very good mother who wants to give her children a better quality of life. She decided to apply for a loan with a group of people in order to buy building materials such as cement, lime, sand, and gravel. This is to begin construction on a more suitable house for her family. Her greatest wish is to finish building the house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy materials for building her house such as cement, lime, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos, 52, lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and newborn grandchild in the frontier village of Getahovitin in the Tavush region of Armenia. He works as a watchman and farms as well, the latter being a good source of income and fresh produce for his family. As Sos’ son is unemployed, he farms the family’s fields as well.

Sos has applied for an 800,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon, money he greatly needs as his lovely wife is suffering from health-related problems. He will use the loan to take his wife for medical exams and tests that with hope will discover the causes of her ill health.

loans.use: to take his wife for medical exams and tests that with hope will find the causes of her ill health.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn is 27 years old and the mother of three children. She helps her husband in providing for their family by assisting on the farm picking bananas. Her husband is a farmer who works on their corn and banana farm. She and her husband want to increase their income for the children's education, so they must have good production on their farm.

Recently Anelyn successfully repaid the previous loan so she is borrowing a new loan to pay for labor for weeding on the farm. In the future she wants to save money to sustain the needs of her family and for better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor for weeding.

loans.name: Aurelio Antonio

texts.es:
Aurelio es un hombre de 60 años de edad que hoy necesita de tu ayuda pare crecer, mejorar sus ingresos, tener más ventas, un capital de trabajo el cual invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, para tener un total de 2 puestos de trabajo, un préstamo que no solo traerá beneficio y progreso para este trabajador hombre, sino que podrá generar empleo.
Aurelio piensa mucho en su familia, quiere darle lo mejor y mientras tenga salud, luchara incansablemente por llevar un alimento y calidad de vida a sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Aurelio is a 60 year old man. He needs your help today to grow, improve his income and to have greater sales. He needs working capital which he will invest in the purchase of a fast food cart to have a total of two work spaces. A loan will not only provide benefit and progress for this hard working man but it might also generate employment.

Aurelio thinks a lot about his family, he wants to provide them with the best. So while he has good health he will fight untiringly to provide food and quality of living for his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Maria Georgina

texts.es:
Buscando aumentar el número de clientes, mejorar sus ventas, tener mejores ingresos, hoy la señora María quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de uso personal y cosméticos, ella una mujer casada de 54 años de edad que debido a una incapacidad está imposibilitada a realizar varios trabajos, teniendo como único medio de ingreso su venta de mercancía, la cual realiza desde su hogar donde tiene una vitrina y ese dinero que genera es muy importante, pues completa los ingresos que lleva su esposo, y con ello pagan todos los gastos que acarrean un hogar doméstico.
Pensando en la temporada de diciembre y en  el aumento en ventas que ha tenido, hoy María busca el apoyo para comprar lociones, cremas de manos, cremas capilares, cosméticos y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Looking to increase her customer base, improve her sales and have a better income, today María wants to request a loan to buy supplies of personal use products and cosmetics. She is a 54 year old married woman, who due to a disability is unable to do various types of work.
Her only source of income is selling merchandise, which she does from her home where she has a display case. The money that she earns is very important, as it complements her husband's income and together covers all of the household expenses.
Thinking of the season of December and of the increase in sales that she has had, today María is requesting support to buy lotions, hand creams, hair creams, cosmetics and household products.

loans.use: to buy lotions, hand creams, hair creams, cosmetics and household products.

loans.name: Khayrinisso

texts.ru: Ее зовут Хайриниссо. Ей 41 год. Хайриниссо любит детей и поэтому выбрала профессию воспитательницы в детском саду. У нее своих детей трое. Старшей дочери 22 года. Сейчас ее дочь чувствует себя самым счастливым человеком в мире, потому что она выходит замуж. Хайриниссо счастлива за дочь, и готовится к ее свадьбе. По таджикским традициям, родители невесты должны купить ей приданное. Семейный бюджет не позволяет дочери купить приданное и Хайриниссо видит выход из ситуации в получении кредита. Хайриниссо надеется, что свадьба ее дочки пройдет по всем традициям и ее дочь будет самой лучшей невестой в мире.
texts.en: Khayrinisso is 41 years old.  She loves children and therefore decided to become a preschool teacher.  She also has her own three children.  Her oldest daughter, now 22, will soon feel like the happiest person on earth because she is getting married.  Khayrinisso is very happy for her daughter and she's preparing her wedding.  According to Tajik customs, the parents of the bride need to buy her a dowry.  However, because of a tight budget, the family is not in a position to buy a dowry for their daughter, so Khayrinisso feels that a loan is the only solution.  She is hoping that the wedding ceremony will happen according to all the traditions and that her daughter will be the happiest bride in the world.

loans.use: to buy a dowry for her daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
Mejorar la calidad de vida es el simple deseo que motiva la señora Clara a levantarse todos los días y trabajar, ella una mujer de 67 años de edad, separada y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias.
Este negocio es con que Clara genera su sustento, hoy esta dulce mujer, verraca, pujante y guerrera solicita tu apoyo para comprar: jeans, blusas, pantalones, camisas y camisetas.
texts.en:
Improving her quality of life is the simple desire that motivates Señora Clara to get up every day and work. She is a woman of 67 years of age, separated and the mother of two children. She sells clothing and sandals.

This business is how Clara generates her livelihood. Now this sweet woman, courageous, vibrant, and a fighter, is applying for a loan to buy jeans, blouses, pants, shirts, and t-shirts [to sell].

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, pants, shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Maria  Olga De Jesus

texts.es:
Olga es una dulce y adorable persona de 42 años de edad que se gana la vida vendiendo alimentos, los cuales prepara en una cocina que con esfuerzo ha ido adecuando (ver foto), prepara almuerzos, refrigerios, entre otros productos, gracias a su negocio y la colaboración de su esposo han salido de una crisis económica y ahora sueñan con mejores posibilidad en el futuro, su mentalidad ha cambiado, cree que es posible lograr grandes cosas, como casa, carro, la educación universitaria de sus dos hijos de 12 y 8, pensamientos que quizás en el momento no los pueda lograr pero trabajando con constancia y con la humildad que la caracteriza seguro en un futuro cumplirá.
Olga pensando en mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes y extender sus servicios a otros sectores, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de alimentos, carnes, arroz, plátano, aceite, frutas, verduras y demás productos, también comprara surtido de licores, tales como ron, aguardiente, cerveza, entre otros.
texts.en:
Olga is a sweet and adorable person, and is 42 years old. She earns a living selling food which she prepares in a kitchen that she has gone about putting together with much effort (see the photo). She prepares lunches, snacks, and other products.

Thanks to her business and the support of her husband, they have gotten over a financial crisis, and now dream of greater possibilities in the future. Her mentality has changed, and she believes that it is possible to achieve great things such as a house, a car, and a college education for her children ages 12 and 8. Dreams that perhaps she cannot achieve at this moment, but by working consistently and with the humility that characterizes her, surely she will achieve it in the future.

Olga wants to improve her sales, increase her customers, and expand her services to other areas. She wants to request a loan to buy a supply of foods, meats, rice, bananas, oil, fruits, vegetables and other products. She will also buy a supply of liqueur such as rum, firewater [vodka], beer, and others.

loans.use: to buy a supply of foods, meats, rice, bananas, oil, fruits, vegetables and other products, and also to buy a supply of liqueur.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre casado tiene 41 años de edad, trabaja como mecánico desde hace veintinueve años de edad. Esta a cargo de su mama por que hace años enviudo. Se encuentra preocupado debido a que su mama perdió la vista del ojo izquierdo, ella ha sido tratada en diferentes clínicas sin ningún resultado y al contrario ha empeorado. La cirugía que necesita es muy costosa  y de momento no cuenta con los recursos suficientes, gasto sus ahorros en los tratamientos anteriores.
texts.en: He is 41 years old, married, and has worked as a mechanic since the age of 29.  He is responsible for his mother because she was widowed a few years ago. He is concerned, due to the fact that his mother lost the vision in her left eye. She has been been treated at various hospitals with no results, and instead her condition has gotten worse. The surgery she needs is very costly, and at the moment he does not have sufficient resources to pay for it, as he spent his savings on the earlier treatments.

loans.use: to obtain eye treatment

loans.name: Mame Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en Septembre 2013 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  

Madame Mame Arame (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et  mère de 04 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter des tissus teintés, des chaussures et à vendre des sandwichs la nuit pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 25 tissus teintés, 10paires de chaussures et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de ses sandwich.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created in September 2013 during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois.  It is made up of women who, for the most part,  have acquired a good deal of experience in small retail business (their main activity).

Mame Arame (seated at the far right of the photo and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower.  She is married, 48 years old, and the mother of four children.  She buys dyed fabrics and shoes, and she also sells sandwiches at night on a retail basis in her own neighborhood.

Thanks to this new loan, she will be able to buy 25 units of dyed fabrics, 10 pairs of shoes and some condiments for the preparation of sandwiches.

She will use her profits to pay for her children's education and to help her husband take care of the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 25 units of dyed fabrics, 10 pairs of shoes and some condiments to prepare and sell sandwiches.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is an active, divorced entrepreneur living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She lives with her two children and also takes care of her parents.

She used her previous loan to buy more coffee, beans, millet, and other items for sale. She works in commerce, operating a retail shop, and has eight years of experience in the field. She has a small bar located to the side of her house. She also works at buying and selling produce like maize, coffee, and beans.

She dreams of buying land and building her own residential house and also educating her two children, but her capital is not enough and some of her customers do not pay on time.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business buying merchandise like maize floor, soap, and sugar to sell in her shop. In this way she can gain a significant profit to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying merchandise like maize flour, soap, and sugar to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
Santo Domingo es una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, en este sector se une la sierra y la costa, existe mucho intercambio comercial por el hecho de ser el puente terrestre.  Aquí vive  Gloria una señora de 40 años, habita junto a su hija que estudia actualmente.
Gloria es una señora muy trabajadora, le ha tocado sacar adelante a sus hijas, ahora solo vive con una; ella trabaja en una casa haciendo los quehaceres domésticos y por las tardes se dedica a la venta  de productos naturales, gracias a estos ingresos ella ha podido salir adelante, darles el alimento a sus hijas y el estudio.
Gloria acude a la Fundación por un pequeño crédito, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de más productos naturales para seguir incrementando y fortaleciendo su negocio, porque gracias a estos ingresos puede llevar el alimento a su hogar.
Agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación por permitir que pequeños microempresarios puedan fortalecer sus negocios y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo is a very commercial and productive city. In this region, the mountains and the coast are united. Here there is much commercial interchange because the area serves as the land bridge between the two. Here resides Gloria, a 40 year-old woman who lives with her daughter who is still studying.

Gloria is a hard-working mother who has taken the responsibility of advancing her daughters. Now she lives with just one. Mornings, Gloria works at home taking care of the requirements of the house, then in the afternoons, she sells natural products. Thanks to her income from these efforts, she has been able to get ahead, providing food for her daughters and paying for their schooling.

Gloria has approached the Foundation for a small loan to be invested in the purchase of additional natural products. She wishes to continue expanding and fortifying her business, since thanks to this income, she can continue to provide the necessary food for her household.

Thanks to Kiva and the Foundation for permitting small entrepreneurs like Gloria to fortify their businesses and to continue advancing.

loans.use: purchase more products and expand her business in order to provide food for her family.

loans.name: Marleny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marleny es persona sonriente, una madre cabeza de familia trabajadora, tiene dos hijos adolescentes, a sus 59 años se dedica a la venta de alimentos, actividad que inicio por necesidad económica ya que es una mujer viuda.
A pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha tenido que atravesar la señora Marleny, ha sabido salir adelante, trabajando con humildad, honestidad y perseverancia, dicho negocio representa el 100% de ingresos con los cuales paga servicios públicos, comida, y todos los imprevisto que resultan en una casa familiar.,
La cliente en el tiempo que lleva trabajando se ha preocupado por la sostenibilidad de su negocio, pero cree que es tiempo de hacer una apuesta por el crecimiento, por ello solicita un préstamo para aumentar el inventario en su negocio, permitiéndole producir mayor cantidad de alimentos (principalmente productos fritos; pasteles, palos de queso, buñuelos, papas rellenas entre otros), también comprara refrescos y una parte para reparar la carpa de su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Marleny is a smiling person, a hard-working mother who is the head of the family. She has two adolescent children. At the age of 59, she sells food, an activity that she began out of economic need, since she is a widow.

In spite of the difficult situations that she has had to go through, Señora Marleny has known how to get ahead, working with humility, honesty, and perseverance. This business represents 100% of the income with which she pays for public services, food, and all the unexpected expenses that arise in a family household.

This client, in the time that she has been working, has worried about the sustainability of her business but she believes that it is time to make a commitment to its growth. For this reason she is applying for a loan to increase the inventory in her business, allowing her to produce a greater quantity of foods (principally fried products, pastries, cheese sticks, buñuelos [fried dough balls], and filled potatoes, among other items). She will also buy soft drinks and use part [of the loan] to repair the awning of her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fried products. She will also buy soft drinks and repair the awning.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 35-year-old hardworking, married entrepreneur, with three children aged 11, 4, and 2, of whom two attend school. He also has the responsibility of looking after four other dependents.

He deals in the selling of fresh foods like pineapples, cabbages, eggs, maize flour, and beans in Kamwenge, Uganda, and requested a Kiva loan through Hofokam Limited to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell, like pineapples and cabbages.

He actively earns supplementary income through other business ventures like produce, charcoal buying and selling, and also a retail shop. Patrick dreams that one day he will be able to save enough to provide a protected future for his family; however, he is challenged by the high rate of defaulters.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods like pineapples and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is a 36-year-old woman who dreams of an improvement in her life. She wants a stable business in the future, a business that can help her raise her two daughters; they are 14 and 7 years old. She raised them alone, that is why she needs to work harder for them to have better lives in the future.

Currently, Jhona buys and sells crab to the community of Carles, Iloilo. She has been doing this proficiently for ten years for their sustainability. Thus, she is in need of an amount to buy crabs to sell and fish meal for the fish pond. Probably, she has been running a fish pond.

loans.use: to buy crabs and fish meal.

loans.name: Monica Marcela

texts.es:
Ella es Mónica una joven de 24 años de edad que se dedica a prestar servicios de peluquería a domicilio, actividad que inicio pro gusto y vocación.
Mónica es madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, quien también trabaja y ambos aportan dinero para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
El sueño de Mónica es tener su propio salón de belleza, un sueño del cual tu puedes ser participe, prestando un capital de dinero el cual la cliente usara para la compra de un lava-cabezas y sillas de peluquería y adecuar un local, pintura, muebles y lo necesario para arrancar lo más pronto posible.
Para Mónica este apoyo será muy importante, no solo por el hecho de tener su propio salón de belleza, sino por estar cerca de su hijo, tener la posibilidad de generar mejores ingresos, con los cuales piensa pagar la educación de su muchacho, mejorar su calidad de vida, su hogar e ir invirtiendo en un futuro en adecuaciones a su local.
texts.en:
Monica is 24 years old and provides hairdressing services at home. She started this work because she enjoys it and to earn a living.

Monica is a mother of a 3 years old son and lives with her domestic partner. He also works and both provide money to maintain their household.

Monica's dream is to have her own salon. She requests a loan to buy hair washers and salon chairs. Also to prepare the location with painting, furniture and everything that’s needed to start as soon as possible.

For Monica this support will be very important, not just to have her own salon, but to be close to her son. She will be able to generate better income which will pay for her son’s education, improve their quality of life and their home, and invest in the future.

loans.use: to have her own salon

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old and married with two children to provide for in Kamwenge, Uganda. For three years he has been earning an income selling natural food supplements, a business he was able to enter into by continually putting away money from his monthly salary. His challenge is fluctuations in customer demand which can result in his stock going bad and losing value.

Emmanuel has applied for a 1,000,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner HOFOKAM to buy more natural food supplements to sell. He wishes to expand his business and so plans to keep good records of all his business transactions. Through his business he dreams of improving his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy more natural food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Bente's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé en Septembre 2013 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  

Madame Bente (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est célibataire, âgée de 27  ans et  02 filles en charge. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des chaussures, sacs de l’huile de palmes et d’autres produits cosmétiques pour femmes. 

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs à main, 10 paires de chaussures, 03 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme et divers  produits cosmétiques pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de renforcer son activité et de s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in September 2013 during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois.  It is made up of women who, for the most part, have acquired a good deal of experience in small retail business, which happens to be their main activity.

Bente (seated at the far right in the photo and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower.  She is single, 27 years old, and she has two young girls under her care.  She buys and sells shoes, handbags, bags of palm oil, and other cosmetics for women.

Thanks to this new loan, she will be able to buy 15 handbags, 10 pairs of shoes, three 20-liter bottles of palm oil, and various cosmetics.  She will resell her goods on a retail basis, in her neighborhood.

She will use her profits to boost her small business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 15 handbags, 10 pairs of shoes, three bottles of palm oil, and various cosmetics for resale, on a retail basis, in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Sayniso

texts.en: Sayniso is an industrious woman. She is married and has three children. Sayniso has a medical education. She graduated Medical College in the Pharmacy unit. Sayniso now is going to start her own business with a pharmacy. She took part in a course “To Get Ahead” from a women's organization and got a certificate. She will secure a building and sell different kind of medicines. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy medicines for organizing a pharmacy business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for organizing a pharmacy business.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 41 years old and he lives in the frontier village Vazashen of Tavush region. Suren is married and he has school-aged children. His wife works at the school.

Suren in his own car gives taxi services and before he also managed cargo transfers. Simultaneously he is farming and he has a nice, not very large, farm, where he takes care of cows, pigs, and chickens.

Suren is also engaged in agriculture and he cultivates beans, potatoes, cucumbers, and tomatoes. He has the nicest orchard in the village, smartly cared for and very clean, with apple, nut, mulberry, and persimmon trees in it.

All his farm products (milk, macun, meat, vegetables, and fruits) Suren sells at the city’s wholesale market. This loan of 500,000 AMD (Armenian drams) Suren plans to use for the purchase of several piglets, developing his swine breeding, and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several piglets, developing his swine breeding, and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Johnmary

texts.en:
Johnmary is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more produce to sell, like coffee, millet and maize. He is 40 years old with four children, ages 16, 14, 12, and 8 years old who all attend school. He also looks after his aged mother. He deals in the buying and selling of produce like maize, beans and coffee, although he also earns extra income for his family from a salon business and hiring out decoration items like plastic chairs. With this, he gets money to cater for his family and give it the best standard of living. He wishes to expand his business into bigger markets and educate all his children, but is limited by inadequate capital.

Johnmary is requesting a loan to buy more maize, beans and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell, like coffee, millet and maize.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo has been working since he was young, growing pigs by helping his father. Currently as a married and providing parent, he has a piggery and it helps to earn a living. His family always helps him with the work, and, in this way, Rodolfo generates the income to support the family

He needs capital to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets to expand his swine production. For this, he took a loan from GDMPC, for he had been a member for years.

Rodolfo dreams of making some home improvements to provide a comfortable living with his family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets to expand his swine production.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, he can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Aminu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Aminu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia muy querido por sus amistades, tiene 59 años de edad, es casado vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Juan trabaja como comerciante en la plaza de su comunidad, lleva 20 años de ser comerciante, pero también es jornalero se dedica a cualquier tipo de labor que se le presente, esto con el fin de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.
Juan tiene el afán de finalizar la construcción de su casa pero para lograrlo se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de algunos materiales que hacen falta tales como; cemento, hierro y piedrín. Su mayor anhelo es terminar la construcción de su casa para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor hogar.
texts.en:
Juan is a father who is beloved by his friends. He is 59 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in a community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

Juan works as a trader in the community plaza. He has spent 20 years as a trader. He is also a laborer and engages in any type of work that presents itself. This is in order to get more income and get his family ahead.

Juan wants to complete the construction of his house. Juan requests a loan to buy materials such as cement, iron and gravel. His greatest wish is to finish building the house to provide his family a better home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and transportation as her major challenges.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.en:
Zilola is a careful mother of three children. Her husband Abduhamidbobo is a farmer. She lives with her family in a village and that’s why she has a good opportunity to develop the business of farming.

She has been occupied with the farming business. She has some land where she grows different kinds of vegetables. She has worked in this field for more than 16 years.

Zilola likes to work in the land and gets profit from this business. She is going to do new sowing in the autumn season, and, with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 9,000 TJS (Somoni) to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and seeds for the new sowing season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and seeds for the new sowing season

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan Guillermo es un hombre de 38 años de edad, felizmente casado, se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado porcino actividad que realiza por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y con la cual puede llevar el pan diario a su mesa.
El negocio lo aprendió de su padre y quiere que ese negocio que ha transcendido de familia en familia sea el artificie de todos sus sueños, como lo es comprar vivienda y lo más importante consolidar un hogar firme para traer hijos al mundo, quiere crear un ambiente de oportunidades, uno donde sus pequeños no pasen necesidades, por ello trabaja con tanto esmero en su negocio.
Pensando en la temporada alta de venta de cerdos, el cliente busca un apoyo económico, el cual usara en la compra de alimento de engorde, vitaminas y cerdos, su principal objetivo es sacar el máximo provecho de la temporada.
texts.en:
Juan Guillermo is 38 years old and happily married.

His occupation is raising and selling pigs. This is an activity he enjoys and which he does because he has an affinity for working independently and it allows him to put bread on the table. He learned the business from his father and he wants that business, which has been handed down from family to family, to be the foundation for all his dreams. They include buying a house, and most importantly, to establish a solid homestead to bring children into the world. He wants to create an atmosphere of opportunity; one where his little ones will not suffer any hardships. This is why he works so diligently at his business.

Thinking ahead to the busy season for pig sales, the client seeks financial assistance which he will use to buy feed for fattening, vitamins, and pigs. His main goal is to take as much advantage as he can of the season.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and pigs.

loans.name: Los Encantos Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Los Encantos Corazón de Jesús” formada hace algunos años y que ahora está conformada por 6 mujeres emprendedoras, representada por su presidenta la Sra. Sonia de 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 aun depende de Ella. Tiene como negocio una bodega en casa donde ofrece todo tipo de bebidas y alimentos, adicionalmente realiza el trabajo de manualidades como pulseras y demás adornos para luego venderlos al público. De esta manera Sonia apoya a su esposo en los ingresos del hogar para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo lo invertirá en surtir de más productos su bodega como diferentes bebidas, arroz, papa, azúcar, etc. Ella tiene pensado seguir trabajando arduamente para apoyar a su hijo en los estudios y que sea todo un profesional. En la foto grupal Sonia se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
This Community Bank “Los Encantos Corazón de Jesús” was formed some years back and at present is made up of 6 enterprising women, represented by their president, Sonia. She is 42 years old, married and has four children although only one of them is still dependent on her.

She has as a business a small store in her home where she offers all sorts of beverages and foods. She also creates handicrafts like bracelets and other adornments to sell to the public. In this way Sonia helps her husband bring income to the home to have a better quality of life.

The loan will be invested in inventory of more products for her little store, like various beverages, rice, potatoes, sugar, etc. She plans to keep working hard to support her son in his studies so he can be a professional. In the group photo Sonia is the one standing, among the rest of her seated companions.

loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, potatoes and sugar.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL LAS MARIAS AGRADECE ESTA CONFORMADA POR NUEVE MIEMBROS SEIS MUJERES Y TRES HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES CON DIES HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTORES DE LECHE, QUESO, CREMA ETC. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA BRINDARLES A SUS FAMILIAS, UN FUTURO MEJORA, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO ESTUDIARON POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD, PARA AYUDAR CON LOS BIENES DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES FANNY Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA DE SGUNDA MANO COMO : PANTALONES, SHORES, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, BLUSAS, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PACAS DE ROPA DE BUENA CALIDAD PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. LAS MARIAS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN  A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The community association Las Marías consists of nine members, six women and three men. They are good mothers and fathers, responsible for ten children between them. They are from El Sauce (The Willow), a location characterized by its producers of milk, cheese, and cream, etc. Presently they are striving to provide for their families and for a better future. Lamentably, they themselves did not study for lack of financial resources and because they saw the need to begin working at an early age in order to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her desire to succeed, the coordinator of this group is Fanny. Her business is the sale of second-hand clothing, including pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, blouses, bed clothes, and children’s clothes, etc. She dedicates 10 hours a day to this business, selling her products, so that in the not-too-distant future she may earn a better income. Her objective for the loan is to invest in the purchase of high quality bales of clothing to satisfy her customers’ demand. Las Marías is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people of limited means and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Sreth

texts.en: Sreth and his wife own a small grocery shop and have four dependent children. He needs to stand in the shop the whole day and consume a lot of energy to run his business till night time; however, the car battery is not reliable. Sometimes the battery runs out without notice. He has no choice but to stay in pitch black for one day until morning, which disturbs not only his lifestyle but also his business. Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system for his business’s energy usage and also his family usage. With a solar home system, he doesn’t have to be concerned about a sudden loss of power anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prey Kor Village, Donrei Phong Commune, Chhlong Di

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 28-year-old single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Ayman has a stall for selling fruit and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Ayman took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new goods of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new goods of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан примерный отец четверых детей верный муж. Хасан в жизни жалеет только об одной вещи, которую в свое время не смог завершить. Хасан жалеет, что не получил образование. И эту ошибку он не позволит допустить своим детям. Он старается, чтобы его дети всегда успевали в учебе. На данный момент Сын Хасана Парвиз учится на платной основе в Государственном Национальном Университете. Необходимо оплатить очередной год обучения Парвиза, но семейный бюджет не позволяет этого сделать. Хасан обратился за кредитом, с надеждой решить эту проблему.
texts.en: Hasan is a devoted husband and the exemplary father of four children.  He regrets only one thing in life, the very one thing he was never able to accomplish.  Hasan regrets that he never got an education.  As he doesn't want to repeat this mistake with his children, he makes sure that his children always have the time to study.  At the moment, Hasan's son, Parviz, is a paying student at the State National University.  Tuition needs to be paid for another year, but the family is on a tight budget and cannot afford this payment.  Hasan has therefore requested a loan to solve this problem.

loans.use: to pay for his son's studies at the university.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el posee desde hace mas de 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their five children. For 10 years he has had a small store located in his home. He has many customers, especially people who live in the neighborhood. With the earnings he gets, he manages to pay for some of his household expenses.

He is applying for another loan, so that he can buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc. and in this way have a better income and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Fitriati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Fitriati, who is 32 years old. Fitriati has been selling bags for five years and her husband has been a teacher for seven years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Fitiriati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdullahi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abdullahi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inobatkhon

texts.ru: Инобатхон 64 летняя жительница маленького района с названием Бохтар. Инобатхон живет одна с внучкой. Внучке 19 лет. Доход в семью в основном приносит только Инобатхон, она шьет и продает национальную одежду. В работе, конечно ей помогает внучка. Инобатхон решила купить больше ткани и для этого обращается за заемными средствами. Она хочет передать свое мастерство внучке и надеется, что она унаследует ее талант.
texts.en: Inobatkhon is 64 years old and a resident of a small district in Tajikistan, the Bohtar district.  She lives alone with her 19-year-old grand-daughter.  For the most part Inobatkhon is the only one bringing an income home; she makes a living by sewing and selling traditional outfits.  Her grand-daughter naturally helps her with her work.  Inobatkhon has decided to buy more fabrics and for this reason she is taking a loan.  She wants to transmit her trade to her granddaughter and hopes that she will inherit her own talent.

loans.use: to buy some fabrics.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 37-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and is blessed with two daughters. The oldest child is a teenage girl while the youngest is four years old.

To earn a living, Arlene is engaged in raffia weaving and she uses “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) leaves to do this. Her husband drives their tricycle to support and provide for the needs of their family.

In the future, Arlene wants to improve their business and have a sustainable means for making a living for their children. She is requesting a loan to buy “buri” leaves which she uses for weaving. She also needs an amount for tricycle repair, and to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy "buri" leaves for weaving, pay for tricycle repair, and pay school fees.

loans.name: Oula

texts.en: Oula is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one child. She has worked as a private teacher since 2003. She equipped a room in her house with all the needed details in order to receive her students. She likes her occupation so much because she likes to help children. To better advance her profession, today she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop so as to facilitate her work. In the future, she wishes to receive more students.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking single man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a business of roasting and selling goat meat, which he operates eight hours a day, and has been doing this work since 2010. He started this work with the hope of earning an income for his family.

Stephen faces the challenges of unpredictable weather changes that hinder growth in his profits. However, he is looking at employing many people to sell the meat in other areas, and in the end his profits will increase. Stephen has asked for a loan to help him buy goats for roasting to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats for roasting to sell

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is from Hovtashen village in the Shirak region, where she lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children.

The family's main occupation is farming. They keep livestock: cows, calves, sheep, hens, pigs and piglets. They also cultivate wheat, potatoes, beet and greens to sell in the market. Each family member has their own task on the farm, and they work effectively and hard to gather income for their living expenses.

Satik has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock, cover transportation costs of the forage to the farm, and prepare the farm for the winter season. Without this loan, the family will hardly be able to sustain the farm in the coming cold season.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her farm's livestock, cover transportation costs of the forage to the farm, and prepare the farm for the winter season.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Gidan Bawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hauwa no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hauwa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eko Puji.a

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Eko, who is a 35-year-old with one son and daughter. Eko has been selling clothes for two years and her husband has been an employee for three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,600,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Eko will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 41-year-old married man with seven children aged between one and sixteen, living in Kagadi Uganda. He deals in retail, selling general merchandise, which he has done since 2004 in order to generate income and satisfy his family demands. He also does farming to supplement his income. Steven describes himself as hardworking and hopes to educate his children to university level. He intends to use this loan to buy sodas, beers, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers, soap, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Dallami

texts.en:
Dallami is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dallami has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dallami would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dallami can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dallami will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Dallami is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Abdulhamid is a maize farmer from Kiru village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulhamid is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulhamid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Abdulhamid can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdulhamid no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Abdulhamid hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rahila is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rahila will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Rahila now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members. She would like to use this additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Haruna is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.
Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash for food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Haruna can store his maize at harvest and sell it later for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Haruna has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Haruna is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment on his farm to members of his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Getahovit is a very cute and nice frontier village in the Tavush region where Armen lives with his wife and two children. Armen’s daughter is a student and his son is still school-aged.

Armen is a farmer and he also makes cargo transfers by order on his own truck. Armen’s farm is at the top of a small hill and his nice orchard is full of various fruit trees (apple, pear, peach, persimmon, nut, fig and mulberry) which can be seen from afar. He also has bulls, pigs and chickens on his farm. The sale of pork, beef, and eggs, together with fruit sales, makes up his family income which is far from being enough for all their needs.

Armen is asking for this loan as he must buy fodder for his farm animals for the winter period, and he also wants to buy two more bulls for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals for the winter period, and to buy two more bulls for his farm.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a kind woman. She comes from North Tajikistan. Gulchehra is married and has four children. Her husband is a builder.

As his income is small, Gulchehra decided to start a new business dealing with feeding cows. With the aim to start the business she took part in a course, “Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead,” from a women's organization.

Gulchehra will buy cows, feed them for some months, and sell them in a local market. She will manage with her business alone.

Gulchehra plans to build a cow shed in the future. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cows to organize this new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows to organize a new business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 61-year-old married woman, living with her family in Gana-an, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte.

To make a living, she helps her husband with working on their own banana and coconut farm. They also plant other crops like corn and vegetables. She makes more income from this activity.

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2011 and recently took out a loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm.

Lolita is hopeful enough to have a better and comfortable living with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer  in order to improve her farm

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit ended her first Kiva loan, and now she is unbelievably happy that she has a chance for her second partnership with Kiva lenders.

Anahit lives with her husband in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. Their daughters are married and live with their families. Anahit now again has some health problems, which for some period seemed to have disappeared. But lately, she again feels unhealthy and weak.

Anahit asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) in order to undergo a course of treatment, with great hopes of finally solving her health problems.

loans.use: to undergo a course of treatment, with great hopes of finally solving her health problems.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya is the responsible mother of 2 children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. He needs to make maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi.

Therefore Ruqiya has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Ruqiya's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Ruqiya also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Ruqiya is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the taxi of her husband.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a wife and a mother to two adult children. She lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Evelyn make curtains and runs a Sari-sari (general) store business in her area. A business that she started three years ago. This business allows Evelyn to make the most of her time since her husband is away working in another country.

Evelyn plans to use her loan to buy cloth, soft drinks, sachet, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits. Through the loan, she can make her planned expansions possible and make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy cloth, soft drinks, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food and biscuits.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is a 60-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has three adult children. She does a living by selling banana fruit to the community. She has been doing this for 30 years and hoping to have more successful years to come for their sustainability.  Aside from selling fruits, she also sells firewood. With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP13000 to buy banana fruit and firewood as well. She hopes that through this, she may be able to improve her earnings and enhance her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy banana fruit and firewood

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, married to Catherine, and supports five members of his family. He runs a motorcycle business in the Chepkumia location served by VFK, Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the past three years.

From this business, Joseph gets a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has borrowed a loan of KES 48,600, which he will use to service his motorcycle and purchase motorbike spareparts. With the anticipated profits, he will pay his children’s school fees and make loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been operating her farm with the help of her husband for more many years earning well for the family. Having a passion for meeting the family's needs, Susan especially lends more effort to providing for the needs of her children. She had to work hard with determination to have a better income to provide their children with a better education than they had.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for improving their farm. To have more produce, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional organic fertilizer to be use for improving her farm.

 In the future, Susan hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer to be used for improving her farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and transportation in her major challenge.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer from Nabai village. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when he can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dauda no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Dauda hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kholmo

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной улыбкой Холмо. Она жительница города Куляб. Она 41 летняя мать. Холмо разведена с мужем, и много лет она воспитывает сына одна. Холмо живет вместе с отцом и матерью. Ее сын учится в средней школе. Холмо дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она 7 лет кроить и шьет. Холмо хочет поменять швейную машинку, по причине, что ее нынешняя машинка устарела. Из-за нехватки денег Холмо просит кредит. Холмо заранее выражает  свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Meet Kholmo, a woman with a beautiful smile.  Kholmo is a resident of the city of Kulob.  She is a 41-year-old mother.  Kholmo is divorced from her husband and she's been raising her son on her own for many years.  She lives with her father and mother.  Her son is in secondary school.

Kholmo makes a living sewing women's clothes from home.  She's been designing and sewing clothes for the past seven years.  She now wants to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is old.  She doesn't have enough money, so she's taking a loan.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman of 63. She and her husband who is a farmer lives in Duero, Bohol. Together, they were able to raise six children together who are now all adults. 

She earns a living by raising hogs, attending to her fish pond and buying rice harvests from farmers and selling it to the market. Editha is asking a loan to buy hog feed and more rice from farmers to maximize her income. 

Editha dreams of helping her children specially in raising her grandchildren. In the future, she hope to increase her business profits and to come up with ways to make further expansions.

loans.use: to buy feed and more rice

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie helps her husband working in their own farm for many years and earns well for the family. She has been taking loans from GDMPC and had successfully repaid its previous loan used for buying organic fertilizer. She is an enthusiastic woman who wants to provide good living condition to her family.

With this, she is taking a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer and seedlings for garden expansion. She always finds ways to improve the farm to gain more returns. In the future, Merlie hopes to improve the farm and wants to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer and seedlings for garden expansion

location.town: La Esperanza, Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with six children all of whom are grown ups .She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. .Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a farming business for the past three years planting and selling farm products at the market .She mentioned transportation and seasonality as a major challenge in her business. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business.She decided to join Yehu to boost her business and also improve her living standards .

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Faith operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. In addition she also operates a salon business that earns her another source of income .

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en:
An experienced farmer from Goris town, Karlen lives there with his wife, who is his support and muse. For more than eight years, Karlen has specialized in keeping livestock. He currently keeps two calves, two piglets, hens, and 35 colonies of bees.

On nearby arable land, Karlen also cultivates haricot and potatoes, as well as growing walnuts and pear trees. Karlen specializes in honey production and sales. The main family income comes from that part of the business, and Karlen wants to develop it.

He is asking for this loan to purchase 23 colonies of bees, 15 bees, and forage for feeding his livestock, so he can get more honey to sell to customers. He hopes to receive lenders' support and faith and develop his agribusiness, so that his wife will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 23 colonies of bees, 15 bees, and forage for feeding his livestock, so he can get more honey to sell to customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity but has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.In addition she also operates a grocery selling business that earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of perishability in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, milk ,maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, milk ,maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Halima has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Halima would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Halima can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Halima will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Halima is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education..

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alh. Amadu

texts.en:
Alh. Amadu is a maize farmer from Iyawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Amadu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Amadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alh. Amadu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alh. Amadu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alh. Amadu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Lawal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Lawal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Lawal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 47-year-old mother of two, residing at Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte with her family. To make a living, her husband manages their farm while she helps him, raising vegetables in their garden.

Dina has been a member of GDMPC since 2013 and has taken out previous loans for various purposes. She is taking out a new loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. She plans to improve the farm and to expand her vegetable garden to cater to market demand for vegetables. She wants to improve the general living standards of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is married, and a mother of five helping her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She has been doing this for more than ten years earning well for the family.  As a member of GDMPC, she had taking loans for this business and had repaid it successfully. She took a new loan recently to use as additional capital to buy a fishing boat. She plans to renovate their house and wants to buy a big fishing boat to be use for fishing in order to have more income for the family's better future.

loans.use: to use as financial assistance to repair their  fishing boat

loans.name: Anatolius

texts.en: Anatolius is a Ugandan male aged 27 years living in Kagadi Uganda, single but intends to marry soon. He owns an internet cafe, and does computer training and selling computer accessories in Kagadi, a business he started in order to earn a living. His dream is to build a permanent house and get married. He requests a loan to buy computer accessories for reselling.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories for selling.

loans.name: Gunorahon

texts.ru: Гунорахон, 46 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гунорахон, на сегодняшний день у нее есть корова. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,66 ГА земли, где она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Гунорахон составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS). Гунорахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки минеральных удобрений и сбор экологически чистого урожая. Гунорахон намерена и дальше постепенно развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Gunorahon is 46 years old, married, and has a son. She has secondary education, and she works in field husbandry and animal husbandry as the main source of income for her family. Thanks to the persistence, purposefulness and hard work of Gunorahon, today she has a cow, and also a land plot of 0.66 hectares on which she cultivates corn. Gunorahon's monthly income is about 6,000 som (KGS). 

Gunorahon has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy mineral fertilisers and harvest environmentally-friendly crops. Gunorahon intends to further develop her business gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to harvest eco-friendly products

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.ru: Шарипа, 20 лет, замужем, детей пока нет. У Шарипы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Шарипы на сегодняшний день имеется 5 овец и 0,56 Га земли, где Шарипа выращивает кукурузу и помидоры для реализации. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на сбор экологически чистого урожая и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Шарипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sharipa is 20 years old, married, and has no children yet. Sharila has secondary education, and she works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the main source of income for her family. Thanks to her persistent hard work, today on Sharipa's farm there are five sheep, and 0.56 hectares of land on which she cultivates corn and tomatoes for sale. 

She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) in order to cultivate her land and harvest eco-friendly crops. Sharipa plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further improvement of her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and harvest eco-friendly corn and tomatoes

loans.name: Stevin

texts.en: Stevin is married with children. He operates a retail shop of cosmetics. He also practices farming as side income. By running these two businesses, he is able to provide for his family's needs. After all the struggles, he desires to construct a beautiful residential house which will be a testament to his hard work, given the fact that he has been in business for all this time. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like cement and concrete to construct his residential house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and concrete to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 48 años de edad, viuda, tiene hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de jugos.
