Ella es constante, independiente y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Bolivar’ caracterizada principalmente por la recepción de inmigrantes del resto del país, mayormente recién llegados de las áreas rurales quienes buscan una oportunidad en la ciudad. 
Francisca es de tez morena, cabello largo trenzado y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su hija mayor que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de jugos como malta con huevo, licuado de plátano, zumo de zanahoria y otros, “la malta con huevo es una trago popular del campo y milagrosa cura para la resaca, según cuentan...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no necesita mucho capital para funcionar, la desventaja es que se encuentra al aire libre. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea refaccionar un cuarto de su casa para habilitarlo como cafetería  y vender masitas y otros alimentos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para refaccionar un cuarto para atender su negocio bajo techo.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 48 years old woman, widow, she has independent children, and her business consists in selling juices.

She is tenacious, independent and very entrepreneurial. She has her business in the "Villa Bolivar" area, which is mainly characterised by the reception of immigrants from the rest of the country, who come largely from rural areas looking for a opportunity in the city.

Francisca has dark skin, long braided hair and short length. Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her oldest daughter who is working. They live in their own house which is built with adobe and a corrugated roof. It has electricity, but no drinking water and sewage.

Her business consists in selling juices such as malt with egg, banana shake, carrot juice and others. "Malt with egg is a popular drink in the rural areas and miraculous for the hangover, according to what people say..." she comments.

The advantage of her business is that not much capital is needed to run it. The disadvantage is that it is located outdoors. Her dream is to grow her business, she wants to refurbish a room in her house to convert it into a coffee room and to sell pastries and other food. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution, which has been in operation for 20 years.

These are the reasons why Francisca is requesting a loan to refurbish a room to run her business indoors.

loans.use: to refurbish a room to run her business indoors.

loans.name: Paula Ismenia

texts.es: Paula es una apasionada por las ventas que desde siempre le ha gustado comercializar distintos artículos, sin embargo formalizó esta actividad hace apenas dos años con el apoyo de su padre quien le tendió la mano para que lograra ofertar mucha más variedad y artículos de mayor costo; prendas de vestir, calzado, enseres para el hogar y electrodomésticos.  Ella es madre de tres hijos menores de edad y reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio de Soledad municipio del Atlántico donde se consolida la gran mayoría de sus clientes.  Ella planifica muy bien su tiempo para no interferir en sus roles y así poder cumplir a cabalidad cada uno de ellos, esto es lo que más ama de su trabajo.  Como se acerca la temporada decembrina, sus clientes le han solicitado encargos de mercancías, pero su capital no es lo suficientemente amplio para poder responder a la demanda, es por ello que solicitó un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar jeans, blusas, vestidos y accesorios, inversión que le permitirá incrementar su surtido y responder oportunamente a los requerimientos de sus clientes. A futuro Paula desea instalar una miscelánea y continuar apoyado a su familia.
texts.en:
Paula is passionate about sales. She has always liked marketing different items, although regularized this occupation just two years ago with the support of her father who held out his hand to her so she could offer much more variety and more expensive items; clothing, footwear, and household goods and appliances.

She is a mother of three children who are minors and lives with her husband in a neighborhood of Soledad, a municipality of the Atlantic, where the vast majority of her customers are consolidated. She plans her time very well so as not to interfere with her roles and thus be able to fully comply with each of them; this is what she loves the most about her job.

As the holiday season is approaching, her customers have requested her orders for goods, but her capital is not large enough to be able to meet the demands. It is why she requested a Kiva loan, the first loan she makes to the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] to buy jeans, blouses, dresses, and accessories, an investment that will allow her to increase her stock and timely meet her customers' requirements. In the future, Paula wishes to open a general store and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, dresses, and accessories to increase her stock and timely meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and is married. He lives with his spouse and his children in the district of Kamwenge, Uganda. He works in retail and also practices agriculture at his home, and has ten years experience in the field.

Moses runs his small shop in his house to avoid the expenditure of renting. He started the retail business from the small savings of his garden yields. He was inspired by the responsibility of looking after his family and educating his children, since gardening was seasonal and could give him less yields. Moses dreams of expanding his retail business into a wholesale one and having all his children educated to higher levels.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise like sodas, biscuits, balloons, etc. to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sodas, biscuits, balloons, etc. to sell this festive season.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ezekiel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ezekiel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ezekiel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ezekiel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Waziri village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when he can obtain the best price, up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cesar Roberto

texts.es: Cesar es un joven universitario de 20 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el séptimo ciclo de su carrera de Administración. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque para el es muy importante el espíritu emprendedor, capaz de participar en la creación, gestión de empresas que satisfagan de manera óptima las necesidades de la sociedad. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a un tan solo un año y medio de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 20-year-old university student. He is currently in the seventh semester of his studies in Business Administration. He decided to study this major because, for him, the entrepreneurial spirit is very important. He wants to be capable of participating in the creation and management of businesses that fill the needs of society in an optimal way. In addition to being a hardworking student, he also enjoys playing soccer with his friends in his free time.

He requested this loan to be able to pay for his tuition. He has only one and a half years left before completing his degree. He is grateful to the people who can help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the university.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 35-year-old entrepreneur from West Irbid, and a caring mother of two children. Her husband is working in the army ‎with a low income, and therefore she decided to help him in the household expenses and opened a grocery to increase her ‎income. She pays for her family's daily expenses and their educational needs.

But there’s a lean season for her business, and it was also the new season in the school. Sanaa wants to recover some losses ‎and gain a better profit. She will use the loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned food, chips, candy, ‎etc.

In due time, she hopes that her business will work well and improve life conditions for her family. Sanaa will ‎do her best to success in her business and help her husband.‎

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned food, chips, candy, ‎etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and transportation as major challenges in her business.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en:
Istifanus is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Istifanus is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Istifanus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Istifanus can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Istifanus is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC used for buying fertilizer for her farm. She earns well from this. As a mother of three, she had to improve her farm to gain more produce.

She recently took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer, such as manure, to boost her farm. In the future, Mary Jean wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, such as manure, to boost her farm.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, from Sepac Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, has been engaged in selling goods in her retail store to make a living. With this business, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC and used it for purchasing additional products to sell. She has successfully repaid it.

Aside from this, she has a farm, their main source of income. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer to boost her banana farm. She wants to have a better living with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to boost her banana farm.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a Ugandan man, age 29 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married and has two children, age 6 and 3 years.

He deals in produce buying and selling to earn a daily income and also earns from farming, serving the rural people plus retail trading.

His dream is to expand his business and make it more stable. He faces a challenge of bad roads, especially during the rainy seasons when the roads are impassable.

He wants a loan to buy beans and maize for selling. Noah is grateful to Kiva for the support given to him that enabled him buy maize flour, sugar and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.name: Gloria Irles

texts.es:
Gloria una mujer catalogada por sus hijos como heroína, luchadora incansable, cabeza de familia, una mujer alegre, que ama a sus dos hijos de 17 y 4 años de edad más que a su propia vida.
Gloria se  dedica a la venta de alimento como lo son las comidas rápidas y productos fritos, una actividad con la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, el cual inicio por necesidad económica.
Aprendió empíricamente, ahora trabaja por cumplir sus dos metas que son: la primera pagar la educación de sus muchachos, la segunda es comprar una vivienda propia, pero son sueños a largos plazo, también busca constituir un local comercial y ser la vendedora de alimentos más reconocida de su sector.
Gloria quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para atender a la demanda de fin de año puesto que en Colombia los estudiantes están próximos a salir a vacaciones, por ello el dinero del monto será para la compra en cantidades de carne, panes, productos congelados, salchichas, refrescos, vegetales, frutas, papas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman described by her children as a heroine, a tireless fighter, the head of the family, a happy woman, who loves her two children, ages 17 and 4, more than her own life.

Gloria works selling food such as fast food and fried products, work with which she generates the necessary income to support her household, which she began from economic necessity.

She learned on her own and now works to achieve her two goals, which are: the first is to pay for her children's education, the second is to purchase her own house, but they are long-term goals, she also wants to establish a retail space and be the most well-known food saleswoman in her area.

Gloria wants to ask for a loan to meet the demand at the end of the year since, in Colombia, the students are about to leave on vacation. So, this amount of money will be to purchase quantities of meat, bread, frozen products, sausages, soft drinks, vegetables, fruit, and potatoes, among other products.

loans.use: to purchase quantities of meat, bread, frozen products, sausages, soft drinks, vegetables, fruit, and potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 64 años de edad, una persona que lleva una vida tranquila, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores, vive con su marido y se dedica a atender un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.
Ella es una persona tranquila que trabaja por mantener su vida tal y como está, no tiene riquezas, pero es feliz con lo poco que tiene, agradece por tener un techo, una comida, un negocio y se esmera mucho por generar los ingresos necesarios para que nada de eso cambie.
María actualmente presenta un preocupación, la fuerte competencia que hay en el sector, este inconveniente le ha hecho mermar las ventas, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar un surtido completo de productos de la canasta familiar, lo que trata de hacer es captar la atención de un mayor número de clientes, pues tendrá un surtido variado para ofertar.
texts.en:
María is a 64-year-old woman, a person who has a peaceful life, she has 4 adult children, lives with her husband and works running a grocery store.

She is a peaceful person who works to maintain her life as it is, she is not rich, but she is happy with the little that she has. She is grateful for having a roof, food, a business and she strives hard to generate the income necessary so that none of this changes.

María currently is worried by the strong competition that there is in the sector. This inconvenience has reduced her sales, so she wants to ask for a loan to purchase a complete assortment of products for the family pantry. What she is trying to do is to attract the attention of a larger number of customers, since she will have a varied assortment to offer.

loans.use: to purchase complete assortment of items for the family pantry.

loans.name: Ndrec

texts.en:
Ndrec needed to do some very simple improvements to his family home and he did not have all the money for it. Hence, he borrowed from others and now he must pay them back. Some acquaintances referred him to VisionFund so that he could get a loan to pay the debts.

Ndrec is in his late 60s and a father also. He is a retiree and his wife is also. They live on their very little retirement pensions. His is $112 a month and hers is $109 a month.

Ndrec served about 30 years in prison because of the political beliefs of his father, who was killed by the government under the communist era. "I grew up in prison and never thought that someday I will see the daylight, but finally the day came with the collapse of the regime. But I was conditioned very different from others when I came out, and this was something to deal with, especially in the first years. Luckily though, despite all of that, I was able to start a family," said Ndrec in the interview.

loans.use: to repay money he borrowed for home improvements.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Amadu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Amadu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Amadu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Amadu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, a mother of three, resides at Magsaysay Baliangao, Misamis Occidental with her family.

She helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2013 and recently took a new loan to purchase seedlings and gardening materials to expand her garden.

They have a plan to buy additional land to expand their farm to gain more farm produce for a better income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and gardening materials to expand her garden.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She is married and she lives with her husband, three sons and her daughter-in-law. Karine’s only elder son is employed and helps his mother to sustain their family needs. Karine works as a cleaner.

She is very worried of her husband health state, since he feels weak and unhealthy and because of that gave up working. This loan of 1.400.000 Armenian drams Karine hopes very much to receive as her husband must pass very proper medical exams to find out his health problems and this loan will give her chance make all the repayments.

loans.use: 's husband pass medical exams to find out his health problems and make all the repayments

loans.name: Mileidys Dayana

texts.es: Mileydys de 18 años es una humilde joven, soñadora y capaz, que se incorporó en el comercio de artículos de uso personal y caramelos, mucho antes de cumplir su mayoría de edad, apoyada por una prima que le permitió vender por intermedio de su afiliación, ella lleva un año en esta labor con la que ha podido costearse parte de sus estudios profesionales en Psicología y sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de clase y amigos de otras facultades.  A futuro se proyecta ejerciendo su profesión y con un negocio más próspero, es por ello que buscó la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar los encargos de sus clientes: cajas de chocolates, galletas,  bombones, accesorios, maquillajes, cremas corporales y fragancias, y con las utilidades ir ahorrando un porcentaje para tener un capital de trabajo que responda oportunamente a los requerimientos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
18-year-old Mileydys is a humble, idealist and capable young woman who started working in the business of personal product and candy sales long before coming of age, with the help of a cousin who enabled her to sell using her membership. 

She has been working in this way for a year and it has allowed her to cover part of her professional studies in Psychology. Most of her clients are her classmates and friends from other colleges. 

In the future she imagines herself practicing her profession and with a more prosperous business, which is why she has sought the opportunity to formally engage in a financial life with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and so be able to fill her clients' orders: chocolate boxes, cookies, bonbons, accessories, makeup, body lotions and perfumes.

With the profits she expects to save a percentage that will allow her to have a working capital and be able to respond quickly to her clients' needs.

loans.use: to fill her clients' orders: chocolate boxes, cookies, bonbons, accessories, makeup, body lotions and perfumes.

loans.name: Celena María

texts.es: Celena es una madre amorosa de un niño de 12 años y en compañía de su cónyuge habitan en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella se vinculó al comercio motivada por una prima que le recomendó ejercer esta profesión, la cual le permitía continuar con su rol de madre y cónyuge sin ningún inconveniente y que por el contrario podía darle un giro positivo a la economía de su hogar. Muy llena de buenas energías y expectativas ingresó al negocio contando con óptimos resultados, hoy en día lleva un año y su meta a futuro es abrir un almacén de ropa.  Debido a la temporada que se aproxima, Celena solicitó un credikiva, oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  para invertir en nuevas tendencias de accesorios y prendas de vestir que exhibirá a su clientela con muy buenas perspectivas de venta.  Celena anhela que su hijo tenga una excelente educación académica que le permita desarrollarse en la profesión de su agrado.
texts.en: Celena is a loving mother of a 12-year-old son and, with her spouse, lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Baranquilla. She became involved in sales motivated by a cousin who recommended that she work in this profession, which allowed her to continue in her role as mother and spouse without any inconvenience and, to the contrary, she could give a positive turn to the household economy. Very full of good energy and expectations, she entered the business having the optimum results. These days, she has been at it for a year, and her goal for the future is to open a clothing store. Due to the approaching season, Celena asked for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to be linked to the financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the new trends in accessories and clothing that she will show her customers with very good sales prospects. Celena wishes for her son to have an excellent academic education which allows him to develop in the profession of his choosing.

loans.use: to invest in the new trends in accessories and clothing.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Agnes operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market, where she sells to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.
